original: mnyam du 'jig cing 'byung ba yin //🔽zhes bya ba'o //🔽theg pa chen po nyid las gzhi blangs pa ni /
analyzed: mnyam du 'jig cing 'byung ba yin // zhes bya ba'o // theg pa chen po nyid las gzhi blangs pa ni /
translated: They arise and perish together.🔽The basis of the objection that the Mahayana is not the word of the Buddha is

original: theg pa chen po ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin zhes spong ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin zhes spong ba'o //
translated: the Mahayana is not the word of the Buddha.

original: nyes pa skye ba'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: nyes pa skye ba'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of the cause of the arising of the fault is

original: de ci'i phyir zhes rgol ba la /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhes rgol ba la /
translated: why is that?

original: lan ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The answer is all the tathagatas.

original: rgyu spangs pas 'bras bu bcom pa yin pas na /
analyzed: rgyu spangs pas 'bras bu bcom pa yin pas na /
translated: Since the result is destroyed by abandoning the cause,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la gnod pa byas pa pas byang chub sems dpa' la gnod pa byas pa nyes pa che bar mi 'thad pas ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la gnod pa byas pa pas byang chub sems dpa' la gnod pa byas pa nyes pa che bar mi 'thad pas ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is not tenable that the fault of harming a bodhisattva is greater than the fault of harming a tathagata.

original: theg pa chen po dag ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po dag ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin te /
translated: The denial is the Mahayana is not the word of the Buddha.

original: mdo sde la mi 'jug cing 'dul ba la mi snang ste chos nyid dang 'gal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas na skur ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde la mi 'jug cing 'dul ba la mi snang ste chos nyid dang 'gal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas na skur ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: It is not included in the sutras, it does not appear in the vinaya and it contradicts reality.

original: mi 'khor bar byed cing sun 'byin pas na spong ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'khor bar byed cing sun 'byin pas na spong ba'o //
translated: It is abandonment because it causes one to turn away from and to be disgusted with cyclic existence.

original: gang zag la skur ba 'debs pa ji ltar spong zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag la skur ba 'debs pa ji ltar spong zhe na /
translated: How does one abandon the denial of the person?

original: chos gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is not a different object, etc.

original: chos dang gang zag tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos dang gang zag tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not different from the person.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling zhes bya ba ni shing gi bye brag las ming btags pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling zhes bya ba ni shing gi bye brag las ming btags pa ste /
translated: The term Jambudvipa is a name designated from a particular tree.

original: dpag tshad drug stong phyed dang bzhi'i nang du chung ba'i gling gi ming ngo //🔽ci 'dra yang rung ba ni tshul khrims te so sor 'chal pa la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dpag tshad drug stong phyed dang bzhi'i nang du chung ba'i gling gi ming ngo // ci 'dra yang rung ba ni tshul khrims te so sor 'chal pa la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the name of a small continent within the area of four and a half yojanas.🔽Any kind of morality is morality, even if it is violated.

original: so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba yin no ;
analyzed: so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba yin no ;
translated: The meaning is that it is the morality of an ordinary person.

original: / dpe 'di dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor gyi bsam pa la dgongs nas tha dad du bstan gyi rtogs pa'i bye brag gis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: / dpe 'di dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor gyi bsam pa la dgongs nas tha dad du bstan gyi rtogs pa'i bye brag gis ni ma yin te /
translated: The Lord taught these similes with the intention of the disciples' attitudes, not with the intention of the distinctions of realization.

original: thams cad las dang po pa kho na la yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad las dang po pa kho na la yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: All of them are for the beginner.

original: nyes pa 'di dag byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa dang 'brel bar ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa 'di dag byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa dang 'brel bar ci mngon zhe na /
translated: How is it known that these faults are connected with the bodhisattva vow?

original: 'phags pa byams pa seng ge sgra'i mdo las kyang zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa seng ge sgra'i mdo las kyang zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is stated in the noble Siṃhanāda-sūtra.

original: las dang po pa yin par ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: las dang po pa yin par ci mngon zhe na /
translated: How is it known that he is a beginner?

original: gal te des thams cad mkhyen pa yongs su mi gtong zhe na zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: gal te des thams cad mkhyen pa yongs su mi gtong zhe na zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: Because it says, “If he does not abandon omniscience. ”

original: nyon mongs pa dag ni sna tshogs pa ma yin nam ci'i phyir zhe sdang khong nas rma 'byung zhing smas par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dag ni sna tshogs pa ma yin nam ci'i phyir zhe sdang khong nas rma 'byung zhing smas par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But aren’t the afflictions various? Why does he say that he is wounded and injured by hatred?

original: byang @249b chub sems dpa' dag ni zhe sdang kho nas lhung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: byang @249b chub sems dpa' dag ni zhe sdang kho nas lhung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because bodhisattvas fall by hatred alone.

original: lhag mas ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: lhag mas ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Not by the others.

original: des gzhan yongs su gtong bar 'gyur la btang na tshul khrims 'chal zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des gzhan yongs su gtong bar 'gyur la btang na tshul khrims 'chal zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because by the others he would abandon others, and if he abandons them, he would have broken his morality and would have cut off the wholesome roots.

original: 'dod chags dag ni de la ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dag ni de la ma yin te /
translated: But he is not like that with regard to desire.

original: gzhan sdud par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan sdud par 'gyur la /
translated: Because by desire he would attract others.

original: des na byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba ni gzhan yongs su sdud pas mchog go //
analyzed: des na byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba ni gzhan yongs su sdud pas mchog go //
translated: Thus, the activity of the bodhisattva is supreme because it benefits others.🔽Also, a scripture declares:🔽The downfall of a bodhisattva arises from hatred.🔽And:

original: lung las kyang byang chub sems dpa'i ltung ba ni zhe sdang las 'byung ngo zhes pa dang / yang byang chub sems dpa'i ltung ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: lung las kyang byang chub sems dpa'i ltung ba ni zhe sdang las 'byung ngo zhes pa dang / yang byang chub sems dpa'i ltung ba ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two downfalls for a bodhisattva:🔽from hatred and from delusion.

original: zhe sdang dang / gti mug go zhes 'byung ba yang byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang / gti mug go zhes 'byung ba yang byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa ni /
translated: A bodhisattva who is skilled in means is not afraid of hatred,🔽but one who is not skilled in means is afraid of the downfall of attachment.

original: zhe sdang gis 'jigs la thabs mi mkhas pa ni 'dod chags kyi ltung bas 'jigs so zhes 'byung bas zhe sdang kho na rma 'byin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhe sdang gis 'jigs la thabs mi mkhas pa ni 'dod chags kyi ltung bas 'jigs so zhes 'byung bas zhe sdang kho na rma 'byin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Thus, it is taught that hatred alone is a wound.

original: 'jam dpal rnam par rol pa'i mdo las kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal rnam par rol pa'i mdo las kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Manjusri Vikurvana Sutra also says:

original: 'o na de ltar khong khro bas dge ba'i rtsa ba zad pa ji lta bu dpe ston cig ce na /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar khong khro bas dge ba'i rtsa ba zad pa ji lta bu dpe ston cig ce na /
translated: Well then, how can the roots of virtue be exhausted by anger?

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos smra ba rab tu dga' ba'i dbang po la byang chub sems dpa' rgyal ba'i blo gros ma dad cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos smra ba rab tu dga' ba'i dbang po la byang chub sems dpa' rgyal ba'i blo gros ma dad cing /
translated: The bodhisattva Jayamati had no faith in the bodhisattva Dharmodgata,

original: khong khro ba bskyed pas sems can dmyal ba chen por ltung bar gyur cing zhes 'byung ba dang / sdong po bkod pa las kyang de dag phan tshun brnyas pa'i sems kyi nyes pas tshe dang 'od dang kha dog las nyams par gyur to zhes 'byung bas ;
analyzed: khong khro ba bskyed pas sems can dmyal ba chen por ltung bar gyur cing zhes 'byung ba dang / sdong po bkod pa las kyang de dag phan tshun brnyas pa'i sems kyi nyes pas tshe dang 'od dang kha dog las nyams par gyur to zhes 'byung bas ;
translated: and “because of anger, they fall into the great hells.”🔽And the Gaṇḍavyūha Sūtra says, “They lost their life force, their light, and their complexion because of the fault of despising each other.”

original: khong khro ba dang brnyas pa dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba zad pa'i rgyur gsal bas de bstan pa ni zla ba sgron ma las kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khong khro ba dang brnyas pa dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba zad pa'i rgyur gsal bas de bstan pa ni zla ba sgron ma las kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: So, since anger and contempt are clearly the cause of the exhaustion of the roots of virtue, the Candrapradīpa Sūtra says, “Therefore, you should not despise even a beginner bodhisattva.”

original: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba dag ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba dag ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Here, the roots of virtue are of three kinds:

original: sbyin pa las byung ba dang / tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa las byung ba dang / tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'o //
translated: those that come from generosity, those that come from morality, and those that come from meditation.

original: de la sbyin pa las byung ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa las byung ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those that come from generosity are of two kinds:

original: phan 'dogs pa dang / yon tan gyi zhing las byung ba ni sbyin pa dang sangs rgyas mchod pa'o //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa dang / yon tan gyi zhing las byung ba ni sbyin pa dang sangs rgyas mchod pa'o //
translated: those that come from helping others and those that come from the field of virtues. Those that come from helping others are generosity and worshiping the Buddha.

original: la la dag ni sbyin par byed mi nus pas longs spyod la chags na de'i gnyen po sangs rgyas mchod pa yin pas na sbyin dang sangs rgyas mchod pa zhes smos so zhe'o //
analyzed: la la dag ni sbyin par byed mi nus pas longs spyod la chags na de'i gnyen po sangs rgyas mchod pa yin pas na sbyin dang sangs rgyas mchod pa zhes smos so zhe'o //
translated: Some say that since one is unable to give when one is attached to wealth, the antidote to that is worship of the Buddha, and so it is called “giving and worship of the Buddha.”

original: tshul khrims ni tshul khrims las byung ba'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni tshul khrims las byung ba'o //
translated: Morality is the source of morality.

original: thos pa la sogs pa ni bsgom pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: thos pa la sogs pa ni bsgom pa las byung ba ste /
translated: Learning and so on are the source of meditation.

original: thos pa'i don sgom par byed pa ni lus dang sems 'du 'dzi dang rnam par rtog pa las dben par bya bas na /
analyzed: thos pa'i don sgom par byed pa ni lus dang sems 'du 'dzi dang rnam par rtog pa las dben par bya bas na /
translated: Since one meditates on the meaning of what one has learned, one should be secluded in body and mind from busyness and discursive thought,

original: dgon gnas smos so //
analyzed: dgon gnas smos so //
translated: and so one is said to live in the forest.

original: de ltar rma 'byin pa'i nyes pa bstan nas /🔽da ni dang ba'i phan yon bstan @250a * //
analyzed: de ltar rma 'byin pa'i nyes pa bstan nas / da ni dang ba'i phan yon bstan @250a * //
translated: Having thus taught the faults of being wounded,

original: pa'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: pa'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: now, in order to teach the benefits of clarity, he says “thus” and so on.

original: bsam pa rnam par dag pas na byams pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa rnam par dag pas na byams pa'o //
translated: Since the intention is pure, it is loving.

original: sbyor ba bzang po ni mig bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba bzang po ni mig bskyed pa'o //
translated: The good application is the development of the eye.

original: mos pa ni las dang po pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa ni las dang po pa'o //
translated: Interest is for beginners.

original: dad pa ni dang ba'i dad pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa ni dang ba'i dad pa'o //
translated: Faith is the clarity of faith.

original: bsngags pa ni yon tan no //
analyzed: bsngags pa ni yon tan no //
translated: Praise is the quality.

original: de nyid nges don gyi lung ni dad pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i mdo las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid nges don gyi lung ni dad pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i mdo las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The definitive meaning of this is in the Sutra Generating the Power of Faith.

original: bslab pa ni khrims lnga la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa ni khrims lnga la sogs pa'o //
translated: The training is the five precepts and so on.

original: de la yul dman pas na dge bsnyen no //
analyzed: de la yul dman pas na dge bsnyen no //
translated: Among them, the lay practitioner is inferior in terms of object.

original: dus thung bas na nyin gcig go //🔽dngos po dman pas na zan zhes smos so //
analyzed: dus thung bas na nyin gcig go // dngos po dman pas na zan zhes smos so //
translated: The one day vow is inferior in terms of time.🔽The one day vow is inferior in terms of substance, since it is called a vow of food.

original: nyung bas na gcig ces smos so //
analyzed: nyung bas na gcig ces smos so //
translated: It is inferior in terms of quantity, since it is called a single vow.

original: chos grangs med pa ni snga ma yul mang bas 'jig rten gyi khams rdul snyed dang / dus ring la bskal pa gang g'a'i bye ma snyed dang / rtag pas na nyin re zhing dang / dngos po bzang bas lha'i zas dang gos byin pa zil gyis gnon ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos grangs med pa ni snga ma yul mang bas 'jig rten gyi khams rdul snyed dang / dus ring la bskal pa gang g'a'i bye ma snyed dang / rtag pas na nyin re zhing dang / dngos po bzang bas lha'i zas dang gos byin pa zil gyis gnon ces bya'o //
translated: The countless Dharmas are superior in terms of object, since they are as numerous as the atoms in the world systems, superior in terms of time, since they are for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges, superior in terms of duration, since they are for every day, and superior in terms of substance, since they are the gift of divine food and clothing.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba tsam yang bsod nams mang du 'phel ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba tsam yang bsod nams mang du 'phel ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why does one’s merit increase greatly just by seeing a tathāgata?

original: bsod nams dang ye shes mthar phyin pas na de'i 'bras bu ni don med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes mthar phyin pas na de'i 'bras bu ni don med pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the result of that is not meaningless, since it perfects merit and wisdom.

original: lung las kyang /
analyzed: lung las kyang /
translated: Also, a scripture says:

original: sangs rgyas kyi sgra yang don med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sgra yang don med pa ma yin te /
translated: The term buddha is not meaningless,🔽because it is the cause of nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes gsungs na gzugs mthong na ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes gsungs na gzugs mthong na ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
translated: If you see form, why would it not be so?

original: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni bdud la sogs pas mi phyed pa'i phyir te ;
analyzed: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni bdud la sogs pas mi phyed pa'i phyir te ;
translated: The term Sangha is so called because it is indivisible by demons and so on,

original: sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun rnams //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun rnams //
translated: because the Buddha, Dharma and Sangha🔽cannot be divided

original: bdud rnams bye ba brgya yis kyang //🔽gang phyir dbye bar mi nus pa //🔽de phyir dge 'dun zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdud rnams bye ba brgya yis kyang // gang phyir dbye bar mi nus pa // de phyir dge 'dun zhes bya'o //
translated: by even a hundred million demons.

original: zhe'o // nyan thos smos pa ni rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhe'o // nyan thos smos pa ni rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term sravaka is mentioned because they are permanent,

original: yang na dang ba'i 'bras bu can yin pas so //
analyzed: yang na dang ba'i 'bras bu can yin pas so //
translated: because they possess the result of faith,

original: yang na sdom pa mtshungs pas so //
analyzed: yang na sdom pa mtshungs pas so //
translated: because they possess the same vows,

original: yang na mi phyed pas so //
analyzed: yang na mi phyed pas so //
translated: because they are indivisible,

original: yang na yon tan dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: yang na yon tan dang ldan pas so //
translated: because they possess qualities,

original: yang na spangs pa 'dra bas so //
analyzed: yang na spangs pa 'dra bas so //
translated: because they possess similar abandonment,

original: yang na grangs mang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na grangs mang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are numerous,

original: yang na mi brten pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: yang na mi brten pa ma yin pas so //
translated: and because they are not independent.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa la bsnyen bkur dus de tsam du dngos po bzang po dang mang pos byas pa pas byang chub sems dpa' la byas pa bsod nams che ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa la bsnyen bkur dus de tsam du dngos po bzang po dang mang pos byas pa pas byang chub sems dpa' la byas pa bsod nams che ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The bodhisattva is more meritorious than the Buddha himself, because he has served the Buddha and his retinue for a long time with many excellent things.

original: la la na re rgyu gtso bo yin pas rgyu mchog tu bshad de /
analyzed: la la na re rgyu gtso bo yin pas rgyu mchog tu bshad de /
translated: Some say: The cause is the most important, so the cause is explained as the best.

original: byang chub sems dpa' las de bzhin gshegs pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' las de bzhin gshegs pa /
translated: The Tathagata arises from the bodhisattva,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa las ni nyan thos 'byung bar gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa las ni nyan thos 'byung bar gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: and the Sravakas arise from the Tathagata.

original: la la ni byang chub @250b kyi sems bsngags par bstan pa'i phyir zhes zer ro //
analyzed: la la ni byang chub @250b kyi sems bsngags par bstan pa'i phyir zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is in order to praise the thought of enlightenment.

original: ra'i shing rta lta bu'i bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ra'i shing rta lta bu'i bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the perfection of the intention like a wish-fulfilling gem?

original: dang ba'i bsam pa la bya'o //
analyzed: dang ba'i bsam pa la bya'o //
translated: It is the intention of clarity.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyun gyi bsam pa ni phun sum tshogs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rgyun gyi bsam pa ni phun sum tshogs pa ma yin la /
translated: The intention of continuity is not perfect.

original: gal te de ltar yin na ra'i shing rta lta bu zhes ji skad brjod /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na ra'i shing rta lta bu zhes ji skad brjod /
translated: If that is so, why is it called like a wish-fulfilling gem?

original: sangs rgyas la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase having generated the roots of virtue in relation to the buddhas refers to generosity, etc. that are focused on the buddhas.

original: de ltar dang po'i phan yon bstan nas da ni nges pa dang ma nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar dang po'i phan yon bstan nas da ni nges pa dang ma nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: Having thus taught the benefits of the first stage, now, in order to teach the characteristics of the bodhisattvas who are certain and those who are not certain, he says:

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'di lta ste //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'di lta ste //
translated: The bodhisattvas are like this:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase and so on refers to the following:

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'o //
translated: Buddha-field refers to the trichiliocosm.

original: phyir phul ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyir phul ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Given back refers to

original: dang po'i sa'i cha nas phyir ded pa'o //
analyzed: dang po'i sa'i cha nas phyir ded pa'o //
translated: the stage of action out of faith.

original: brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa zhes bya ba ni grangs kyi mtha' thug pa ste /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa zhes bya ba ni grangs kyi mtha' thug pa ste /
translated: Inconceivable and beyond that refers to the limit of enumeration.

original: de'i gong na grangs kyi ming gzhan med pas ji skad du /
analyzed: de'i gong na grangs kyi ming gzhan med pas ji skad du /
translated: Since there is no other name for the number beyond that, it is said:

original: brjod du med pa'i brjod du med pa ni /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i brjod du med pa ni /

original: 'bum rdib dang / gam gum dang / la lo dang / bgrang 'phyos te de'i steng du rtsa ba'i grangs bdun bsnan na brgya bcu drug ni grangs rkyang pa'i dbang du byas pas so //
analyzed: 'bum rdib dang / gam gum dang / la lo dang / bgrang 'phyos te de'i steng du rtsa ba'i grangs bdun bsnan na brgya bcu drug ni grangs rkyang pa'i dbang du byas pas so //

original: khug pa'i gnas ni bcu ste /
analyzed: khug pa'i gnas ni bcu ste /
translated: The ten stages of the partial are

original: dpag yas dang / yal phyong dang / mu yal dang / bgrang yol dang / mi 'jal dang / bsam phyod dang / mtha' 'byam dang / dpag thag dang / brjod du med pa dang / brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa ste /
analyzed: dpag yas dang / yal phyong dang / mu yal dang / bgrang yol dang / mi 'jal dang / bsam phyod dang / mtha' 'byam dang / dpag thag dang / brjod du med pa dang / brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa ste /
translated: infinite, beyond measure, beyond number, beyond calculation, beyond conception, beyond limit, beyond bound, beyond thought, beyond expression, and beyond inexpressible expression.

original: de'i steng du bgrod 'phyos la bsgres pa la sogs pa nas brjod du med pa bsgres pa'i bar du bcu bsnan pa ni khug pa'i gnas bcu ste /
analyzed: de'i steng du bgrod 'phyos la bsgres pa la sogs pa nas brjod du med pa bsgres pa'i bar du bcu bsnan pa ni khug pa'i gnas bcu ste /
translated: The ten stages of the partial are the ten stages of the partial, from the stage of the partial that is multiplied by the stage of the partial that is beyond expression, and so on, up to the stage of the partial that is multiplied by the stage of the partial that is beyond inexpressible expression.

original: nyi shu dang spyir sdom na brgya sum cu rtsa drug tu ni ming gis bstan pas so //
analyzed: nyi shu dang spyir sdom na brgya sum cu rtsa drug tu ni ming gis bstan pas so //
translated: In general, when the twenty are added together, they are explained by name as the one hundred and thirty-six.

original: dpe de nyid sbyar ba ni /
analyzed: dpe de nyid sbyar ba ni /
translated: The example is applied:

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: As such, the ten stages of the partial🔽are the ten stages of the partial.

original: thos pa'i dbang du byas pa ni kha ton byed pa dang / klog pa dang / 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa'i dbang du byas pa ni kha ton byed pa dang / klog pa dang / 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: The one who is governed by listening is one who recites, reads, and memorizes.

original: bsam pa'i dbang du byas pa ni //
analyzed: bsam pa'i dbang du byas pa ni //
translated: The one who is governed by reflection is one who

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
translated: reflects properly.

original: dpyod pa ni shes rab kyis zhib tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa ni shes rab kyis zhib tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: Analysis is the thorough discrimination by wisdom.

original: kun chub par byed pa ni ma lus par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: kun chub par byed pa ni ma lus par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Comprehension is the complete retention of what is heard and reflected upon.

original: de la tshul dman pa la spyod pa dang / 'dre ba la spyod pas na dpe gnyis bstan no //
analyzed: de la tshul dman pa la spyod pa dang / 'dre ba la spyod pas na dpe gnyis bstan no //
translated: The two similes are taught in order to show the one who practices with inferior method and the one who practices with a mixture of methods.

original: rang bzhin gyi rigs dang ldan zhing sems bskyed pas na theg pa chen po pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi rigs dang ldan zhing sems bskyed pas na theg pa chen po pa'o //
translated: The one who is endowed with the lineage and has generated the thought is a Mahayanist.

original: bsam pa rgya che bas na mos pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa rgya che bas na mos pa'o //
translated: The one who has a vast attitude is a believer.

original: sbyor ba rgya che bas klog pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba rgya che bas klog pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The one who has a vast application is a reader and a memorizer.

original: de la @251b klog pa ni gzhung gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de la @251b klog pa ni gzhung gi bdag nyid do //
translated: Here, reading is the text itself.

original: 'dzin pa ni don rnam par sems pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni don rnam par sems pa'o //
translated: Memorizing is the reflection on the meaning.

original: gus pa ni sems kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: gus pa ni sems kyi khyad par ro //
translated: Respect is a special attitude.

original: zhe sa ni lus dang ngag gi'o //
analyzed: zhe sa ni lus dang ngag gi'o //
translated: Politeness is physical and verbal.

original: gzhol ba ni mos pa'o //
analyzed: gzhol ba ni mos pa'o //
translated: Inclination is belief.

original: 'bab pa ni lhan cig spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'bab pa ni lhan cig spyod pa'o //
translated: The descent is the simultaneous practice.

original: brten pa ni 'grogs pa'o //
analyzed: brten pa ni 'grogs pa'o //
translated: The support is the companionship.

original: tshol ba ni nyan pa'o //
analyzed: tshol ba ni nyan pa'o //
translated: The seeking is the listening.

original: 'dzin pa ni don mi nyams par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni don mi nyams par byed pa'o //
translated: The holding is the non-deterioration of the meaning.

original: 'chang ba ni glegs bam mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: 'chang ba ni glegs bam mi gtong ba'o //
translated: The bearing is the non-abandonment of the scriptures.

original: de ltar sgrub pas bsti stang byed pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sgrub pas bsti stang byed pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the reverence through practice,

original: zang zing gis bsti stang byed par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zang zing gis bsti stang byed par bstan pa ni /
translated: he teaches the reverence through material things.

original: rab tu gus pas me tog dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu gus pas me tog dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: With great respect, with flowers, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i gtso bo ni gzhan la gus pa yin pas mi brnyan pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i gtso bo ni gzhan la gus pa yin pas mi brnyan pa zhes smos so //
translated: Since the chief thing in the Bodhisattva's practice is respect for others, he says, without contempt.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni zab pa dang rgya che ba'o //🔽yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa dag ni zab pa yin la /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni zab pa dang rgya che ba'o // yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa dag ni zab pa yin la /
translated: The six perfections are the profound and the magnificent.🔽 Moreover, some believe that the conventional truths are the profound,

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ston pa dag ni rgya che ba yin no zhes kha cig 'dod do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ston pa dag ni rgya che ba yin no zhes kha cig 'dod do //
translated: and the teaching of the ultimate truth is the magnificent.

original: bden pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i chos mi spong bas mos pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i chos mi spong bas mos pa'o //
translated: The interest is the non-abandonment of the Dharma which is endowed with the two truths.

original: theg pa chen po'i don ni shes rab dang snying rje'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i don ni shes rab dang snying rje'o //
translated: The meaning of the Great Vehicle is wisdom and compassion.

original: yang na pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
analyzed: yang na pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
translated: Or else, it is the six perfections.

original: yang na zab pa dang rgya che ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang na zab pa dang rgya che ba'i don to //
translated: Or else, it is the meaning of the profound and the vast.

original: 'phags pa thogs med kyis ni sems bskyed pa la sogs pa rnam pa bdun bshad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa thogs med kyis ni sems bskyed pa la sogs pa rnam pa bdun bshad do //
translated: The noble Asanga explains it as seven topics, beginning with the generation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang snying rje la bshad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang snying rje la bshad do //
translated: The noble Nagarjuna explains it as the six perfections and compassion.

original: lang kar gshegs pa las ni /
analyzed: lang kar gshegs pa las ni /
translated: The Lankāvatāra-sūtra says:🔽The five dharmas, the nature,🔽and the eight consciousnesses,

original: chos lnga dang ni rang bzhin dang // rnam par shes pa brgyad nyid dang // bdag med pa ni rnam gnyis kyis //
analyzed: chos lnga dang ni rang bzhin dang // rnam par shes pa brgyad nyid dang // bdag med pa ni rnam gnyis kyis //
translated: and the two kinds of selflessness

original: ma lus theg pa chen po bsdus //
analyzed: ma lus theg pa chen po bsdus //
translated: comprise the entire Great Vehicle.

original: zhe'o // de la chos lnga ni ming dang / rgyu mtshan dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zhe'o // de la chos lnga ni ming dang / rgyu mtshan dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa ni rang bzhin no //
translated: Therein, the five dharmas are name, sign, conceptualization, suchness, and right knowledge.

original: 'phags pa byams pa'i zhal nas ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa'i zhal nas ni /
translated: The noble Maitreya says:

original: sa bon dang / 'jug pa dang / bsgrub pa dang / go rims dang / 'bras bu dag ni theg pa chen po yin te /
analyzed: sa bon dang / 'jug pa dang / bsgrub pa dang / go rims dang / 'bras bu dag ni theg pa chen po yin te /
translated: The Great Vehicle is the seed, the entry, the practice, the sequence, and the result.

original: rigs ni sa bon no //
analyzed: rigs ni sa bon no //
translated: The spiritual potential is the seed.

original: 'jug pa ni sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: The entry is the generation of the resolve.

original: sgrub pa ni rang dang gzhan gyi don to //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni rang dang gzhan gyi don to //
translated: The practice is the benefit of self and other.

original: go rims ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
analyzed: go rims ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
translated: The sequence is the six perfections.

original: 'bras bu ni byang chub kyi don te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni byang chub kyi don te /
translated: The result is the goal of enlightenment.🔽Thus,

original: de'i phyir / theg pa mchog bstan pa yi rnam pa chos kyis 'gro ba'i sems can la //
analyzed: de'i phyir / theg pa mchog bstan pa yi rnam pa chos kyis 'gro ba'i sems can la //
translated: for beings who go by the Dharma, the teaching of the supreme vehicle

original: 'byor pa'i don tshul bla med gyur pa rnam pa lnga yi bdag nyid ston //🔽zhes gsungs @252a * //
analyzed: 'byor pa'i don tshul bla med gyur pa rnam pa lnga yi bdag nyid ston // zhes gsungs @252a * //
translated: teaches the five aspects of the nature of the unsurpassed way of the goals.

original: so ; / mkhas pa ni phyin ci ma log par shes pa'o //
analyzed: so ; / mkhas pa ni phyin ci ma log par shes pa'o //
translated: The wise are those who know without error.

original: mi g-yo bas na rtag tu'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo bas na rtag tu'o //
translated: They are always steadfast.

original: skyabs ni mtho ris dang byang grol lo //
analyzed: skyabs ni mtho ris dang byang grol lo //
translated: The refuge is heaven and liberation.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni smon pa dang / 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni smon pa dang / 'jug pa'o //
translated: The thought of enlightenment is the aspiration and the engagement.

original: byams pa ni phan par 'dod pa'i sems so //
analyzed: byams pa ni phan par 'dod pa'i sems so //
translated: Love is the thought of wishing benefit.

original: snying rje ni sdug bsngal bsal ba'i sems so //
analyzed: snying rje ni sdug bsngal bsal ba'i sems so //
translated: Compassion is the thought of removing suffering.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The six perfections are generosity and so on.

original: rton pa bzhi ni thos pa dang // bsam pa dang / sgom pa'i gnas skabs gsum du chos dang / don dang / nges pa'i don dang / ye shes la rton gyi gang zag dang / tshig dang / drang ba'i don dang / rnam par shes pa la mi rton pa'o //
analyzed: rton pa bzhi ni thos pa dang // bsam pa dang / sgom pa'i gnas skabs gsum du chos dang / don dang / nges pa'i don dang / ye shes la rton gyi gang zag dang / tshig dang / drang ba'i don dang / rnam par shes pa la mi rton pa'o //
translated: The four reliances are to rely on the teaching, the meaning, the definitive meaning, and the wisdom, and not to rely on the person, the words, the interpretable meaning, or consciousness, in the three situations of hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po ni sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po ni sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa'o //
translated: The four social practices are generosity, pleasant speech, purposeful activity, and conformity.

original: rang gi lam la gzhan sbyor ba ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi lam la gzhan sbyor ba ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The application of others to one's own path is the also.

original: da ni chos spong ba'i nyes pa bstan pa'i phyir dam pa'i chos spong ba ni gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni chos spong ba'i nyes pa bstan pa'i phyir dam pa'i chos spong ba ni gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the fault of rejecting the true teaching, he says, The rejection of the true teaching.

original: gang zag gang gis spong zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag gang gis spong zhe na /
translated: By what sort of person is it rejected?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa zhes smos so //
translated: By one who is in the Bodhisattva vehicle.

original: dus nam gyi tshe spong zhe na /
analyzed: dus nam gyi tshe spong zhe na /
translated: At what time is it rejected?

original: sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: For many quintillions of eons.

original: bzod pa ma thob cing mos pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa ni /
analyzed: bzod pa ma thob cing mos pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa ni /
translated: One who has not attained patience and has not fulfilled his aspiration

original: sangs rgyas mthong yang kha na ma tho ba'i las chen po la 'jug pa srid pas na de smos so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mthong yang kha na ma tho ba'i las chen po la 'jug pa srid pas na de smos so //
translated: may even see the Buddha and still engage in a great misdeed.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul zhes bya ba ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul zhes bya ba ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “in a manner of objectification” means that one does not possess the complete purity of the three sectors.

original: gang spong ba zhe na /
analyzed: gang spong ba zhe na /
translated: What does one reject?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di zhes smos so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di zhes smos so //
translated: The phrase “this profound perfection of wisdom” refers to it.

original: ri mo byed pa ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin zhes yongs su spong ba'o //
analyzed: ri mo byed pa ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin zhes yongs su spong ba'o //
translated: One rejects it by saying that it is not the word of the Buddha.

original: ji ltar ri mo byed ce na //
analyzed: ji ltar ri mo byed ce na //
translated: How does one reject it?

original: 'khor du 'ongs na yang lus dang sems kyis mthun par mi spyod ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'khor du 'ongs na yang lus dang sems kyis mthun par mi spyod ces bya ba ste /
translated: One does not act in accord with it either physically or mentally.🔽“

original: 'khor ni dge slong la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ni dge slong la sogs pa'o //
translated: The assembly” refers to monks and so on.🔽“

original: 'ongs pa ni chos kyi mkhan po'i gsang drang ba'i phyir lhags pa'o //
analyzed: 'ongs pa ni chos kyi mkhan po'i gsang drang ba'i phyir lhags pa'o //
translated: Having come” means having come in order to question the teacher of the Dharma.

original: 'dud pa la sogs pa med pas lus kyis mthun par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dud pa la sogs pa med pas lus kyis mthun par mi byed pa'o //
translated: One does not act in accord with it physically by not bowing down to it and so on.

original: chos ma yin no zhes spong bas sems kyis mthun par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin no zhes spong bas sems kyis mthun par mi byed pa'o //
translated: One does not mentally assent to it, by rejecting it with the thought this is not the Dharma.

original: des nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /🔽mthong ba'i chos la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: des nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na / mthong ba'i chos la sogs pa ni /
translated: What is the fault of that?

original: 'chal ba'i shes rab tu 'gyur zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'chal ba'i shes rab tu 'gyur zhes bya ba ste /
translated: One has bad insight in this visible world, etc.

original: shes rab dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is one is devoid of insight.

original: 'dor ba ni spong ba'o //
analyzed: 'dor ba ni spong ba'o //
translated: Rejection means abandonment.

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad 'di las skyes @252b shing byung bas na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bor ba'o //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad 'di las skyes @252b shing byung bas na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bor ba'o //
translated: Since all the Buddhas of the three times have arisen and emerged from this, one rejects omniscience.

original: des 'bras bu ci myong zhe na /🔽skyes nas myong ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: des 'bras bu ci myong zhe na / skyes nas myong ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: lo bye ba khrag khrig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: lo bye ba khrag khrig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: From the point of view of the experience of the result in the next life, it is said for millions and millions of years, etc.

original: bar ma chad pa dmyal ba kho na brgyud pas na 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: bar ma chad pa dmyal ba kho na brgyud pas na 'khor ba'o //
translated: Since one goes through only the hells without interruption, it is cyclic existence.

original: 'jig pa ni dus mtha'i me la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni dus mtha'i me la sogs pa'o //
translated: Destruction is the fire at the end of the eon, etc.

original: chags pa ni dang po rlung nas bzung ste'o //
analyzed: chags pa ni dang po rlung nas bzung ste'o //
translated: Attachment is from the beginning, starting with the wind.

original: de'i tshe'ang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan gyi sems can dmyal bar skye bas na dmyal ba chen po nas dmyal ba chen por zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe'ang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan gyi sems can dmyal bar skye bas na dmyal ba chen po nas dmyal ba chen por zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: At that time, because sentient beings are born in the hells of other world systems, it is said, “from one great hell to another great hell.”

original: de'i las zad nas gong du 'pho ba ni /
analyzed: de'i las zad nas gong du 'pho ba ni /
translated: When their karma is exhausted, they are reborn in higher realms.

original: dud 'gro dang gshin rje'i 'jig rten du zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: dud 'gro dang gshin rje'i 'jig rten du zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: It is said, “in the animal realm and the world of Yama.”

original: des na cis te mir skyes na yang lkugs pa dang dmus long la sogs par skye bas na de bzhin no zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: des na cis te mir skyes na yang lkugs pa dang dmus long la sogs par skye bas na de bzhin no zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, even if they are born as humans, they are born as mute, blind, and so on.

original: 'o na kha na ma tho ba chen po ni mtshams med pa ma yin nam zhes rgol pa la /
analyzed: 'o na kha na ma tho ba chen po ni mtshams med pa ma yin nam zhes rgol pa la /
translated: “But isn’t the great offense the heinous acts?”

original: lan ni de bas kyang dam pa'i chos spong ba kha na ma tho ba che ba yin te /
analyzed: lan ni de bas kyang dam pa'i chos spong ba kha na ma tho ba che ba yin te /
translated: The answer is that abandoning the true Dharma is a greater offense than that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because it severs the root of the wisdom of the buddhas of the three times.

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi rtsa ba bcad pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni mtshams med pa lnga dang 'dra zhes mi bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi rtsa ba bcad pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni mtshams med pa lnga dang 'dra zhes mi bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is taught that abandoning the true Dharma is not like the five heinous acts.

original: 'di byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa dang 'brel par ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: 'di byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa dang 'brel par ci mngon zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “How is this connected to the bodhisattva vow?”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is because it says “the bodhisattva vehicle.”

original: da ni bdud kyi las kyi gnod pa bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: da ni bdud kyi las kyi gnod pa bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: Now, in order to teach the harm of the māras’ activities,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi las ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi las ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: it says, “The māras’ activities of bodhisattvas.”

original: 'dir bdud dag ni du zhig la /
analyzed: 'dir bdud dag ni du zhig la /
translated: Here, how many māras are there?

original: gang zag ni gang gi la /
analyzed: gang zag ni gang gi la /
translated: For what kind of person?

original: dus ni nam gyi tshe /
analyzed: dus ni nam gyi tshe /
translated: At what time?🔽What kind of harm?🔽How many māras’ activities are there?🔽What is the method for abandoning them?

original: gnod pa ni ji lta bu zhig / bdud kyi las ni du zhig / de spong ba'i thabs ni gang zhig ce na smras pa /
analyzed: gnod pa ni ji lta bu zhig / bdud kyi las ni du zhig / de spong ba'i thabs ni gang zhig ce na smras pa /
translated: It is said:

original: bdud ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: bdud ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of māras:

original: phung po dang / nyon mongs pa dang / 'chi bdag dang / lha'i bu'i bdud do //
analyzed: phung po dang / nyon mongs pa dang / 'chi bdag dang / lha'i bu'i bdud do //
translated: the māras of the skandhas, afflictions, lord of death, and the son of the gods.🔽For what kind of person?

original: gang zag ni las dang po pa theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa la'o //
analyzed: gang zag ni las dang po pa theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa la'o //
translated: For the beginner, who is newly engaged in the vehicle.

original: dus ni dad pa dang rnam par rtog pa shas che ba dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral ba'i tshe'o //
analyzed: dus ni dad pa dang rnam par rtog pa shas che ba dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral ba'i tshe'o //
translated: The time is when faith and discursive thoughts are predominant, when one is engaged in striving, and when one is separated from the spiritual teacher.

original: 'ching ba las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir rab tu brtson par byed pa la bar chad bya ba'i phyir nye bar 'ong zhing de las mi 'da' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'ching ba las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir rab tu brtson par byed pa la bar chad bya ba'i phyir nye bar 'ong zhing de las mi 'da' bar byed pa'o //
translated: It comes to obstruct one who is striving to transcend the fetters, and it does not let one transcend them.

original: bdud kyi las ni bsod nams kyi bar chad byed pa'i bdud kyi las brgyad dang / ye shes kyi bar du gcod pa nyi shu'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi las ni bsod nams kyi bar chad byed pa'i bdud kyi las brgyad dang / ye shes kyi bar du gcod pa nyi shu'o //
translated: The works of Mara are the eight works of Mara that obstruct merit and the twenty that obstruct knowledge.

original: brtag pa'i thabs ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: brtag pa'i thabs ni bzhi ste /
translated: The means of investigation are four:

original: rgyud kyi yon tan la brtag pa dang / 'od zer la brtag pa dang / chos @253a * //
analyzed: rgyud kyi yon tan la brtag pa dang / 'od zer la brtag pa dang / chos @253a * //
translated: investigation of the qualities of the continuum, investigation of the light rays,

original: bshad pa la brtag pa dang / mchod pa la brtag pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa la brtag pa dang / mchod pa la brtag pa'o //
translated: investigation of the Dharma teaching, and investigation of the worship.

original: la la ni stong pa nyid kyis brtag pa dang lnga'o zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: la la ni stong pa nyid kyis brtag pa dang lnga'o zhes 'dod do //
translated: Some maintain that there is a fifth, the investigation of emptiness.

original: spang ba'i thabs ni yang dag pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa'i sgo nas spong bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: spang ba'i thabs ni yang dag pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa'i sgo nas spong bar bya ba'o //
translated: The means of abandoning them is to abandon them by relying on a true spiritual friend.

original: de la bdud bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa'i bdud do //
analyzed: de la bdud bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa'i bdud do //
translated: The four māras are the māras of the bodhisattvas.

original: las rnam pa gnyis mtshon pa ni /
analyzed: las rnam pa gnyis mtshon pa ni /
translated: The two kinds of actions are indicated.

original: bdud kyi las ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi las ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The actions of māras come from the perfection of wisdom.

original: las dang po pa theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa la bdud 'byung bas ming la gnas pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: las dang po pa theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa la bdud 'byung bas ming la gnas pa zhes smos te /
translated: Since māras arise for beginners who have newly entered the vehicle, it says “abiding in names.”

original: las dang po pa yin pas na tshig kho na la'o //
analyzed: las dang po pa yin pas na tshig kho na la'o //
translated: Since they are beginners, they are only in the words.

original: ston pas ming la zhen pas bslus pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: ston pas ming la zhen pas bslus pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: The teacher says they are deceived by clinging to names.

original: / ming ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: / ming ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What kind of names?

original: khyod mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyod mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “When you fully awaken to perfect buddhahood.”

original: las dang po pa yin pas na phyir mi ldog pa'i ltas de dag med par yang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: las dang po pa yin pas na phyir mi ldog pa'i ltas de dag med par yang zhes bya ste /
translated: Since they are beginners, it says “even without the signs of irreversibility.”

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i ltas ni theg pa dman pa la ngan song dag gis brod pa dang 'jigs pa bskyed pa las kyang mi ldog pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i ltas ni theg pa dman pa la ngan song dag gis brod pa dang 'jigs pa bskyed pa las kyang mi ldog pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The sign of irreversibility is that one does not turn back even from the lower vehicle, which is generated by the fear of the miserable realms.

original: rlom sems pa ni bdud kyi tshig gis nga rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: rlom sems pa ni bdud kyi tshig gis nga rgyal ba'o //
translated: Conceit is pride due to the words of Mara.

original: brnyas pa ni khyad du gsod pa'o //
analyzed: brnyas pa ni khyad du gsod pa'o //
translated: Disdain is contempt.

original: de'i phyir / bdag stod gzhan la smod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir / bdag stod gzhan la smod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva who praises himself and disparages others

original: bdud kyis yongs su blang shing blo chung rig par bya //
analyzed: bdud kyis yongs su blang shing blo chung rig par bya //
translated: is to be known as having been taken by Mara, and as having little intelligence.

original: zhe'o // dus ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: zhe'o // dus ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Time is of four kinds:

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral ba las 'byung bas na de thabs mi mkhas shing shes rab dang bral ba /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral ba las 'byung bas na de thabs mi mkhas shing shes rab dang bral ba /
translated: Since it arises from being separated from a spiritual friend, it is said that one is unskilled in means and is separated from wisdom.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral ba /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral ba /
translated: One is separated from a spiritual friend.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis ma zin cing zhes smos te /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis ma zin cing zhes smos te /
translated: One is not taken care of by a spiritual friend.

original: mang po smos pa ni mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mang po smos pa ni mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The plural is used to indicate the general.

original: las gang byed ce na /
analyzed: las gang byed ce na /
translated: What kind of action does one perform?

original: nyan thos kyi sa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: It is said that one performs the action of the level of the śrāvaka, and so on.

original: ltung ba'i rtsa ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba'i rtsa ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The root of the downfall is taking life, etc.

original: ches lci ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar du gcod pa'i phyir te /🔽dmyal bar 'gro ba byang chub la //
analyzed: ches lci ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar du gcod pa'i phyir te / dmyal bar 'gro ba byang chub la //
translated: The most serious is the one that obstructs the knowledge of all things.🔽Going to hell does not obstruct

original: gtan gyi gegs byed ma yin te //
analyzed: gtan gyi gegs byed ma yin te //
translated: enlightenment.

original: nyan thos dang ni rang sangs rgyas //
analyzed: nyan thos dang ni rang sangs rgyas //
translated: But the Hearers’ and Solitary Realizers’

original: theg pa mchog la gegs su 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: theg pa mchog la gegs su 'gyur // zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Vehicle obstructs the supreme vehicle.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa la /🔽bdud 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa la / bdud 'byung ba ni /
translated: The arising of Mara for the conceptualizer

original: lha'i bu ji tsam du las 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lha'i bu ji tsam du las 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: is stated in the passage beginning “Mara, the son of the gods, engages in action.

original: las ni lus la sogs pa'i las so //
analyzed: las ni lus la sogs pa'i las so //
translated: ” Action is bodily action, etc.

original: 'jug pa ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Engagement is conceptualization.

original: bdud ni nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: bdud ni nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: Mara is the afflictions,

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: as it is said:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i nyon mongs pa ni rnam par rtog pa'o zhes @253b gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i nyon mongs pa ni rnam par rtog pa'o zhes @253b gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “The Bodhisattva’s afflictions are conceptualizations.🔽”

original: smon pa ni 'bras bu 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: smon pa ni 'bras bu 'dod pa'o //
translated: Aspiration is the desire for a result.

original: 'dzin pa ni rgyu la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni rgyu la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Grasping is the engagement in a cause.

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa ni gtsor byed pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa ni gtsor byed pa'o //
translated: Exaggerated grasping is the making of something primary.

original: 'dod pa ni 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni 'dun pa'o //
translated: Desire is longing.

original: 'du shes pa ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes pa ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Notion is the apprehension of signs.

original: rlom sems pa ni dngos por lta ba'o //
analyzed: rlom sems pa ni dngos por lta ba'o //
translated: Conceit is the view of entities.

original: yongs su rtags pa ni spyod pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rtags pa ni spyod pa'o //
translated: Investigation is conduct.

original: gang du las 'jug pa zhes smos pa de gang la ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gang du las 'jug pa zhes smos pa de gang la ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Where does action enter?

original: byang chub kyi sems la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “In the thought of enlightenment, etc.

original: zhen pa ni dngos por lta ba'o //
analyzed: zhen pa ni dngos por lta ba'o //
translated: Attachment is the view of entities.

original: ci'i phyir bdud kyi las su bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdud kyi las su bshad ce na /
translated: Why are they called the works of Mara?

original: dngos por lta ba ni 'ching ba yin pas thar pa ci thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos por lta ba ni 'ching ba yin pas thar pa ci thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The view of entities is bondage. What is the point of liberation?

original: dngos por lta bas kun nas bslang ba'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba yang 'ching ba kho na yin pas /
analyzed: dngos por lta bas kun nas bslang ba'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba yang 'ching ba kho na yin pas /
translated: The application of generosity, etc. , which is motivated by the view of entities, is just bondage.

original: sbyin pas rlom sems su byed pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sbyin pas rlom sems su byed pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore he says, “conceit in generosity, etc.

original: rlom sems pa ni rang dang gzhan dang chos su dngos po lta ba'o //
analyzed: rlom sems pa ni rang dang gzhan dang chos su dngos po lta ba'o //
translated: Conceit is the view of entities as self, other, or phenomena.

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa ni zhen pa'i gnas su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa ni zhen pa'i gnas su rtog pa'o //
translated: Apprehending as supreme is the conception of a basis of attachment.

original: 'dzin pa ni zhe sdang la sogs par brtags pa'o ;
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni zhe sdang la sogs par brtags pa'o ;
translated: Grasping is the investigation of hatred, etc.

original: / lan pa ni rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: / lan pa ni rtsol ba'o //
translated: Rebuke is striving.

original: mtshan ma ni g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni g-yeng ba'o //
translated: Signs are distractions.

original: rgyu ba ni spyod pa'o //🔽mngon du rgyu ba mi 'byung ba tsam la gcor byed pas na /
analyzed: rgyu ba ni spyod pa'o // mngon du rgyu ba mi 'byung ba tsam la gcor byed pas na /
translated: Wandering is conduct.

original: dgon pa la dga' zhing mos pa dang / btang snyoms su byed ces smos te /
analyzed: dgon pa la dga' zhing mos pa dang / btang snyoms su byed ces smos te /
translated: Since one is merely not producing manifest wandering, it is said, one delights in and is devoted to solitude, and one is equanimous.

original: sems can yal bar 'dor ba na btang snyoms su ltung ba'o //
analyzed: sems can yal bar 'dor ba na btang snyoms su ltung ba'o //
translated: When one abandons sentient beings, one falls into equanimity.

original: chos gos la sogs pa ngan pas chog pas na 'dod pa chung ba'o //
analyzed: chos gos la sogs pa ngan pas chog pas na 'dod pa chung ba'o //
translated: Since one is satisfied with poor robes, etc., one has few desires.

original: mang po mi 'dod pas na chog shes pa'o //
analyzed: mang po mi 'dod pas na chog shes pa'o //
translated: Since one does not desire many, one is content.

original: de la 'dod pa chung bas ni chos bzhi spong ba ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa chung bas ni chos bzhi spong ba ste /
translated: Therein, by having few desires, one abandons four dharmas:

original: tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag dang / gzhogs slong dang / thob kyis 'jal ba'o //
analyzed: tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag dang / gzhogs slong dang / thob kyis 'jal ba'o //
translated: hypocrisy, garrulousness, hinting, and pursuing gain with gain.

original: chog shes pas ni rnyed pas rnyed pa spong ngo //
analyzed: chog shes pas ni rnyed pas rnyed pa spong ngo //
translated: By being content, one abandons gain with gain.

original: lus la sogs pa las su rung bar byed pas na sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa las su rung bar byed pas na sbyangs pa'o //
translated: Since one makes the body, etc., serviceable, one is pure.

original: yon tan ni bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: yon tan ni bcu gnyis te /
translated: The qualities are twelve:

original: zas las gyur pa gsum dang / gos las gyur pa gsum dang / gnas las gyur pa drug go //🔽de la mang du za ba'i gnyen po ni /
analyzed: zas las gyur pa gsum dang / gos las gyur pa gsum dang / gnas las gyur pa drug go // de la mang du za ba'i gnyen po ni /
translated: The three that arise from food, the three that arise from clothing, and the six that arise from shelter.

original: stan gcig pa ste /
analyzed: stan gcig pa ste /
translated: The antidote to eating a lot is to be a one-seat eater.

original: de yang stan gyi mtha' pa dang / chu'i mtha' pa'o //
analyzed: de yang stan gyi mtha' pa dang / chu'i mtha' pa'o //
translated: This means to be a “one-bowl eater” or a “one-water eater.”

original: yang yang za ba'i gnyen po ni phyis mi len pa'o //
analyzed: yang yang za ba'i gnyen po ni phyis mi len pa'o //
translated: The antidote to eating again is not to eat after.

original: bzang po la zhen pa'i gnyen po ni bsod snyoms pa ste /
analyzed: bzang po la zhen pa'i gnyen po ni bsod snyoms pa ste /
translated: The antidote to attachment to good food is to be a refuse-rag wearer.

original: de yang ci thob pa len pa dang mthar gyis rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: de yang ci thob pa len pa dang mthar gyis rgyu ba'o //
translated: This means to accept whatever food one is offered and to go for alms in sequence.

original: gos bzang po la chags pa'i gnyen po phyag dar khrod pa ste /
analyzed: gos bzang po la chags pa'i gnyen po phyag dar khrod pa ste /
translated: The antidote to attachment to good clothing is to be a wearer of coarse clothing.

original: de yang bor ba dang smad pa'i dbang gis so //🔽mang po'i gnyen po chos gos gsum pa'o //🔽'jam pa'i gnyen po phying pa pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bor ba dang smad pa'i dbang gis so // mang po'i gnyen po chos gos gsum pa'o // 'jam pa'i gnyen po phying pa pa'o //
translated: This means to wear clothing that is discarded or despised.🔽The antidote to having a lot of clothing is to be a wearer of the three Dharma robes.

original: 'du 'dzi la chags pa'i @254a * //🔽gnyen po ni dgon pa pa'o //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi la chags pa'i @254a * // gnyen po ni dgon pa pa'o //
translated: The antidote to attachment to soft clothing is to be a wearer of felt.🔽The antidote to attachment to social interaction is to be a forest dweller.

original: bla gab la chags pa'i gnyen po ni bla gab med pa'o //
analyzed: bla gab la chags pa'i gnyen po ni bla gab med pa'o //
translated: The antidote to attachment to shelter is to be a homeless person.

original: stan la chags pa'i gnyen po ni gzhi ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: stan la chags pa'i gnyen po ni gzhi ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: The antidote to attachment to a seat is to be a person who stays wherever he happens to be.

original: gtsug lag khang la chags pa'i gnyen po ni shing drung pa'o //🔽'khrig pa la chags pa'i gnyen po ni dur khrod pa'o ;
analyzed: gtsug lag khang la chags pa'i gnyen po ni shing drung pa'o // 'khrig pa la chags pa'i gnyen po ni dur khrod pa'o ;
translated: The remedy for attachment to temples is the “tree-root dweller.”🔽The remedy for attachment to sexual intercourse is the “charnel-ground dweller.”

original: / nyal ba la chags pa'i gnyen po ni cog pu pa'o //
analyzed: / nyal ba la chags pa'i gnyen po ni cog pu pa'o //
translated: The remedy for attachment to lying down is the “sitting posture.”

original: yo byad kyis phongs par byed pas na bsnyungs pa'o //
analyzed: yo byad kyis phongs par byed pas na bsnyungs pa'o //
translated: “Deprivation” means being deprived of possessions.

original: bsod nams kyi dngos po sbyin pa la sogs pa la ji lta ba bzhin du ye shes kyi tshogs la zhen pa yang 'ching ba yin pas /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi dngos po sbyin pa la sogs pa la ji lta ba bzhin du ye shes kyi tshogs la zhen pa yang 'ching ba yin pas /
translated: Since the accumulation of wisdom is also a fetter in the same way that the accumulation of merit through generosity and so on is,

original: stong pa nyid la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: stong pa nyid la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: he says, “Abiding in emptiness,” and so on.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni lhag mthong ngo //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni lhag mthong ngo //
translated: Emptiness and so on are insight.

original: spros pa med pa ni zhi gnas so //
analyzed: spros pa med pa ni zhi gnas so //
translated: Freedom from conceptual elaboration is serenity.

original: rab tu dben pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs so //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs so //
translated: Isolation is the accumulation of meditative absorption.

original: tshogs gnyis ni sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba'i phyir bka' sgrub ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshogs gnyis ni sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba'i phyir bka' sgrub ces bya ba'o //
translated: Since the two accumulations are approved by the Buddha, they are called “the accomplishment of the Buddha’s word.”

original: de ltar rgyas par bshad pa'i don bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar rgyas par bshad pa'i don bsdus pa ni /
translated: The summary of the meaning of this extensive explanation is as follows.

original: ji tsam du rtog pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji tsam du rtog pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: As much as one conceives, etc.

original: spyi dang khyad par dang de gnyis kas spyod pa ni rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa dang yongs su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par dang de gnyis kas spyod pa ni rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa dang yongs su rtog pa'o //
translated: General and specific and both of those are the conceiving, the discursive thought, and the thorough conception.

original: tha snyad bzhir rtog pas na mthong ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad bzhir rtog pas na mthong ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Since one conceives the four conventions, there is seeing, etc.

original: 'o na las dang po pa dag ji ltar 'dug par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na las dang po pa dag ji ltar 'dug par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well, how will beginners be situated?

original: stong pa nyid rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa la shes pa yongs su gtad nas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa la shes pa yongs su gtad nas /
translated: Having entrusted the knowledge to the emptiness endowed with the most sublime of all aspects,

original: tshogs bsags pa de nyid rtogs par 'gyur zhing nyes pa mtha' dag spong bas las dang po pas kyang sun 'byin pa'i sgo nas spong gi / gzhan du na rtog pa dag ni /
analyzed: tshogs bsags pa de nyid rtogs par 'gyur zhing nyes pa mtha' dag spong bas las dang po pas kyang sun 'byin pa'i sgo nas spong gi / gzhan du na rtog pa dag ni /
translated: that very accumulation of the collections will be realized and all faults will be abandoned. Therefore, even beginners abandon them by way of repudiation.

original: btsan thabs su spangs par 'dod na 'dus byas sun phyung bas gsor mi rung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: btsan thabs su spangs par 'dod na 'dus byas sun phyung bas gsor mi rung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, if one wishes to forcefully abandon the conceptions, then, since the compounded is repudiated, one will be incurable.

original: rnam par dben don mi shes shing //
analyzed: rnam par dben don mi shes shing //
translated: Not knowing the meaning of voidness,

original: thos pa tsam la 'jug byed pa //
analyzed: thos pa tsam la 'jug byed pa //
translated: one who engages in mere hearing

original: mi gang bsod nams mi byed pa'i //
analyzed: mi gang bsod nams mi byed pa'i //
translated: Those who do not perform merit

original: skyes bu tha shal de dag brlab //
analyzed: skyes bu tha shal de dag brlab //
translated: are the worst of people.

original: ces 'phags pa nyid kyis gsungs pa dang / yang yod yang dag pa'i dngos po la med do zhes skur pa 'debs pa'i legs par ma zin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ces 'phags pa nyid kyis gsungs pa dang / yang yod yang dag pa'i dngos po la med do zhes skur pa 'debs pa'i legs par ma zin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: And also, “Those who say that what exists does not exist are said to be in error.

original: dam pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di las nyams par rig par bya'o zhes /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di las nyams par rig par bya'o zhes /
translated: They should be known as having fallen from this well-proclaimed teaching and discipline.”

original: 'phags pa thogs med nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa'i sa las kyang gsungs pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'phags pa thogs med nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa'i sa las kyang gsungs pa'i phyir la /
translated: This is stated in the Bodhisattva Levels by the noble Asanga himself.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /🔽'jig tshogs su lta ba ri rab dang mnyam pa ni bla yi /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang / 'jig tshogs su lta ba ri rab dang mnyam pa ni bla yi /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān also said:🔽“It is better to have the view of the transitory collection equal to Mount Meru

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can stong pa nyid du lta ba @254b ni gsor mi rung ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can stong pa nyid du lta ba @254b ni gsor mi rung ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: than to have the arrogance of emptiness.”

original: 'og nas yang thabs dang shes rab ya bral ba ni 'ching bar gsungs pa dang / yang thabs dang mi ldan par dge ba spyod pa thams cad kyang bdud kyi las so zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: 'og nas yang thabs dang shes rab ya bral ba ni 'ching bar gsungs pa dang / yang thabs dang mi ldan par dge ba spyod pa thams cad kyang bdud kyi las so zhes 'chad do //
translated: And later on, it says that the separation of method and wisdom is bondage, and that all virtuous practices that are not endowed with method are the work of Mara.

original: de bas na 'khrul pa la 'khrul par shes nas rim gyis spong ba ni 'khrul pa spangs pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de bas na 'khrul pa la 'khrul par shes nas rim gyis spong ba ni 'khrul pa spangs pa zhes brjod de /
translated: Therefore, having recognized delusion as delusion, to gradually abandon it is called abandoning delusion.

original: sna tshogs 'di dag 'khrul pa na //
analyzed: sna tshogs 'di dag 'khrul pa na //
translated: As for these various delusions,

original: ma 'khrul gang zhig yin zhe na //
analyzed: ma 'khrul gang zhig yin zhe na //
translated: what is non-delusion?

original: 'khrul pa tsam du spongs shes na //
analyzed: 'khrul pa tsam du spongs shes na //
translated: If one knows how to abandon mere delusion,

original: ma 'khrul yin par shes par bya //
analyzed: ma 'khrul yin par shes par bya //
translated: one should know that it is non-delusion.

original: zhes 'dod so //
analyzed: zhes 'dod so //
translated: This is asserted.

original: da ni brtson pa dang ldan pa la bdud 'byung bas na /
analyzed: da ni brtson pa dang ldan pa la bdud 'byung bas na /
translated: Now, since Mara arises for those who are diligent,

original: de'i mtshan nyid brjod pa ni bdud kyi las ni brtson pa las 'byung zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid brjod pa ni bdud kyi las ni brtson pa las 'byung zhes smos so //
translated: the characteristics of that are stated: the work of Mara arises from diligence.

original: brtson pa gang dag ni bdud kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin nam /
analyzed: brtson pa gang dag ni bdud kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin nam /
translated: Are not diligence and so on antidotes to Mara?

original: ji ltar na brtson pa la bdud 'byung zhes ci'i phyir zhe na zhes rgol ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar na brtson pa la bdud 'byung zhes ci'i phyir zhe na zhes rgol ba la /
translated: Why is it said that Mara arises for the diligent?

original: gang zhig rin po che dang bang mdzod dang ldan pa la /
analyzed: gang zhig rin po che dang bang mdzod dang ldan pa la /
translated: What can thieves do to someone who is rich with jewels and treasuries?

original: chom rkun pa dag glags tshol zhing dbul zhing phongs la dgras ci zhig byas par 'gyur /
analyzed: chom rkun pa dag glags tshol zhing dbul zhing phongs la dgras ci zhig byas par 'gyur /
translated: What can poverty and enemies do to someone who is rich with jewels and treasuries?

original: de bzhin du dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa la bdud 'byung gi le lo la bdud kyis ci zhig bya zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa la bdud 'byung gi le lo la bdud kyis ci zhig bya zhes pa ni /
translated: Similarly, Mara appears to those who are diligent in virtue, but what can Mara do to the lazy?

original: brtson pa la bdud glags tshol gyi zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: brtson pa la bdud glags tshol gyi zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said that Mara seeks an opportunity for those who are diligent.

original: brtson pa la sogs pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: brtson pa la sogs pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is diligence, etc.?

original: ji tsam du gnyis la sbyor ba zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ji tsam du gnyis la sbyor ba zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said to be application to the two.

original: gnyis zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The two are the nature of the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag ni dngos por grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag ni dngos por grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: Are not the apprehended object and apprehending subject established as things?

original: lung las kyang nga de'i tshe ri dags kyi rgyal po seng ge yan lag ma smad pa zhes bya bar gyur to zhes gsungs pa dang / yang dge slong dag mtshan mo nam langs pa na ri dags ce spyad skad 'byin pa'i sgra thos so zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: lung las kyang nga de'i tshe ri dags kyi rgyal po seng ge yan lag ma smad pa zhes bya bar gyur to zhes gsungs pa dang / yang dge slong dag mtshan mo nam langs pa na ri dags ce spyad skad 'byin pa'i sgra thos so zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: And: “Monks, at dawn you hear the cry of the jackal, a beast of prey.”

original: ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dgag ce na de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes rgol ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dgag ce na de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes rgol ba la /
translated: How do we refute the object and subject?

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas goms pa'i 'khrul pa yin pas yang dag par mi rung ste /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas goms pa'i 'khrul pa yin pas yang dag par mi rung ste /
translated: The object and subject are errors due to habituation from beginningless time, and so they are not correct.

original: rigs pa dang lung gis gnod par gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: rigs pa dang lung gis gnod par gyur pa yin la /
translated: They are refuted by reasoning and scripture.

original: bdag med pa ston pa'i tha snyad kyi sgro btags pa ni bdag dang bdag gir gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa brjod pa yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bdag med pa ston pa'i tha snyad kyi sgro btags pa ni bdag dang bdag gir gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa brjod pa yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: But the imputation of the conventional expression “selflessness” is a reference to the object and subject of the self and “mine.”

original: 'jig rten pa dag ni thog ma med pa'i 'khrul pas goms pa'i dbang gis yang dag par 'dzin pa gnyis la sbyor ba'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dag ni thog ma med pa'i 'khrul pas goms pa'i dbang gis yang dag par 'dzin pa gnyis la sbyor ba'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The worldly, on the other hand, are engaged in the two graspings due to the power of habituation to error from beginningless time.

original: gnyis dang bral bas na sbyor ba yang dag pa ste /🔽phyin ci @255a * //
analyzed: gnyis dang bral bas na sbyor ba yang dag pa ste / phyin ci @255a * //
translated: Since it is free from the two, it is the right engagement.

original: ma log pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma log pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “non-erroneous” is

original: de kho na nyid du na thob par lta ba med pas thob pa dam pa ni sbyor ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du na thob par lta ba med pas thob pa dam pa ni sbyor ba med pa ste /
translated: In reality, since there is no view of attainment, the highest attainment is non-engagement,

original: mi sbyor ba nyid sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi sbyor ba nyid sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because non-engagement itself is engagement.

original: spros pa med pa zhes bya ba ni spros pa'i mtha' brgyad dang bral ba ni /
analyzed: spros pa med pa zhes bya ba ni spros pa'i mtha' brgyad dang bral ba ni /
translated: “Free from conceptual elaborations” means free from the eight extremes of conceptual elaborations.

original: de ltar bshad pa bsdu ba ni gang na mig la mi sbyor ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa bsdu ba ni gang na mig la mi sbyor ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: The summary of what has been explained is stated in “where one does not engage the eye.”

original: dad pa dang ldan pa'i bdud kyi las ni shugs kyis go bas na 'dir ma gsungs te /
analyzed: dad pa dang ldan pa'i bdud kyi las ni shugs kyis go bas na 'dir ma gsungs te /
translated: Since the work of Māra endowed with faith is understood implicitly, it is not mentioned here.

original: 'das ma thag pa'i brtson pa dang ldan pa'i skabs su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'das ma thag pa'i brtson pa dang ldan pa'i skabs su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It should be applied in the context of the immediately preceding section on diligence.

original: da ni bdud kyi gnod pa gang byed pa de bstan te mthong ba'i chos la theg pa mchog la nyams par byed pa dang / ma mthong ba'i tshe rten mchog las nyams par byed pa'o //
analyzed: da ni bdud kyi gnod pa gang byed pa de bstan te mthong ba'i chos la theg pa mchog la nyams par byed pa dang / ma mthong ba'i tshe rten mchog las nyams par byed pa'o //
translated: Now, the harm done by Mara is taught: in this life, it causes one to fall from the supreme vehicle; and in the next life, it causes one to fall from the supreme support.

original: de lta bas na brdar bstan pa'i tshul gyis brtag pa rnam pa lngas brtags nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pas spang bar bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na brdar bstan pa'i tshul gyis brtag pa rnam pa lngas brtags nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pas spang bar bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, one should rely on the spiritual friend by investigating with the five investigations in the manner of conventional teaching.
