original: lha'i bu nyi shu po 'di dag ni zhes smos te /
analyzed: lha'i bu nyi shu po 'di dag ni zhes smos te /
translated: The twenty sons of the gods are mentioned,

original: bdud kyi las brgyad dang / bdud kyi spyod pa bco brgyad dang / bdud kyi las yang dag phul nyi shu zhes smos pa ni de brtag pa la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdud kyi las brgyad dang / bdud kyi spyod pa bco brgyad dang / bdud kyi las yang dag phul nyi shu zhes smos pa ni de brtag pa la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: saying these are the twenty supreme offerings of Mara's deeds is for the sake of becoming skilled in investigating them.

original: de la nyi shu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nyi shu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twenty?

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa zhes gsungs te /🔽rnal 'byor ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa zhes gsungs te / rnal 'byor ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: It is said the practitioner,

original: spyod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: spyod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: and practice is twofold:

original: sems rnam par spyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spyod pa dang / spyod pa nyams su len pa'i spyod pa ste /
analyzed: sems rnam par spyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spyod pa dang / spyod pa nyams su len pa'i spyod pa ste /
translated: The concentration of mental cultivation is the practice, and the practice of practicing is the practice.

original: don gyi skabs 'dir ni sems rnam par spyod pa'i spyod pa la 'dod do //
analyzed: don gyi skabs 'dir ni sems rnam par spyod pa'i spyod pa la 'dod do //
translated: In this context, the practice is the practice of mental cultivation.

original: bdud ces bya ba ni yon tan skye ba'i bar du gcod pa la bya ste /
analyzed: bdud ces bya ba ni yon tan skye ba'i bar du gcod pa la bya ste /
translated: The word “demon” refers to an obstacle to the arising of virtue.

original: 'dir ni theg pa mchog la 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir ni theg pa mchog la 'dod do //
translated: Here, it refers to the supreme vehicle.

original: yang dag phul zhes bya ba ni bdud kyi las mchog yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag phul zhes bya ba ni bdud kyi las mchog yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “supreme” means the supreme activity of a demon.

original: bdud kyi las ni dpag tu med pa yin nam /
analyzed: bdud kyi las ni dpag tu med pa yin nam /
translated: Aren’t the activities of a demon immeasurable?🔽How can they be limited to twenty?

original: ji ltar grangs nges zhes rgol ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar grangs nges zhes rgol ba ni /
translated: This is the objection.

original: gang zhe na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhe na zhes bya'o //
translated: The reply is “What are they?”

original: bden mod kyi 'dir mchog bsdus nas bshad pa nyes pa med ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: bden mod kyi 'dir mchog bsdus nas bshad pa nyes pa med ces bya ba ni /
translated: It is true that they are immeasurable, but here, in order to include the supreme ones, there is no fault in explaining them as twenty.

original: 'di lta ste zhes mtshams sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes mtshams sbyor ba'o //
translated: The word “namely” introduces the list.

original: de la rnam pa nyi shu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la rnam pa nyi shu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The twenty are as follows:

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i dbang du byas pas bshes gnyen dman pa la brten pa ni /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i dbang du byas pas bshes gnyen dman pa la brten pa ni /
translated: 1. Relying on an inferior spiritual friend due to the influence of clinging.

original: rnam par grol bar 'dod cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol bar 'dod cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The desire for liberation and so on.

original: 'khor bas skrag pa ni nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba'i theg pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor bas skrag pa ni nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba'i theg pa'o //
translated: Fear of cyclic existence is the vehicle of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: dang po dang bar ma dang tha mar ni /
analyzed: dang po dang bar ma dang tha mar ni /
translated: First, middle, and last

original: gnyen po la sogs pa gsum du sbyar te /
analyzed: gnyen po la sogs pa gsum du sbyar te /
translated: is applied to the three: antidotes and so on.

original: theg pa mchog gi rtsa ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin pas @255b de dang bral ba ni /
analyzed: theg pa mchog gi rtsa ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin pas @255b de dang bral ba ni /
translated: Since the root of the supreme vehicle is the spiritual friend, being separated from that is

original: de'i bar du gcod pa bdud ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bar du gcod pa bdud ces bya'o //
translated: called a demon, an obstruction to that.

original: de ltar yongs su 'dzin pa dang bral na 'bras bu'i mchog sgrub pa dang bral bas shes rab thabs kyis ma zin na ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su 'dzin pa dang bral na 'bras bu'i mchog sgrub pa dang bral bas shes rab thabs kyis ma zin na ni gnyis te /
translated: Thus, if one is separated from the perfect support, one is separated from accomplishing the supreme result. If one is not embraced by method and wisdom, there are two:

original: gzhan gyi don gyi thabs dang bral ba ni stong pa nyid las so sor rtog cing sems can yal bar 'dor ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi thabs dang bral ba ni stong pa nyid las so sor rtog cing sems can yal bar 'dor ba ste /
translated: If one is separated from the method of the benefit of others, one is separated from emptiness, individually discriminating, and abandoning sentient beings.

original: rang nyid kyi nyon mongs pa spong bar 'bad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid kyi nyon mongs pa spong bar 'bad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one strives to abandon one's own afflictions.

original: rang don gyi thabs dang bral ba ni 'dus ma byas la so sor rtog cing 'dus byas kyis yongs su skyo ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rang don gyi thabs dang bral ba ni 'dus ma byas la so sor rtog cing 'dus byas kyis yongs su skyo ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Those who lack the means for their own benefit are said to discriminate the unconditioned and to be completely discouraged by the conditioned.

original: tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: They do not complete the collections.

original: de ltar shes rab thabs kyis yongs su ma zin pas zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi rgyu la log par zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab thabs kyis yongs su ma zin pas zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi rgyu la log par zhugs pa ni /
translated: Thus, those who are not embraced by the wisdom that is the means, who are wrongly engaged in the cause of uncontaminated wisdom,

original: bsam gtan bskyed cing rnam par ldog pa tshol ba ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bskyed cing rnam par ldog pa tshol ba ste /
translated: generate meditative stabilization and seek to turn away from it.

original: zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi rgyu ni ting nge 'dzin yin pa'i phyir bsam gtan bskyed pa ni rang zhi bar 'dod pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi rgyu ni ting nge 'dzin yin pa'i phyir bsam gtan bskyed pa ni rang zhi bar 'dod pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because meditative stabilization is the cause of uncontaminated wisdom, generating meditative stabilization is the intention to seek one's own peace, and so forth.

original: ldog pa ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: ldog pa ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Turning away from it is meditative stabilization that possesses the most sublime of all aspects.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang bral ba ni gang zag la ltos te bsam pa dman pa dang / chos la ltos te sbyor ba dman par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang bral ba ni gang zag la ltos te bsam pa dman pa dang / chos la ltos te sbyor ba dman par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Those who lack authentic meditative stabilization have inferior intention in terms of the person and inferior application in terms of the teaching.

original: de la gang zag la ltos te bsam pa dman pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de la gang zag la ltos te bsam pa dman pa ni gnyis te /
translated: Therein, the inferior attitude in relation to the person is twofold.

original: spyi'i dbang du byas nas snying rje dang bral ba ni snying rje chen po bskyed ces bya'o //
analyzed: spyi'i dbang du byas nas snying rje dang bral ba ni snying rje chen po bskyed ces bya'o //
translated: In general, the one devoid of compassion is said to generate great compassion.

original: bye brag gi dbang du byas nas byams pa dang bral ba ni khro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bye brag gi dbang du byas nas byams pa dang bral ba ni khro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: In particular, the one devoid of love is said to be angry.

original: chos kyi dbang du byas nas sbyor ba dman pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbang du byas nas sbyor ba dman pa ni gnyis te /
translated: The inferior application in relation to the Dharma is twofold.

original: bshad pa'i dbang du byas pa dang / sgrub pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa'i dbang du byas pa dang / sgrub pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: It is in relation to teaching and in relation to practice.

original: de la bshad pa'i dbang du byas pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de la bshad pa'i dbang du byas pa ni gnyis te /
translated: Therein, in relation to teaching, it is twofold.

original: shes rab dman pa la sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: shes rab dman pa la sbyor ba ni /
translated: The application to those of inferior wisdom is

original: nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba'i gtam ston cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba'i gtam ston cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: to teach the discourses of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: bdag med pa tsam ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa tsam ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they teach only the selflessness of the person.🔽The application to those of perverse wisdom is

original: shes rab 'chal ba la sbyor ba ni zab mo'i gtam 'chab cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab 'chal ba la sbyor ba ni zab mo'i gtam 'chab cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: to conceal the profound discourses.

original: zab mo ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zab mo ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The profound refers to emptiness and so forth.

original: gtam sna tshogs pa ni rgyan po'i gtam la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gtam sna tshogs pa ni rgyan po'i gtam la sogs pa'o //
translated: The various stories are the stories of gamblers and so on.

original: sgrub pa'i dbang du byas pa ni lnga ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i dbang du byas pa ni lnga ste /
translated: The five that are based on practice are:

original: sbyor ba la mi brtson pa dang / sbyor ba nyams pa la brtson pa dang / sbyong ba mi mthun pa la brtson pa dang / sbyor ba dang bral ba la brtson pa dang / sbyor ba ngan pa la brtson pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba la mi brtson pa dang / sbyor ba nyams pa la brtson pa dang / sbyong ba mi mthun pa la brtson pa dang / sbyor ba dang bral ba la brtson pa dang / sbyor ba ngan pa la brtson pa'o //
translated: not striving for the practice, striving for the practice that is defective, striving for the practice that is not compatible, striving for the practice that is incomplete, and striving for the practice that is faulty.

original: sbyor ba la mi brtson pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: sbyor ba la mi brtson pa ni gnyis te /
translated: Not striving for the practice is twofold:

original: rang gi lam sgrub pa la mi brtson pa ni /🔽lam @256a * //
analyzed: rang gi lam sgrub pa la mi brtson pa ni / lam @256a * //
translated: Not striving to accomplish one’s own path is

original: shes kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: shes kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: the verse that begins, “Even if one knows the path.”

original: lam ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
analyzed: lam ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
translated: The path is the six perfections.

original: gzhan lam du khrid pa la mi brtson pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan lam du khrid pa la mi brtson pa ni /
translated: Not striving to lead others to the path is

original: rab tu brtson pa'i bsngags pa brjod kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu brtson pa'i bsngags pa brjod kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: the verse that begins, “Even if one praises the qualities of striving.”

original: mi sbyor ba ni khrid par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi sbyor ba ni khrid par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Not applying oneself is not leading others to the path.

original: sbyor ba nyams pa la brtson pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: sbyor ba nyams pa la brtson pa ni gnyis te /
translated: Striving for the practice that is defective is twofold:

original: rang gi spyod pa mi sgrub pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi spyod pa mi sgrub pa ni /
translated: Not accomplishing one’s own practice is🔽the verse that begins, “Even if one has the aspiration.”

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba sogs kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba sogs kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The root of virtue and so on means and so forth.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni theg pa chen po'i lam du 'gro bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni theg pa chen po'i lam du 'gro bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The thought of awakening is the cause of going on the path of the Great Vehicle.

original: rang gi spyod pa la gzhan mi sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: rang gi spyod pa la gzhan mi sbyor ba ni /
translated: Not applying others to one's own conduct is

original: lhag mthong gi rnal 'byor dang ldan par gnas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi rnal 'byor dang ldan par gnas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: dwelling in the yoga of insight and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan gces su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan gces su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattva is the one who cherishes others.

original: sbyor ba mi mthun pa la brtson pa ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba mi mthun pa la brtson pa ni /
translated: Striving in incompatible application is

original: nyon mongs pa ma lus pa zad par tshol zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma lus pa zad par tshol zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: seeking to exhaust all afflictions and so on.

original: bsam pa dang sbyor ba mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa dang sbyor ba mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is incompatible in terms of intention and application.

original: sbyor ba dang bral ba la brtson pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang bral ba la brtson pa ni gnyis te /
translated: Striving in the absence of application is twofold.

original: gzhan don sgrub pa'i thabs snying rje dang bral ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan don sgrub pa'i thabs snying rje dang bral ba ni /
translated: The absence of compassion, the means of accomplishing the welfare of others, is

original: shes rab kyis rnam par dpyod cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyis rnam par dpyod cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: analyzed with wisdom and so on.

original: rang don bsgrub pa'i sbyor ba thabs ma lus pa dang bral ba ni thabs dang mi ldan par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rang don bsgrub pa'i sbyor ba thabs ma lus pa dang bral ba ni thabs dang mi ldan par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Lacking all the methods of application for accomplishing one's own goal is called not having the means and so on.

original: thabs la mkhas pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means being devoid of skill in means.

original: sbyor ba ngan pa la brtson pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ngan pa la brtson pa ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of striving in bad application:

original: brtson par bya ba ma yin pa la brtson pa ni /
analyzed: brtson par bya ba ma yin pa la brtson pa ni /
translated: Striving in what should not be striven for is

original: sde snod mi tshol gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sde snod mi tshol gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: not seeking the scriptural collections and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams so //
translated: The Bodhisattva canon is the six perfections and the means of gathering others.

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan ni chad par lta ba dag go //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan ni chad par lta ba dag go //
translated: The Lokayata is the view of annihilation.

original: brtson par byas pa la log par brtson pa ni mang du thos kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: brtson par byas pa la log par brtson pa ni mang du thos kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Wrong striving in what should be striven for is being learned but concealing the Dharma and so on.

original: mang du thos pa ni brtson par bya ba yin yang /
analyzed: mang du thos pa ni brtson par bya ba yin yang /
translated: Being learned is what should be striven for.

original: chos 'chab pa ni log pa yin pas /
analyzed: chos 'chab pa ni log pa yin pas /
translated: Concealing the Dharma is wrong,

original: log par brtson pa'o //
analyzed: log par brtson pa'o //
translated: so it is wrong striving.

original: de ltar dman pa la mos pa dag ni /
analyzed: de ltar dman pa la mos pa dag ni /
translated: Thus, those with inferior aspiration

original: dngos pos lta bas na 'jig rten pa'i dgos pa'i zhal ta byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dngos pos lta bas na 'jig rten pa'i dgos pa'i zhal ta byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: He is called a “worldly man” because he is occupied with the affairs of the world.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni mang du thos pa las skyes kyi /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni mang du thos pa las skyes kyi /
translated: The perfect Buddha is born from much learning,

original: dngos po yongs su 'dzin pa las ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po yongs su 'dzin pa las ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: not from the possession of things.

original: dman pa'i spyod pa la spyod pa dag ni dman pa'i grogs po la brten pas /
analyzed: dman pa'i spyod pa la spyod pa dag ni dman pa'i grogs po la brten pas /
translated: Those who practice the conduct of the inferior, relying on inferior friends,

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos smra ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos smra ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: the bodhisattva should not even talk with them, much less rely on them.

original: skal pa mnyam pa ni theg pa chen po'i bgo skal la spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa ni theg pa chen po'i bgo skal la spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Equal fortune” means sharing the fortune of the Great Vehicle.

original: @256b dman pa'i grogs po la brten pa dag ni dman pa la bag med par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: @256b dman pa'i grogs po la brten pa dag ni dman pa la bag med par 'gyur bas /
translated: Those who rely on inferior friends become careless about the inferior.🔽Therefore, the bodhisattva should not rely on them.

original: gang gi tshe brgya byin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe brgya byin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “When Indra, etc.”

original: 'jig rten skyong ba ni yul 'khor srung la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten skyong ba ni yul 'khor srung la sogs pa'o //
translated: The world guardians are Dhṛtarāṣṭra and so on.

original: de ltar na yang dag pa'i lam las zlog par byed pa bdud kyi las kyi go rims 'di ni srid pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de ltar na yang dag pa'i lam las zlog par byed pa bdud kyi las kyi go rims 'di ni srid pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus, the order of Māra’s actions is just this: turning away from the true path.

original: da ni gzhan la brnyas pa'i nyes pa bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni gzhan la brnyas pa'i nyes pa bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now, the fault of despising others will be explained.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzugs bzang zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzugs bzang zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The passage beginning The bodhisattva who is handsome, etc.,

original: gzhan la brnyas pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gzhan la brnyas pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: is the cause of despising others.

original: de la lhun legs pa ni gzugs bzang ba'o //
analyzed: de la lhun legs pa ni gzugs bzang ba'o //
translated: There, well-proportioned means having a good figure.

original: byad legs pa ni mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: byad legs pa ni mdzes pa'o //
translated: Well-formed means being beautiful.

original: phyug pa ni 'byor pa sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyug pa ni 'byor pa sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: Wealthy means having various resources.🔽Rich means having much gold, etc.

original: longs spyod pas nor chab ni gsar la sogs pa mang ba'o //
analyzed: longs spyod pas nor chab ni gsar la sogs pa mang ba'o //
translated: Having many possessions means having various things.

original: longs spyod ni 'phral gyi dgos pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod ni 'phral gyi dgos pa'o //
translated: Possessions are immediate necessities.

original: nor mang ba ni gser la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: nor mang ba ni gser la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: Having many treasures means having various things.

original: mdzod ni sna tshogs pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: mdzod ni sna tshogs pa'i gnas so //
translated: Storehouses are places for various things.

original: bang ba ni sna re re'i gnas so //🔽rus ni ba ra dva dza la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bang ba ni sna re re'i gnas so // rus ni ba ra dva dza la sogs pa'o //
translated: Granaries are places for each individual thing.🔽Lineage is the family of Vṛṣṇi, etc.

original: rigs ni rgyal rigs la sogs pa'o //🔽g-yog ni go re long ngo //
analyzed: rigs ni rgyal rigs la sogs pa'o // g-yog ni go re long ngo //
translated: Caste is the kṣatriya caste, etc.🔽Servants are those who do menial labor.

original: 'khor ni rjes su 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor ni rjes su 'tsho ba'o //
translated: Attendants are those who follow.

original: bsod nams ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Merit is giving, etc.

original: ye shes ni thob pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni thob pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is attainment, etc.

original: brtson pa ni lhur len pa'o //
analyzed: brtson pa ni lhur len pa'o //
translated: Diligence is enthusiasm.

original: dbang phyug ni rgyal po'i sa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug ni rgyal po'i sa la gnas pa'o //
translated: The powerful are those who are on the level of kings.

original: rgyags pa ni dregs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyags pa ni dregs pa'o //
translated: Arrogance is haughtiness.

original: bag med pa ni brtsam pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bag med pa ni brtsam pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: Carelessness is not being engaged.

original: gang la brnyas she na ;
analyzed: gang la brnyas she na ;
translated: With regard to whom is there contempt?

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag rab tu byung bar gtogs pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag rab tu byung bar gtogs pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said that it is with regard to those bodhisattvas who are renunciates.

original: rab tu byung ba dag ni rten mchog yin pas na /🔽gang dag khyim na gnas par byed bzhin du //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba dag ni rten mchog yin pas na / gang dag khyim na gnas par byed bzhin du //
translated: Because renunciates are the best of supports,🔽there is no buddha who has attained

original: byang chub dam pa'i mchog 'di thob pa yi //🔽sangs rgyas gang yang sngon chad ma byung ste //
analyzed: byang chub dam pa'i mchog 'di thob pa yi // sangs rgyas gang yang sngon chad ma byung ste //
translated: this supreme, excellent enlightenment🔽while remaining in a household.🔽There is no buddha who has arisen or who abides in the future

original: ma 'ongs pa na mi 'byung gnas pa med //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na mi 'byung gnas pa med //
translated: apart from having gone forth from the household.

original: ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽khyim gyi gnas nas mngon par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro // khyim gyi gnas nas mngon par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what is said.🔽“Going forth from the household” means

original: khyim spangs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyim spangs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: abandoning the household.

original: khyim gyi gnas ni sdug bsngal du ma'i gnas yin pas na /
analyzed: khyim gyi gnas ni sdug bsngal du ma'i gnas yin pas na /
translated: Because the household is the basis of many sufferings,

original: 'phags pa drag shul can gyis zhus pa las smad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa drag shul can gyis zhus pa las smad pa lta bu'o //
translated: it is as it is said in the noble Inquiry of Ugra.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su tshol ba la brtson pa ni /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su tshol ba la brtson pa ni /
translated: The one who is diligent in seeking the accumulation of wisdom

original: de gcor byed pa'o //
analyzed: de gcor byed pa'o //
translated: is the one who is engaged in that.

original: 'o na tshogs gnyis dag ni lam ma yin nam ci'i phyir 'di mchog ce na /
analyzed: 'o na tshogs gnyis dag ni lam ma yin nam ci'i phyir 'di mchog ce na /
translated: Well, aren't the two accumulations the path? Why is this supreme?

original: bden mod kyi 'on kyang 'byor ba mtha' dag spangs pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: bden mod kyi 'on kyang 'byor ba mtha' dag spangs pa nyid kyis /
translated: Indeed, that is true. However, by abandoning all the enjoyments,

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'i phyir te /
translated: the accumulation of merit is gathered.

original: de lta ma yin na lung las kyang rab tu byung bas zang zing gi sbyin @257a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na lung las kyang rab tu byung bas zang zing gi sbyin @257a * //
translated: Otherwise, even according to the scriptures, since the renunciate is not permitted to give material gifts,

original: pa ma gnang bas ji ltar tshogs sogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: pa ma gnang bas ji ltar tshogs sogs par 'gyur /
translated: how will the accumulation be gathered?

original: de'i phyir na tshogs gnyis dang ldan par 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir na tshogs gnyis dang ldan par 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, it is asserted that the two accumulations are possessed.

original: gang gi phyir brnyas she na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir brnyas she na /
translated: Why is he despised?

original: sha dang khrag skams pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sha dang khrag skams pa zhes bya ste /
translated: He is called one with dried up flesh and blood,

original: dus ma yin pa'i kha zas la sogs pa spang ba'i phyir ro //🔽rke ba ni ring ba'o //🔽nyam chung ba ni lus kyi mtha' med pa'o //
analyzed: dus ma yin pa'i kha zas la sogs pa spang ba'i phyir ro // rke ba ni ring ba'o // nyam chung ba ni lus kyi mtha' med pa'o //
translated: because he abandons untimely food and so on.🔽He is emaciated because he is very thin.🔽He is weak because his body is without strength.

original: lus rtsas yogs pa ni ha cang yang rke ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus rtsas yogs pa ni ha cang yang rke ba'i phyir ro //
translated: His body is covered with veins because he is very emaciated.

original: de ltar ci'i phyir lus gdung zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ci'i phyir lus gdung zhe na /
translated: Why does he torment his body in this way?🔽He is like one whose head or clothes are on fire,

original: mgo dang gos la me 'bar ba bzhin du zhes smos te shin tu brtson zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mgo dang gos la me 'bar ba bzhin du zhes smos te shin tu brtson zhes bya ba'o //
translated: that is, he is very diligent.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni dge ba'i chos yongs su tshol ba la brtson pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni dge ba'i chos yongs su tshol ba la brtson pa'o //
translated: One who has begun striving is one who is diligent in seeking wholesome states.

original: theg pa chen po dag ni dngos po gtso bo yin pas rke zhing nyam chung ba mdog ngan cing mi sdug par rig nas brnyas pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po dag ni dngos po gtso bo yin pas rke zhing nyam chung ba mdog ngan cing mi sdug par rig nas brnyas pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: Since the Great Vehicle is the principal thing, he is despised, knowing that it is weak, of poor color, and ugly.

original: phyi rol la spyad pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang thal ba'i nang du me byung ba lta bur nyes pa dang bcas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyi rol la spyad pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang thal ba'i nang du me byung ba lta bur nyes pa dang bcas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Even though he is engaged in external activities, he is nevertheless faulty, like a fire hidden by ashes. This is the meaning of the phrase, “he is despised.

original: de la snyam du sems pa zhes bya bas ni bsam pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la snyam du sems pa zhes bya bas ni bsam pa bstan to //
translated: ” The phrase, “he thinks to himself,” shows his attitude.

original: legs par bshad pa nyan mi 'dod ces bya bas sbyor ba bstan to //
analyzed: legs par bshad pa nyan mi 'dod ces bya bas sbyor ba bstan to //
translated: The phrase, “he does not want to hear good advice,” shows his application.

original: ches dman zhing rmugs pa zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: ches dman zhing rmugs pa zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The phrase, “he is very low and dull”

original: spyir zhing bag med par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spyir zhing bag med par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that he is generally heedless.

original: da ni bar du gcod pa'i chos bzhi bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bar du gcod pa'i chos bzhi bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the four dharmas that are obstacles,

original: bzhi gang zhe na zhes smos te /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na zhes smos te /
translated: it says, “What are the four?”

original: log par brjod pa ni tshigs su bcad pa ngan pa sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: log par brjod pa ni tshigs su bcad pa ngan pa sgrogs pa'o //
translated: Evil speech is proclaiming bad verses.

original: 'di dag byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa dang 'brel pa ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa dang 'brel pa ci mngon zhe na /
translated: If one asks, “How are these connected with the bodhisattva vow?”

original: thams cad la byang chub sems dpa' zhes smos pa'i phyir dang / 'dir yang theg pa chen po'i bar du gcod par bstan pa'i phyir dang / yang yid ches pa'i lung bdag gi bla ma brgyud pa las 'di ltar thos pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: thams cad la byang chub sems dpa' zhes smos pa'i phyir dang / 'dir yang theg pa chen po'i bar du gcod par bstan pa'i phyir dang / yang yid ches pa'i lung bdag gi bla ma brgyud pa las 'di ltar thos pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is because in all of them the word bodhisattva is mentioned, and here they are taught as obstacles to the Mahāyāna, and also because of the trustworthy scripture that I heard in this way from my own guru’s lineage.

original: ci'i phyir lung tshad ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lung tshad ma yin zhe na /
translated: If one asks, “Why is scripture valid?”

original: shin tu lkog tu 'gyur ba'i don dag la ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shin tu lkog tu 'gyur ba'i don dag la ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: It is because direct perception and inference do not engage with extremely hidden objects.

original: tshad ma rnam 'grel las kyang /
analyzed: tshad ma rnam 'grel las kyang /
translated: The Commentary on Valid Knowledge says:🔽The one who moves to the third stage

original: gnas gsum par ni 'pho ba dang // bstan bcos len pa rigs ldan yin //
analyzed: gnas gsum par ni 'pho ba dang // bstan bcos len pa rigs ldan yin //
translated: is a suitable recipient for the treatise.

original: zhes 'byung ba dang / yang /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba dang / yang /
translated: And also:

original: lung ma rtogs pa'i rtog ge la //
analyzed: lung ma rtogs pa'i rtog ge la //
translated: The non-Buddhist philosophers are not aware of this.🔽

original: chos rnams rnam par gnas ma yin //
analyzed: chos rnams rnam par gnas ma yin //
translated: The teachings are not established for the reasoning of those who do not understand the scriptures.

original: drang srong rnams kyi shes pa gang //🔽de yang lung gi sngon du song //
analyzed: drang srong rnams kyi shes pa gang // de yang lung gi sngon du song //
translated: The knowledge of the sages🔽also depends on the scriptures.

original: zhes gsungs pas lung nyid tshad mar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas lung nyid tshad mar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the scriptures themselves are authoritative.

original: mdo kun las btus pa'i bshad pa /
analyzed: mdo kun las btus pa'i bshad pa /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the Compendium of Sutras.

original: lung gi tshad mas sbyar ba las bar du gcod @257b pa'i chos spang ba rnyed par dka' ba'i gtam brjod pa ste bdun pa'o /
analyzed: lung gi tshad mas sbyar ba las bar du gcod @257b pa'i chos spang ba rnyed par dka' ba'i gtam brjod pa ste bdun pa'o /
translated: This is the seventh chapter of the treatise, called The Explanation of the Application of Scriptural Authority, which discusses the avoidance of obstacles and the difficulty of attaining the teachings.

original: // / da ni khyim pa rnams kyi sgrub pa bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: // / da ni khyim pa rnams kyi sgrub pa bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now, the practice for householders will be explained.

original: de la yang dag pa'i sgrub pa bstan pa ni 'di dag las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i sgrub pa bstan pa ni 'di dag las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Regarding that, the teaching on right practice is stated from from these and so on.

original: chos ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'o //
translated: Dharma refers to the bodhisattva vow.

original: nan tan gyis bsrung ba ni mi nyams par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nan tan gyis bsrung ba ni mi nyams par byed pa'o //
translated: Practice means to guard it without decline.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa ma yin pa la khyim ji ltar gnang zhes rgol ba ni ci 'dra zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa ma yin pa la khyim ji ltar gnang zhes rgol ba ni ci 'dra zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The objection is raised: If the superior intention is not pure, how can householders be allowed to [practice]? What kind of [practice] is it?

original: lan ni 'bad pa yod kyang khyim spang bar mi nus pas bstan to //
analyzed: lan ni 'bad pa yod kyang khyim spang bar mi nus pas bstan to //
translated: The answer is that even though one may try, one cannot abandon the household.

original: 'o na gzhan gyi bud med la log par mi sgrub pa yang 'bad pa yod kyang mi nus pa'i phyir ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gzhan gyi bud med la log par mi sgrub pa yang 'bad pa yod kyang mi nus pa'i phyir ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Well, then, since one cannot avoid sexual misconduct with another’s wife even though one tries, one would not incur a downfall.

original: de ni ma yin te gzhan gyi chung ma la bgrod pa ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba chen po yin la /🔽khyim gyi gnas ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te gzhan gyi chung ma la bgrod pa ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba chen po yin la / khyim gyi gnas ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: That is not so, because sexual intercourse with another’s wife is a natural, grave offense,🔽and the household life is taught to be an offense that is proscribed.

original: khyim bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: khyim bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The passage beginning with “Householder” teaches this.

original: skyes bu dam pa ni sngon gyi byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa ni sngon gyi byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: A holy person is a previous bodhisattva.

original: las ni tshul khrims rjes su bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: las ni tshul khrims rjes su bsrung ba'o //
translated: His action is to protect morality.

original: skyes bu ngan pa ni tshe 'di'i bde ba 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu ngan pa ni tshe 'di'i bde ba 'dod pa'o //
translated: An evil person is one who desires the happiness of this life.

original: las ni kha na ma tho ba'o //
analyzed: las ni kha na ma tho ba'o //
translated: His action is an offense.

original: chos kyis longs spyod tshol ba ni srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pas gzhan la mi 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyis longs spyod tshol ba ni srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pas gzhan la mi 'tshe ba'o //
translated: Seeking enjoyments through Dharma is not harming others by killing and so on.

original: mthun pa ni mchod rten la sogs pa dang ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: mthun pa ni mchod rten la sogs pa dang ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: Agreeable means not displeasing to others.

original: yang dag pa ni srang la sgyu byed pa la sogs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ni srang la sgyu byed pa la sogs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Correct means not cheating with false weights and measures, and so on.

original: de dag gis ni longs spyod tshol ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis ni longs spyod tshol ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //

original: longs spyod pa'i dbang du byas pas ni /
analyzed: longs spyod pa'i dbang du byas pas ni /
translated: From the point of view of enjoying them, it says:

original: gzhan la 'tshe ba mi byed de //
analyzed: gzhan la 'tshe ba mi byed de //
translated: One does not harm others.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: And so on.

original: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes ni myur du 'bral ba'i bsam pa'o ;
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes ni myur du 'bral ba'i bsam pa'o ;
translated: The perception of impermanence is the thought of quick separation.

original: / snying po len pa ni /
analyzed: / snying po len pa ni /
translated: Taking the essence is as follows:

original: pha ma la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: pha ma la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: One should think of one's parents.

analyzed: gtong ba 'phel ba ni sbyin pa'i 'bras bu yod par byed pa'o //
translated: Increasing giving is making the result of giving exist.

analyzed: log par sgrub pa spang ba ni /
translated: Abandoning wrong practice is as follows:

analyzed: ming chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: dman pa la zhen pas mi gtsang ba'i srin bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dman pa la zhen pas mi gtsang ba'i srin bu lta bu'o //
translated: They are like worms in filth, because they are attached to what is base.

original: snyigs ma len pa ni smad pa 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: snyigs ma len pa ni smad pa 'dod pa'o //
translated: They are takers of dregs, because they desire what is despised.

original: brkam pa ni ha cang zhen pa'o //
analyzed: brkam pa ni ha cang zhen pa'o //
translated: They are greedy, because they are very attached.

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa spangs pas na lha dang mi'i chos las nyams pa'o /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa spangs pas na lha dang mi'i chos las nyams pa'o /
translated: They are fallen from the Dharma of gods and men, because they have abandoned generosity, morality, and tolerance.

original: kha na ma tho ba la mi 'dzem pas khrel dang ngo tsha bor ba'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba la mi 'dzem pas khrel dang ngo tsha bor ba'o //
translated: They are without shame and modesty, because they are not ashamed of their sins.

original: log par 'tsho bas na ngan par smad pa'i 'tsho ba can no //
analyzed: log par 'tsho bas na ngan par smad pa'i 'tsho ba can no //
translated: They have a contemptible livelihood, because they have wrong livelihood.

original: dam pa'i spyod pa ma yin pas mkhas pas smad pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i spyod pa ma yin pas mkhas pas smad pa'o //
translated: They are despised by the wise, because they do not have the conduct of holy ones.

original: bya ba mi shes pas byis pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba mi shes pas byis pa'o //
translated: They are fools, because they do not know what should be done.

original: de'i rjes su 'jug pa la brten pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'jug pa la brten pa'o //
translated: They are dependent, because they depend on those who follow them.

original: kha na ma tho ba la dga' bas sdig pa'i bsam pa can no //🔽kha na ma tho ba can dang 'grogs pas brten pa'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba la dga' bas sdig pa'i bsam pa can no // kha na ma tho ba can dang 'grogs pas brten pa'o //
translated: They have sinful thoughts, because they delight in sin.🔽They are companions, because they associate with sinners.

original: kha na ma tho ba byed pas kun du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba byed pas kun du 'jug pa'o //
translated: They are engaged, because they commit sins.

original: kha na ma tho ba la mos pas gzhol ba'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba la mos pas gzhol ba'o //
translated: They are inclined, because they are devoted to sin.

original: glags rnyed pas bud med kyis tshugs pa'o //
analyzed: glags rnyed pas bud med kyis tshugs pa'o //
translated: They are controlled by women, because they are vulnerable.

original: rang dbang du byas pas bud med kyis 'khol ba'o //🔽'khrig pa'i chos la zhen pas dbang du song ba'o //
analyzed: rang dbang du byas pas bud med kyis 'khol ba'o // 'khrig pa'i chos la zhen pas dbang du song ba'o //
translated: Because of being independent, women rule.🔽Because of attachment to sexual intercourse, they are under the control.

original: 'khrig pa'i chos la mos pas gzhol ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrig pa'i chos la mos pas gzhol ba'o //
translated: Because of being devoted to sexual intercourse, they are inclined.

original: mi gtong bas 'grogs @258b pa'o //
analyzed: mi gtong bas 'grogs @258b pa'o //
translated: Because of not giving up, they are associated.

original: de nyid ni rma'i sgo'i spyod yul can zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni rma'i sgo'i spyod yul can zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That is what is meant by they are the domain of the door of wounds, and so on.

original: de'i phyir phan 'dogs pa dang yon tan gyi zhing yongs su spong bas pha ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir phan 'dogs pa dang yon tan gyi zhing yongs su spong bas pha ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because of abandoning the field of benefit and virtues, and so on, is said.

original: des 'bras bu gang myang zhe na /
analyzed: des 'bras bu gang myang zhe na /
translated: What result does that lead to?

original: sems can dmyal ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The hells, and so on, is said.

original: pha ma dag ni ji ltar phan 'dogs pa'i zhing du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: pha ma dag ni ji ltar phan 'dogs pa'i zhing du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do parents become a field of benefit?

original: dka' ba byas shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dka' ba byas shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because of the difficulty they have gone through, and so on.🔽By what supreme [being] is that condemned?

original: de lta bu de dam pa gang gis smad pas na rgyal po chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu de dam pa gang gis smad pas na rgyal po chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The great king, and so on, is said.

original: de nyid nges don gyi lung bstan pa'i sgo nas bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid nges don gyi lung bstan pa'i sgo nas bsdu ba ni /
translated: The summary by way of the definitive meaning prophecy of that is:🔽 🔽The one who is the supreme field of benefit and virtues, and so on.

original: zla ba sgron ma'i mdo las kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zla ba sgron ma'i mdo las kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Candrapradīpa Sūtra also says,

original: da ni 'dod pa'i nyes pa de nyid spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'dod pa'i nyes pa de nyid spang ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to abandon just those faults of desire,

original: mi sdug pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mi sdug pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: he says, “One should also apply to ugliness.”

original: mi sdug pa ni 'dod chags kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir de bstan te /
analyzed: mi sdug pa ni 'dod chags kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir de bstan te /
translated: He teaches ugliness because it is the antidote to desire.

original: de la mi sdug pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: de la mi sdug pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: There are six kinds of ugliness:

original: 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags kyi dbang du byas pa mi gtsang ba'i mi sdug pa dang / mi brtan pas rab tu 'jig pa'i mi sdug pa ste /
analyzed: 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags kyi dbang du byas pa mi gtsang ba'i mi sdug pa dang / mi brtan pas rab tu 'jig pa'i mi sdug pa ste /
translated: The ugliness of impurity, from the perspective of sexual desire; the ugliness of complete destruction, from the perspective of impermanence; the ugliness of suffering, from the perspective of the suffering of pain; the ugliness of lowliness, from the perspective of the lower realms; the ugliness of inferiority, from the perspective of the higher realms; and the ugliness of the unattractive, from the perspective of the unattractive.

original: don gyi skabs 'dir ni 'khrig pa'i gnyen po lus dang sems kyi tshor ba sdug bsngal ba'i dbang du byas pa sdug bsngal gyi mi sdug pa dang / dman pa'i gzhi dang dman pa'i khams gang yin pa 'dod pa'i khams lta bu'i dbang du byas pa ngan pa'i mi sdug pa dang /
analyzed: don gyi skabs 'dir ni 'khrig pa'i gnyen po lus dang sems kyi tshor ba sdug bsngal ba'i dbang du byas pa sdug bsngal gyi mi sdug pa dang / dman pa'i gzhi dang dman pa'i khams gang yin pa 'dod pa'i khams lta bu'i dbang du byas pa ngan pa'i mi sdug pa dang /
translated: In this context, the ugliness of suffering is from the perspective of the suffering of pain, which is the antidote to sexual desire, in terms of the physical and mental feelings. The ugliness of lowliness is from the perspective of the lower realms, which are the basis of lowliness. The ugliness of inferiority is from the perspective of the desire realm, which is an inferior realm.

original: gzugs med pa la ltos te gzugs kyi khams sam /
analyzed: gzugs med pa la ltos te gzugs kyi khams sam /
translated: The ugliness of the unattractive is from the perspective of the form realm, in comparison with the formless realm.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la ltos te srid pa'i rtse mo man chad lta bu ltos pa'i mi sdug pa dang / khams gsum gyi kun du sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba la sogs pa kun du nyon mongs pa'i mi sdug pa dang / phung po lnga mi rtag cing mi brtan pa rab tu 'jig pa'i mi sdug pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la ltos te srid pa'i rtse mo man chad lta bu ltos pa'i mi sdug pa dang / khams gsum gyi kun du sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba la sogs pa kun du nyon mongs pa'i mi sdug pa dang / phung po lnga mi rtag cing mi brtan pa rab tu 'jig pa'i mi sdug pa ste /
translated: The unpleasantness of the impermanence of the five aggregates is that they are impermanent, unstable, and perishable.

original: don gyi skabs 'dir ni 'khrig pa'i gnyen po yin pas mi gtsang ba'i mi sdug pa la dgongs so //
analyzed: don gyi skabs 'dir ni 'khrig pa'i gnyen po yin pas mi gtsang ba'i mi sdug pa la dgongs so //
translated: In this context, the unpleasantness of impurity is intended as the antidote to attachment.

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is of two types:

original: nang la brten pa dang / phyi rol la brten pa'o //
analyzed: nang la brten pa dang / phyi rol la brten pa'o //
translated: that which is based on the internal and that which is based on the external.

original: de la nang la brten pa mi gtsang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nang la brten pa mi gtsang ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the unpleasantness of impurity based on the internal?

original: rdzas sum cu rtsa drug ste /
analyzed: rdzas sum cu rtsa drug ste /
translated: It is the thirty-six substances:

original: skra dang spu dang sen mo so //
analyzed: skra dang spu dang sen mo so //
translated: hair of the head, hair of the body, nails,

original: glog pa dri ma pags pa sha /🔽rus pa chu rgyus mkhal ma rtsa //
analyzed: glog pa dri ma pags pa sha / rus pa chu rgyus mkhal ma rtsa //
translated: teeth, dirt, skin, flesh,🔽bones, marrow, kidney, heart,

original: snying dang mchin pa glo ba dang // rgyu ma gnye ma pho ba'o //
analyzed: snying dang mchin pa glo ba dang // rgyu ma gnye ma pho ba'o //
translated: liver, lungs, intestines, mesentery, stomach,

original: mcher pa phyi sa mchi ma rdul //
analyzed: mcher pa phyi sa mchi ma rdul //
translated: spleen, excrement, tears, sweat,

original: mchil ma snabs dang chu ser zhag / rkang dang tshil dang bad kan mkhris //
analyzed: mchil ma snabs dang chu ser zhag / rkang dang tshil dang bad kan mkhris //
translated: urine, and the thirty-six impure substances🔽are held to be the internal objects of meditation.🔽The meditation on the external objects of meditation is as follows:🔽The meditation on the repulsive is of two kinds:🔽the meditation on the repulsive in terms of the stages of decomposition,

original: rnag dang khrag dang glad spri dang // glad @259a * //
analyzed: rnag dang khrag dang glad spri dang // glad @259a * //
translated: and the meditation on the repulsive in terms of the individual parts of the body.🔽The meditation on the repulsive in terms of the stages of decomposition is as follows:🔽The meditation on the repulsive in terms of the individual parts of the body is as follows:🔽The meditation on the repulsive in terms of the individual parts of the body is of two kinds:🔽the meditation on the repulsive in terms of the thirty-six impure substances,🔽and the meditation on the repulsive in terms of the skeleton.

original: rgyas dang ni gcin dag dang // mi gtsang rdzas ni sum cu drug / nang la brten pa yin par 'dod //
analyzed: rgyas dang ni gcin dag dang // mi gtsang rdzas ni sum cu drug / nang la brten pa yin par 'dod //
translated: The meditation on the repulsive in terms of the thirty-six impure substances is as follows:🔽The meditation on the repulsive in terms of the skeleton is of two kinds:🔽the meditation on the skeleton that is connected to one’s own body,🔽and the meditation on the skeleton that is separate from one’s own body.🔽The meditation on the repulsive in terms of the skeleton that is connected to one’s own body is as follows:

original: rnam par bsngos shing rnags pa dang // 'bus gzhigs rnam par bam pa dang // zos shing dmar dang rnam 'thor dang // rus gong keng rus rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: rnam par bsngos shing rnags pa dang // 'bus gzhigs rnam par bam pa dang // zos shing dmar dang rnam 'thor dang // rus gong keng rus rnam pa gnyis //
translated: The meditation on the repulsive in terms of the skeleton that is separate from one’s own body is as follows:

original: de bzhin mi gtsang gos pa dang // bsti ba ljan ljin gang ba rnams //
analyzed: de bzhin mi gtsang gos pa dang // bsti ba ljan ljin gang ba rnams //
translated: The meditation on the repulsive in terms of the individual parts of the body is as follows:🔽The meditation on the repulsive in terms of the individual parts of the body is of two kinds:

original: mi gtsang phyi la brten pa ste //
analyzed: mi gtsang phyi la brten pa ste //
translated: the meditation on the repulsive in terms of the thirty-six impure substances,

original: bsgom pa'i dmigs pa yin par 'dod //🔽ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i dmigs pa yin par 'dod // ces 'byung ngo //
translated: and the meditation on the repulsive in terms of the skeleton.🔽The meditation on the repulsive in terms of the thirty-six impure substances is as follows:🔽The meditation on the repulsive in terms of the skeleton is of two kinds:🔽the meditation on the skeleton that is connected to one’s own body,🔽and the meditation on the skeleton that is separate from one’s own body.🔽The meditation on the repulsive in terms of the skeleton that is connected to one’s own body is as follows:

original: de la nang la brten pa'i mi gtsang ba'i mi sdug pa la dmigs pa ni nang gi 'dod pa rnams 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags las sems rnam par spyod par byed do //
analyzed: de la nang la brten pa'i mi gtsang ba'i mi sdug pa la dmigs pa ni nang gi 'dod pa rnams 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags las sems rnam par spyod par byed do //
translated: The meditation on the repulsive in terms of the skeleton that is separate from one’s own body is as follows:

original: de la phyi rol la brten pa'i mi gtsang ba'i mi sdug pa stong pa nyid la dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: de la phyi rol la brten pa'i mi gtsang ba'i mi sdug pa stong pa nyid la dmigs pa ni /
translated: The contemplation of the emptiness of the impurity of the external is as follows.

original: phyi rol gyi 'dod pa rnams la 'khrig pa la 'dun pa 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa /🔽kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / reg pa dang / nye bar spyod pa'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa las sems rnam par spyod par byed de /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi 'dod pa rnams la 'khrig pa la 'dun pa 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa / kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / reg pa dang / nye bar spyod pa'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa las sems rnam par spyod par byed de /
translated: The mind is made to engage by means of the four types of sexual desire and the desire for the objects of desire, which are external.🔽The four types of sexual desire are the desire for color, shape, touch, and enjoyment.🔽The mind is made to engage by means of the contemplation of the bloated, the livid, the festering, the cut up, the gnawed, and the scattered.

original: de la / rnam par bsngos shing rnags pa dang // 'bus gzhigs rnam par bam pa dang // zos shing zhes bya ba yid la byed pas ni kha dog la chags pa spong bar byed do //
analyzed: de la / rnam par bsngos shing rnags pa dang // 'bus gzhigs rnam par bam pa dang // zos shing zhes bya ba yid la byed pas ni kha dog la chags pa spong bar byed do //
translated: The contemplation of the bloated and so on abandons attachment to color.

original: dmar dang zhes bya bas ni dbyibs kyi 'dod chags pa spong bar byed do //
analyzed: dmar dang zhes bya bas ni dbyibs kyi 'dod chags pa spong bar byed do //
translated: The contemplation of the pale and the red abandons attachment to shape.🔽The contemplation of the skeleton and the skeleton without flesh abandons attachment to touch.

original: rus gong dang / keng rus dang / rus pa'i keng rus yid la byed pa ni rig pa'i 'dod chags yongs su spong ngo //
analyzed: rus gong dang / keng rus dang / rus pa'i keng rus yid la byed pa ni rig pa'i 'dod chags yongs su spong ngo //
translated: The contemplation of the bones discarded in all directions abandons attachment to enjoyment.

original: rnam 'thor dang zhes bya bas ni nye bar spyod pa'i 'dod chags la sems rnam par sbyong bar byed do //🔽de lta bas na lung las kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis shi nas zhag gcig lon pa'am zhes pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam 'thor dang zhes bya bas ni nye bar spyod pa'i 'dod chags la sems rnam par sbyong bar byed do // de lta bas na lung las kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis shi nas zhag gcig lon pa'am zhes pa gsungs te /
translated: The phrase “scattered in all directions” purifies the mind of attachment to the enjoyment of material things.

original: de la shi nas zhag gcig lon pa'am bdun lon pa'i bar gyis dur khrod bya rog dang chun lag dang / bya rgod dang / khyi dang wa dag gis zos pa mthong nas zhes bya bas ni rnam par bsngos nas zos pa'i bar bstan to //
analyzed: de la shi nas zhag gcig lon pa'am bdun lon pa'i bar gyis dur khrod bya rog dang chun lag dang / bya rgod dang / khyi dang wa dag gis zos pa mthong nas zhes bya bas ni rnam par bsngos nas zos pa'i bar bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the Buddha said in the scriptures, “After death, for one day, or for seven days, or for a week, or for a fortnight, or for a month, or for six months, or for a year, or for two years, or for five years, or for ten years, or for a hundred years, or for a thousand years, or for a hundred thousand years, or for many hundreds of thousands of years, or for many hundreds of thousands of millions of years, or for many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of years, the bodies of the dead are seen to be eaten by crows, vultures, dogs, jackals, and worms.”

original: pags pa dang sha dang khrag dang chu rgyus kyi zungs med pa zhes bya bas ni rnam par dmar ba bstan to ;🔽/ dur khrod kyi rus pa gang dag mthong na zhes bya bas ni keng rus bstan to //
analyzed: pags pa dang sha dang khrag dang chu rgyus kyi zungs med pa zhes bya bas ni rnam par dmar ba bstan to ; / dur khrod kyi rus pa gang dag mthong na zhes bya bas ni keng rus bstan to //
translated: The phrase “without skin, flesh, or blood, and with the tendons and ligaments destroyed” refers to the stage of the “red” corpse.🔽The phrase “seeing the bones in the charnel ground” refers to the stage of the “skeleton.”

original: lag pa'i rus pa yang logs shig ces bya ba la sogs pa rnams kyis ni rnam par 'thor ba bstan to //
analyzed: lag pa'i rus pa yang logs shig ces bya ba la sogs pa rnams kyis ni rnam par 'thor ba bstan to //
translated: The phrase “the bones of the hands in one place, and the bones of the feet in another” refers to the stage of the “scattered bones.”

original: 'di nyid byang chub sems dpas bsgom par bya ba yin pas na /
analyzed: 'di nyid byang chub sems dpas bsgom par bya ba yin pas na /
translated: Since this is what the bodhisattva should cultivate,

original: lung las kyang rnam par bam pa mi dmigs @259b pa'i phyir rnam par bam pa'i 'du shes bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lung las kyang rnam par bam pa mi dmigs @259b pa'i phyir rnam par bam pa'i 'du shes bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the scriptures also say, “One should cultivate the perception of a bloated corpse, because one does not perceive a living being.”

original: 'dir ni smos par zad kyi rgyas par ni 'og nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir ni smos par zad kyi rgyas par ni 'og nas 'byung ngo //
translated: This is just a brief mention; a more extensive [discussion] will come later.

original: da ni mi dge ba bcu'i gnod par 'gyur ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: da ni mi dge ba bcu'i gnod par 'gyur ba bstan pa ni /
translated: Now, the harm of the ten non-virtues is taught:

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “It is like this…” and so on.

original: mi dge ba bcu ni srog gcod pa nas log par lta ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu ni srog gcod pa nas log par lta ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The ten non-virtues are from killing to wrong views.

original: de la srog gcod pa la sogs pa dag gi ni gzhi dang bsam pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / sbyor ba dang / mthar thug pa'i dbang gis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la srog gcod pa la sogs pa dag gi ni gzhi dang bsam pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / sbyor ba dang / mthar thug pa'i dbang gis rig par bya'o //
translated: There, the basis, intention, affliction, performance, and culmination of killing and so on should be understood.

original: de la srog gcod pa ni pha rol yin pa dang / srog chags su 'du shes pa dang / bsad pa'i bsam pa dang / brtsal ba byas pa dang / des shi nas gzhi la sogs pa'i khyad par las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la srog gcod pa ni pha rol yin pa dang / srog chags su 'du shes pa dang / bsad pa'i bsam pa dang / brtsal ba byas pa dang / des shi nas gzhi la sogs pa'i khyad par las rig par bya'o //
translated: The distinction of the basis is known from the distinction of the basis, and so on.

original: rigs dang / chos dang / rgyal mtshan gyis bsrungs pa'am /
analyzed: rigs dang / chos dang / rgyal mtshan gyis bsrungs pa'am /
translated: Or, it is when one kills a being protected by its caste, its religion, or its flag,

original: rang dbang ba'i yang dus ma yin pa dang / gnas ma yin pa dang / yul ma yin pa dang / yan lag ma yin pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: rang dbang ba'i yang dus ma yin pa dang / gnas ma yin pa dang / yul ma yin pa dang / yan lag ma yin pa la yang ngo //
translated: or a being protected by oneself, at the wrong time, in the wrong place, in the wrong manner, or with the wrong part of the body.

original: gzhan gyis yongs su bzung ba dang / der 'du shes pa dang / rgyu ba'i bsam pa dang / gnas nas gnas su spags pa las sdig pa'i khyad par ni rdzas de gang yin pa'i khyad par dang / sbyor ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi ma byin par len pa'i kha na ma tho ba rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis yongs su bzung ba dang / der 'du shes pa dang / rgyu ba'i bsam pa dang / gnas nas gnas su spags pa las sdig pa'i khyad par ni rdzas de gang yin pa'i khyad par dang / sbyor ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi ma byin par len pa'i kha na ma tho ba rig par bya'o //
translated: The distinction of the sin of taking what is not given is known from the distinction of the object, the distinction of the preparation, and so on.

original: bslu ba'i bsam pa dang / lta ba yid la bzhag nas don go ba la tshig gam lus kyi reg byed kyis go bar byas pa dang / the tshom za ba la nges par smras nas yang brdzun du smra ba'i kha na ma tho ba bslu bar bya ba'i khyad par dang /
analyzed: bslu ba'i bsam pa dang / lta ba yid la bzhag nas don go ba la tshig gam lus kyi reg byed kyis go bar byas pa dang / the tshom za ba la nges par smras nas yang brdzun du smra ba'i kha na ma tho ba bslu bar bya ba'i khyad par dang /
translated: Lying is to deceive another by means of speech, with the intention to deceive, by means of words or syllables that are understood by the other.

original: bsam pa'i khyad par la sogs pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam pa'i khyad par la sogs pas rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the sin of lying is distinguished by the distinction of the object to be deceived, the distinction of the intention, and so on.

original: mi dga' bar 'dod pa'am dbye ba'i bsam pas 'ga' zhig la mi dga' ba thos nas de la bsnyad pa dang / de la thos nas 'di la yang rung ste /
analyzed: mi dga' bar 'dod pa'am dbye ba'i bsam pas 'ga' zhig la mi dga' ba thos nas de la bsnyad pa dang / de la thos nas 'di la yang rung ste /
translated: Slander is to speak unpleasant words to one person, having heard them from another, with the intention to create disharmony or with the intention to create dislike.

original: yang dag pa'am yang dag pa ma yin yang phra ma'i kha na ma tho bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'am yang dag pa ma yin yang phra ma'i kha na ma tho bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the sin of slander is either true or false.

original: yang dag pa ma yin na /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin na /
translated: If it is false,

original: brdzun yin no zhe na /
analyzed: brdzun yin no zhe na /
translated: it is lying.

original: la la dag na re /
analyzed: la la dag na re /
translated: Some say:

original: brdzun no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: brdzun no zhes zer ro //
translated: It is lying.🔽Others say:

original: la la dag ni ma yin te /🔽dbye ba'i bsam pas na 'di ni phra ma yin la /
analyzed: la la dag ni ma yin te / dbye ba'i bsam pas na 'di ni phra ma yin la /
translated: It is not,

original: slu ba'i bsam pa med pas /
analyzed: slu ba'i bsam pa med pas /
translated: because it is slander with the intention to create disharmony.

original: brdzun ma yin te /
analyzed: brdzun ma yin te /
translated: It is not lying,🔽because there is no intention to deceive.

original: des na yang dag pa ma yin par tshig rtsub mo smra na yang /
analyzed: des na yang dag pa ma yin par tshig rtsub mo smra na yang /
translated: Therefore, even if one speaks harsh words that are not true,

original: brdzun du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: brdzun du mi 'gyur te /
translated: it is not lying,

original: bsam pa gnyis cig car mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bsam pa gnyis cig car mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: because the two intentions are not possible at the same time.

original: @260a * // khros pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / pha rol po sdug bsngal bar 'dod pas don go bar smra na tshig rtsub mo'i kha na ma tho bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: @260a * // khros pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / pha rol po sdug bsngal bar 'dod pas don go bar smra na tshig rtsub mo'i kha na ma tho bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that when one speaks with an angry mind and with the desire to cause another suffering, it is the vile action of harsh words.

original: don mi go bar smas pa ni dag 'khyal pa'o //
analyzed: don mi go bar smas pa ni dag 'khyal pa'o //
translated: When one speaks without understanding the meaning, it is idle chatter.

original: de gsum ma gtogs pa tshig gzhan gang zhig nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis brjod na bag 'chal pa'i kha na ma tho bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de gsum ma gtogs pa tshig gzhan gang zhig nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis brjod na bag 'chal pa'i kha na ma tho bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Except for those three, any other words expressed with an afflicted mind should be known as the vile action of senseless speech.

original: las kyi lam 'di gsum yang brdzun bzhin du lus kyis kyang byed la /
analyzed: las kyi lam 'di gsum yang brdzun bzhin du lus kyis kyang byed la /
translated: Like lying, these three karmic paths are also committed by the body.

original: sdig pa'i khyad par yang brdzun dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i khyad par yang brdzun dang 'dra'o //
translated: And their specific sins are like lying.

original: gzhan gyi nor la 'dod pa bskyed pa las ni brnab sems kyi kha na ma tho bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi nor la 'dod pa bskyed pa las ni brnab sems kyi kha na ma tho bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the vile action of covetousness arises from generating desire for the wealth of others.

original: sems can la zhe sdang ba las ni gnod sems kyi kha na ma tho bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can la zhe sdang ba las ni gnod sems kyi kha na ma tho bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Malice should be understood as the moral offense of malice that arises from hatred for sentient beings.

original: log par lta ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin du lta'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin du lta'o //
translated: Wrong views are understood as explained above.

original: las kyi lam 'di gsum gyi sdig pa'i khyad par ni /
analyzed: las kyi lam 'di gsum gyi sdig pa'i khyad par ni /
translated: The distinction of the three karmic paths of nonvirtue

original: bsam pa'i khyad par kho na las rig par byas la /
analyzed: bsam pa'i khyad par kho na las rig par byas la /
translated: should be understood as the distinction of the intention alone.

original: brnab sems kyi ni dmigs pa'i dbang gis kyang rig par bya'o //🔽de ltar mi dge ba bcu gzhi la sogs pa'i yan lag yongs su rdzogs par spyad pa las ni /
analyzed: brnab sems kyi ni dmigs pa'i dbang gis kyang rig par bya'o // de ltar mi dge ba bcu gzhi la sogs pa'i yan lag yongs su rdzogs par spyad pa las ni /
translated: But covetousness should be understood as the power of the object.🔽Thus, the result of the ten nonvirtues is undesirable

original: gnod par 'gyur bas na mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: gnod par 'gyur bas na mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: because it is the result of engaging in the complete branches of the basis and so on.

original: stsogs pa zhes bya ba ni brdzun du smra ba la sogs par bsdu'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa zhes bya ba ni brdzun du smra ba la sogs par bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase and so on includes lying and so on.

original: 'bras bu ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Result has four types:

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / dbang gi 'bras bu dang / skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / dbang gi 'bras bu dang / skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: the result of karmic maturation, the result of natural outflow, the dominant result and the result of conscious effort.

original: de la skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: de la skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni /
translated: The result of conscious effort is as follows.

original: 'phral la'am de ma thag tu myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phral la'am de ma thag tu myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is experienced immediately, or soon.

original: dbang gi 'bras bu ni phyi rol du smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang gi 'bras bu ni phyi rol du smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The dominant result ripens externally.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni byed pa dang / myong ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni byed pa dang / myong ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The result that is a natural outflow is twofold, according to whether it is similar to its cause or is experienced.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni ngan song gsum du'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni ngan song gsum du'o //
translated: The maturational result is in the three lower miserable destinies.

original: de lta bas na 'bras bu bzhi mtshon pa'i don du rnam par smin pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'bras bu bzhi mtshon pa'i don du rnam par smin pa zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, the term “maturation” is mentioned in order to illustrate the four results.

original: 'o na sdom pa can kho na la nyes par 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sdom pa can kho na la nyes par 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: But is there an offense only for one who has taken the vow?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: thams cad dang thun mong yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad dang thun mong yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that it is common to all:

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyid tshe la log par bsgrub pa bstan pa ma yin gyi zhes smos so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyid tshe la log par bsgrub pa bstan pa ma yin gyi zhes smos so //
translated: It is not taught that only the bodhisattva has a wrong livelihood.🔽Here, it is just an illustration, but it should be understood in detail from the sutra itself.

original: 'dir ni mtshon par zad kyi zhib tu mdo nyid las shes par bya'o zhes phyogs mtshon pa ni rgya cher gsungs so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni mtshon par zad kyi zhib tu mdo nyid las shes par bya'o zhes phyogs mtshon pa ni rgya cher gsungs so zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the extensive explanation of the illustration.

original: de la srog gcod pa'i rgyu mthun pa ni mir gyur pa'i tshe rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la srog gcod pa'i rgyu mthun pa ni mir gyur pa'i tshe rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The causally concordant experiential effect of killing is that when one is born as a human being, one’s life will be short.

original: byed pa rgyu mthun pa dang / myong ba rgyu mthun pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa rgyu mthun pa dang / myong ba rgyu mthun pa'o //
translated: The causally concordant experiential effect of killing is that when one becomes a human being, one has a short life and many illnesses.

original: de la byed pa rgyu mthun @260b pa ni thams cad du byed par dga' ba ste /
analyzed: de la byed pa rgyu mthun @260b pa ni thams cad du byed par dga' ba ste /
translated: The causally concordant behavioral effect is that one delights in killing in all one’s lives,

original: thams cad du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du rig par bya'o //
translated: and this should be understood as applying to all the nonvirtuous actions.

original: myong ba rgyu mthun pa ni 'di lta ste tshe thung ba dang nad mang ba'o //
analyzed: myong ba rgyu mthun pa ni 'di lta ste tshe thung ba dang nad mang ba'o //
translated: The causally concordant experiential effect is that one has a short life and many illnesses.

original: dbang gi 'bras bu ni lo thog la sogs pa kha ba dang / shin pa dang / rul bar 'gyur zhing des dus ma yin par 'chi ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dbang gi 'bras bu ni lo thog la sogs pa kha ba dang / shin pa dang / rul bar 'gyur zhing des dus ma yin par 'chi ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The environmental effect is that crops and so on are damaged by frost, hail, and rot, and this becomes a condition for untimely death.

original: 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa'i myong ba rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa'i myong ba rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni /
translated: The causally concordant experiential effect of sexual misconduct is that one’s spouse is disobedient and unfaithful.

original: g-yog 'khor mi srun pa dang / lhod pa dang bcas pa'i chung mar 'gyur ba'o //🔽dbang gi 'bras bu ni lud khung dang ljan ljin can du skya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yog 'khor mi srun pa dang / lhod pa dang bcas pa'i chung mar 'gyur ba'o //🔽dbang gi 'bras bu ni lud khung dang ljan ljin can du skya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The environmental effect is that one is born in a place that is filthy and malodorous.🔽The causally concordant experiential effect of lying is that one is much slandered.

original: ma byin par len pa'i myong ba rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa'i myong ba rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni /
translated: The causally concordant experiential effect of taking what is not given is

original: longs spyod med pa dang gzhan dang thun mong ba'o //
analyzed: longs spyod med pa dang gzhan dang thun mong ba'o //
translated: having no resources and having to share them with others.

original: dbang gi 'bras bu ni sad dang mu ge la sogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dbang gi 'bras bu ni sad dang mu ge la sogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The dominant effect is that one is born in a place with frost, famine, and so on.

original: brdzun du smra ba'i myong rgyu mthun pas ni slu ba dang skur pa mang ba'o //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba'i myong rgyu mthun pas ni slu ba dang skur pa mang ba'o //
translated: The causally concordant experiential effect of lying is being deceived and slandered a lot.

original: dbang gi 'bras bu ni ha cang char che ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang gi 'bras bu ni ha cang char che ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The dominant effect is that it rains too much and so on.

original: phra ba'i myong ba rgyu mthun pas ni g-yog 'khor mi 'dum pa dang / ngan par 'du ba'o //
analyzed: phra ba'i myong ba rgyu mthun pas ni g-yog 'khor mi 'dum pa dang / ngan par 'du ba'o //
translated: The causally concordant experiential effect of divisive speech is that one’s retinue and helpers are not harmonious and are bad.

original: dbang gi 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: dbang gi 'bras bu ni /
translated: The dominant effect is that

original: sa gzhi gye  gu dang mtho dman can du skye ba'o //🔽dag rtsub po'i myong ba rgyu mthun pa ni /
analyzed: sa gzhi gye  gu dang mtho dman can du skye ba'o // dag rtsub po'i myong ba rgyu mthun pa ni /
translated: one is born in a place with uneven terrain.

original: zher 'debs pa dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i tshig thos pa'o //
analyzed: zher 'debs pa dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i tshig thos pa'o //
translated: The causally concordant experiential effect of harsh speech is that one is criticized and hears unpleasant words.

original: dbang gi 'bras bu ni sa gzhi rtsub pa dang tsher ma can la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang gi 'bras bu ni sa gzhi rtsub pa dang tsher ma can la sogs pa'o //
translated: The dominant effect is that the land is rough, has thorns, and so on.

original: tshig 'khyal pa'i myong ba rgyu mthun pas ni tshig mi btsun pa dang ; ma brtags par spobs pa can no //
analyzed: tshig 'khyal pa'i myong ba rgyu mthun pas ni tshig mi btsun pa dang ; ma brtags par spobs pa can no //
translated: The causally concordant experiential effect of idle chatter is that one’s words are not respected and one speaks without thinking.

original: dbang gi 'bras bu ni ljon shing yal ga dang lo ma dang 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba'o //🔽brnab sems kyi myong ba rgyu mthun ni /
analyzed: dbang gi 'bras bu ni ljon shing yal ga dang lo ma dang 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba'o // brnab sems kyi myong ba rgyu mthun ni /
translated: The dominant effect is that trees, leaves, and fruit will be scarce.

original: 'dod pa che ba dang chog mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa che ba dang chog mi shes pa'o //
translated: The causally concordant experiential effect of covetousness is that one is greedy and dissatisfied.

original: dbang gi 'bras bu ni longs spyod dang 'bru la sogs pa je chung du 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dbang gi 'bras bu ni longs spyod dang 'bru la sogs pa je chung du 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The dominant effect is that one’s wealth, grain, and so forth will diminish.

original: gnod sems kyi myong ba rgyu mthun pas gzhan gyis 'tshe ba dang glags lta bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnod sems kyi myong ba rgyu mthun pas gzhan gyis 'tshe ba dang glags lta bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The causally concordant experiential effect of malice is that one is harmed by others and is looked down upon.

original: dbang gi 'bras bu ni gcan gzan gdug pa dang srin dang me la sogs pa mang bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dbang gi 'bras bu ni gcan gzan gdug pa dang srin dang me la sogs pa mang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The dominant effect is that there will be many wild animals, insects, fires, and so forth.

original: log par lta ba'i myong ba rgyu mthun pas ni lta ba ngan pa dang / g-yo sgyu can no //
analyzed: log par lta ba'i myong ba rgyu mthun pas ni lta ba ngan pa dang / g-yo sgyu can no //
translated: The causally concordant experiential effect of wrong views is that one has bad views and is deceitful.

original: dbang gi 'bras bus ni mgon med cing skyabs med par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang gi 'bras bus ni mgon med cing skyabs med par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The dominant effect is that one will have no protector or refuge and so forth.

original: de lta bas na rnam par smin pa dang myong ba rgyu mthun pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par smin pa dang myong ba rgyu mthun pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, in terms of the maturation result and the result resembling the cause,🔽the noble Dashabhumika Sutra says:

original: 'phags pa sa bcu'i mdo las srog gcod pa ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do //
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu'i mdo las srog gcod pa ni sems can dmyal bar khrid do //
translated: Killing leads to the hells.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su khrid do //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su khrid do //
translated: It leads to the animal realm.

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du khrid do //
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du khrid do //
translated: It leads to the world of Yama.

original: ci de brgya la mir skyes na @261a * //
analyzed: ci de brgya la mir skyes na @261a * //
translated: If by some chance one is born human,

original: yang 'bras bu gnyis myong bar 'gyur te /
