analyzed: yang 'bras bu gnyis myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: one will experience two results:

original: 'di lta ste tshe thung ba dang nad mang ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste tshe thung ba dang nad mang ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: a short life and much illness.

original: de la gtso bo yin pas sems can dmyal ba 'ba' zhig smos te /
analyzed: de la gtso bo yin pas sems can dmyal ba 'ba' zhig smos te /
translated: Here, only the hells are mentioned because they are the principal result.

original: zhib tu ni dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nyid las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhib tu ni dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nyid las rig par bya'o //
translated: But the details should be understood from the noble Dharma-smrty-upasthana-sutra itself.

original: da ni longs spyod dang srog la chags pa'i log par sgrub pa spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni longs spyod dang srog la chags pa'i log par sgrub pa spang ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to abandon the wrong practice of attachment to wealth and life,

original: longs spyod dang srog la chags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: longs spyod dang srog la chags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Attachment to wealth and life,” and so on.

original: log par sgrub pa ni bar du gcod pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: log par sgrub pa ni bar du gcod pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Wrong practice is the cause of obstacles.

original: de la re zhig spyir bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig spyir bstan pa ni /
translated: Among them, first, the general teaching is:

original: rgyal po chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Great King, etc.

original: longs spyod dang lus la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa nyid yin la ;
analyzed: longs spyod dang lus la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa nyid yin la ;
translated: Wealth, body, etc. are impermanent.

original: mi rtag pa'i don ni med pa'i don yin pas rmi lam gyi dpes bstan to //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i don ni med pa'i don yin pas rmi lam gyi dpes bstan to //
translated: The meaning of impermanence is the meaning of non-existence, so it is taught by the example of a dream.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni /
translated: Impermanence is:

original: shing las zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: shing las zhes gsungs te /
translated: From the tree, etc.

original: longs spyod dang lus la sogs pa 'phel ba mi rtag par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: longs spyod dang lus la sogs pa 'phel ba mi rtag par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the impermanence of the increase of wealth, body, etc. is taught by the example of the flower.

original: me tog byung nas 'bras bu 'byung ngo zhes bya bas dpe bstan to //
analyzed: me tog byung nas 'bras bu 'byung ngo zhes bya bas dpe bstan to //
translated: After the flower appears, the fruit appears.

original: gnas pa mi rtag pa ni 'bras bu byung nas yang med pa'i dpes bstan to //
analyzed: gnas pa mi rtag pa ni 'bras bu byung nas yang med pa'i dpes bstan to //
translated: The impermanence of duration is taught by the example of the fruit disappearing again after appearing.

original: 'grib pa mi rtag pa ni 'dab ma'i dpes bstan to //
analyzed: 'grib pa mi rtag pa ni 'dab ma'i dpes bstan to //
translated: The impermanence of decrease is taught by the example of the leaves.

original: de ltar dpe don du sbyar ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar dpe don du sbyar ba ni /
translated: Thus, the application of the example to the meaning is:

original: de bzhin du zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes gsungs te /
translated: Likewise, etc.

original: rgyal srid ni rin po che dang nye ba'i rin po che'o //
analyzed: rgyal srid ni rin po che dang nye ba'i rin po che'o //
translated: The kingdom is the precious and semi-precious jewels.

original: dbang phyug ni longs spyod mtha' dag la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug ni longs spyod mtha' dag la dbang ba'o //
translated: The lord is the one who has power over all the enjoyments.

original: 'dod pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The desires are forms, etc.

original: dbang ba ni dbang med pa'o //
analyzed: dbang ba ni dbang med pa'o //
translated: The possessions are the things that are not under one's power.

original: de dag gang zhe na glang po che dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag gang zhe na glang po che dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: What are they? He says elephants, etc.

original: glang po che dang / rta dang / shing rta ni theg pa'i longs spyod do //
analyzed: glang po che dang / rta dang / shing rta ni theg pa'i longs spyod do //
translated: Elephants, horses, and chariots are the enjoyments of the vehicle.

original: de'i steng du dpung bu chung bsnan pa ni dpung rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i steng du dpung bu chung bsnan pa ni dpung rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four divisions of the army are added to that. They are the four divisions of the army.

original: bde ba skyong ba'i dbang du byas pa'o ;
analyzed: bde ba skyong ba'i dbang du byas pa'o ;
translated: This is from the point of view of the enjoyment of happiness.

original: / sras dang btsun mo dang gzhon nu zhes bya ba ni nang gi 'khor te /
analyzed: / sras dang btsun mo dang gzhon nu zhes bya ba ni nang gi 'khor te /
translated: Sons, wives, and daughters are the inner circle.

original: bde ba spyod pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: bde ba spyod pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: This is from the point of view of the enjoyment of happiness.

original: de la nang gi slas ni slas te btsun mo dam pa'o //
analyzed: de la nang gi slas ni slas te btsun mo dam pa'o //
translated: The inner harem is the harem, the chief wives.

original: blon po dang rtsis pa dang sna chen po la gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i 'khor te /
analyzed: blon po dang rtsis pa dang sna chen po la gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i 'khor te /
translated: Ministers, accountants, and high officials are the inner circle.

original: longs spyod kyi bde ba gong du spel ba'i dbang du byas pa ste ;
analyzed: longs spyod kyi bde ba gong du spel ba'i dbang du byas pa ste ;
translated: This is from the point of view of increasing the happiness of enjoyments.

original: de la 'khor lo'i 'thab pa'i blon po chen po sna chen po la gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'khor lo'i 'thab pa'i blon po chen po sna chen po la gtogs pa'o //
translated: The great ministers who are skilled in the methods of warfare are the great ministers who are the nose

original: sgo ba dang 'khor zhes bya ba ni de dang nye ba'i 'khor te /
analyzed: sgo ba dang 'khor zhes bya ba ni de dang nye ba'i 'khor te /
translated: The doorkeepers and the retinue are the immediate retinue.

original: bde ba dang mi mthun pa las bsrung ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang mi mthun pa las bsrung ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: They are considered in terms of protection from what is not conducive to happiness.

original: pha ma nas rten grogs zhes bya ba'i bar ni /
analyzed: pha ma nas rten grogs zhes bya ba'i bar ni /
translated: The parents up to the friends are

original: 'khor gyi gtso bo ste /
analyzed: 'khor gyi gtso bo ste /
translated: the chief of the retinue.

original: bde ba thob pa'i dbang du byas @261b pa'o ;
analyzed: bde ba thob pa'i dbang du byas @261b pa'o ;
translated: They are considered in terms of attaining happiness.

original: / bran po nas zho shas 'tsho ba'i bar ni /
analyzed: / bran po nas zho shas 'tsho ba'i bar ni /
translated: The slaves up to the wage earners are

original: phyi'i 'khor te /
analyzed: phyi'i 'khor te /
translated: the outer retinue.

original: bde ba'i rgyu chud mi gson pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu chud mi gson pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: They are considered in terms of not wasting the causes of happiness.

original: yul gyi mi zhes bya ba ni ris su gtogs pa'i 'khor te bde ba la sbyar ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: yul gyi mi zhes bya ba ni ris su gtogs pa'i 'khor te bde ba la sbyar ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The subjects are the retinue that belongs to a class. They are considered in terms of being applied to happiness.

original: gser dang dngul la sogs pa ni nor bu dang bya ba dag go //
analyzed: gser dang dngul la sogs pa ni nor bu dang bya ba dag go //
translated: Gold, silver, and so on are the jewels and the actions.

original: gos dang nor zhes bya ba ni spyad pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: gos dang nor zhes bya ba ni spyad pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The clothes and wealth are considered in terms of enjoyment.

original: 'bru dang bang mdzod ces bya ba ni bsag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bru dang bang mdzod ces bya ba ni bsag par bya ba'o //
translated: The grain and the treasury are what is to be stored.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba ni rkang 'gros nas zhing gi bar du bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba ni rkang 'gros nas zhing gi bar du bsdu ba ste /
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes the rest of the animals up to the field protectors.

original: 'di dag kyang 'phel ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa mi rtag par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang 'phel ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa mi rtag par bstan to //
translated: These are taught to be impermanent in the sense of having growth, abiding, and destruction.

original: longs spyod ji lta ba bzhin du srog mi rtag par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: longs spyod ji lta ba bzhin du srog mi rtag par bstan pa ni /
translated: The impermanence of life is taught in accordance with the enjoyments.

original: bor te 'gro dgos so zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bor te 'gro dgos so zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said that one must go away, having abandoned them.

original: dus kyis gnyer te rgyal po 'gro dgos na //
analyzed: dus kyis gnyer te rgyal po 'gro dgos na //
translated: The time comes when the king must go away.

original: longs spyod mdza' dang gnyen gshes rjes mi 'gro //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: longs spyod mdza' dang gnyen gshes rjes mi 'gro // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Wealth, friends, and relatives do not follow him.

original: da ni ji ltar mi rtag pa bstan pa de'i phyir mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar mi rtag pa bstan pa de'i phyir mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to teach impermanence in accordance with that, he says, “Impermanent,” and so on.

original: re zhig spyir bstan pa ni skad cig ma'i mi rtag pas na mi rtag pa ste skyes nas 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig spyir bstan pa ni skad cig ma'i mi rtag pas na mi rtag pa ste skyes nas 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In general, impermanent means that which is impermanent due to momentary impermanence, because it is destroyed after arising.

original: rgyun mi rtag pas na mi brtan pa ste blo rtsing gis kyang rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun mi rtag pas na mi brtan pa ste blo rtsing gis kyang rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Unstable means that which is impermanent due to the impermanence of the continuum, because it is understood even by a coarse mind.

original: glo bur gyis mi rtag pas na yid mi brtan pa ste /
analyzed: glo bur gyis mi rtag pas na yid mi brtan pa ste /
translated: Unreliable means that which is impermanent due to accidental impermanence.

original: dus la mi sdod par 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus la mi sdod par 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is destroyed without remaining until the time of its destruction.

original: dus kyis mi rtag pas na rnam par 'gyur ba ste dus kyis 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus kyis mi rtag pas na rnam par 'gyur ba ste dus kyis 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is impermanent because of the impermanence of time, because it changes with time.

original: de ltar mi rtag pas na yun thung ste ring du mi gnas pa zhes snga ma phyi mas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mi rtag pas na yun thung ste ring du mi gnas pa zhes snga ma phyi mas bshad par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is short-lived because of impermanence, because it does not remain long.

original: da ni khyad par du bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni khyad par du bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, it is to be explained in particular.

original: re zhig la tshe mi rtag pa ni mthar sdig pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: re zhig la tshe mi rtag pa ni mthar sdig pa zhes bya ste /
translated: First, life is impermanent and finally it is evil.

original: rgas pa ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i phyir sdig pa'o //
analyzed: rgas pa ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i phyir sdig pa'o //
translated: Old age is evil because it is undesirable.

original: longs spyod mi rtag pa ni zad cing 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: longs spyod mi rtag pa ni zad cing 'jig pa ste /
translated: Wealth is impermanent, perishable and subject to loss.

original: zad pa ni rang gi nyams pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa ni rang gi nyams pa'o //
translated: Loss is the deterioration of one's own.

original: 'jig pa ni glo bur gyi rkyen gyis so //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni glo bur gyi rkyen gyis so //
translated: Perishability is by adventitious conditions.

original: thams cad kyi rang bzhin de yin pas na sgo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi rang bzhin de yin pas na sgo zhes bya ste /
translated: Since it is the nature of all, it is called the door,

original: der 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one goes out through it.

original: longs spyod dang lus dag ni shing rta'i yan lag 'dus pa lta bu yin pas na rgud pa dang dga' ba dag ni so sor 'gyes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: longs spyod dang lus dag ni shing rta'i yan lag 'dus pa lta bu yin pas na rgud pa dang dga' ba dag ni so sor 'gyes pa lta bu'o //
translated: Wealth and body are like the assembled parts of a chariot, so misfortune and happiness are like their separation.

original: nad med pa mi rtag pa ni 'jigs pa dang 'tshe ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nad med pa mi rtag pa ni 'jigs pa dang 'tshe ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The impermanence of health is having fear and harm, and so on.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i nad ni sngar ma lta bu'i ngo bo nyid pas na /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i nad ni sngar ma lta bu'i ngo bo nyid pas na /
translated: The innate disease is like the former, and so

original: ngag gi skrag pa ste /
analyzed: ngag gi skrag pa ste /
translated: it is a fear of speech.

original: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is having fear.

original: glo bur ba'i nad ni mtshon gyi zug rdu lta bu ste /
analyzed: glo bur ba'i nad ni mtshon gyi zug rdu lta bu ste /
translated: The adventitious disease is like a wound from a weapon.

original: 'phral du 'byung bas 'tshe ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'phral du 'byung bas 'tshe ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is having harm because it arises suddenly.

original: @262a * // srog mi rtag pas 'chi ba ni /
analyzed: @262a * // srog mi rtag pas 'chi ba ni /
translated: Death, because of the impermanence of life,

original: sems kyi gdung ba'i rgyu yin pas mya ngan mang ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyi gdung ba'i rgyu yin pas mya ngan mang ba'o //
translated: is the cause of mental anguish, and so there is much sorrow.

original: lus gdung ba'i rgyu yin pas 'khrug pa mang ba ste /
analyzed: lus gdung ba'i rgyu yin pas 'khrug pa mang ba ste /
translated: It is the cause of physical anguish, and so there is much disturbance.

original: lus las kyang 'chi ba'i rkyen gyi mya ngan dang 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lus las kyang 'chi ba'i rkyen gyi mya ngan dang 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that sorrow and disturbance from death arise from the body.

original: 'chi ba nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'chi ba nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is death itself?🔽It is the separation of the body

original: tshe dang drod dang rnam shes kyis //🔽de yi lus ni bor ba nas //
analyzed: tshe dang drod dang rnam shes kyis // de yi lus ni bor ba nas //
translated: from life, heat, and consciousness.

original: dran pa med de shing lta bur //
analyzed: dran pa med de shing lta bur //
translated: Then, without awareness, like a log,

original: sa la 'gyel nas nyal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sa la 'gyel nas nyal bar 'gyur //
translated: the body lies fallen on the ground.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba yin la /
translated: This is death.

original: yan lag dang nyid lag dag ni sa la 'brul /
analyzed: yan lag dang nyid lag dag ni sa la 'brul /
translated: The limbs and minor limbs are scattered on the ground.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i lus 'di 'jig dbugs rgyu ba dang srog dag ni 'chad /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i lus 'di 'jig dbugs rgyu ba dang srog dag ni 'chad /
translated: This body of the four great elements is destroyed, the breath and life are cut off.

original: rus pa dang sha dang khrag dang rgyus pa la sogs pa dag ni so sor 'gyes /
analyzed: rus pa dang sha dang khrag dang rgyus pa la sogs pa dag ni so sor 'gyes /
translated: The bones, flesh, blood, sinews, etc. are scattered.🔽The hair and nails are scattered in all directions.

original: skra dang nus pa dag ni phyogs dang phyogs mtshams su 'thor zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis 'brul ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: skra dang nus pa dag ni phyogs dang phyogs mtshams su 'thor zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis 'brul ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams bshad par bya'o //
translated: In this way, the words “scattered” and so forth are explained.

original: rnam par 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni nges par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni nges par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “ Destruction” means “certainty.”

original: de dag kyang dus nges pa med ;
analyzed: de dag kyang dus nges pa med ;
translated: Moreover, there is no certainty of time.

original: mdo sde las mthar sgo gcig tu 'du bas ni dri ba mgo gcig tu lan gdab pa'i phyir chos can zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo sde las mthar sgo gcig tu 'du bas ni dri ba mgo gcig tu lan gdab pa'i phyir chos can zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: In the sūtras, the question is answered in one direction by collecting into one door, and therefore the word “subject” is mentioned.

original: de ni log par sgrub pa spang ba'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid la gdams pa ni /
analyzed: de ni log par sgrub pa spang ba'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid la gdams pa ni /
translated: In order to eliminate wrong practice, the instruction on impermanence is:

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: 'dir mi rtag pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dir mi rtag pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Impermanence is twofold:

original: nang gi mi rtag par lta ba dang / phyi'i mi rtag par lta ba'o //
analyzed: nang gi mi rtag par lta ba dang / phyi'i mi rtag par lta ba'o //
translated: impermanence of the internal and impermanence of the external.

original: de la nang gi mi rtag pa ni skad cig pa dang / rgyun mi rtag pa dang / glo bur gyis mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de la nang gi mi rtag pa ni skad cig pa dang / rgyun mi rtag pa dang / glo bur gyis mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Impermanence of the internal is threefold: impermanence of the moment, impermanence of the series, and impermanence of the adventitious union of the aggregates.

original: phyi'i mi rtag pa ni dus kyis mi rtag pa ste /🔽rnam par bam pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i mi rtag pa ni dus kyis mi rtag pa ste / rnam par bam pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Impermanence of the external is twofold: impermanence of the receptacle world and impermanence of the external elements.🔽Impermanence of the external elements is twofold: impermanence of the arising of the elements and impermanence of the destruction of the elements.

original: de dag kyang yang dang yang du goms par bya ba dang / gnas skabs rnam pa dgur rang gi lus dang mgo bsgre bas log par sgrub pa spang bar 'gyur te /🔽ji skad du /🔽dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i skabs nas zhib tu 'byung bzhin du lta ba ni mi rtag pas lta ba dang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang yang dang yang du goms par bya ba dang / gnas skabs rnam pa dgur rang gi lus dang mgo bsgre bas log par sgrub pa spang bar 'gyur te / ji skad du / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i skabs nas zhib tu 'byung bzhin du lta ba ni mi rtag pas lta ba dang zhes bya'o //
translated: Impermanence of the arising of the elements is twofold: impermanence of the arising of the elements in the world and impermanence of the arising of the elements in the body.

original: zad pa dang 'jig pa dag ni nang dang phyi rol lus la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa dang 'jig pa dag ni nang dang phyi rol lus la ltos pa'o //
translated: Impermanence of the destruction of the elements is twofold: impermanence of the destruction of the elements in the world and impermanence of the destruction of the elements in the body.🔽Impermanence of the destruction of the elements in the world is twofold: impermanence of the destruction of the elements in the world through fire, water, and wind, and impermanence of the destruction of the elements in the world through the exhaustion of causes.🔽Impermanence of the destruction of the elements in the body is twofold: impermanence of the destruction of the elements in the body through the exhaustion of the life force and impermanence of the destruction of the elements in the body through the exhaustion of the elements.

original: longs spyod la chags pa'i gnyen po ji ltar sgom zhe na /
analyzed: longs spyod la chags pa'i gnyen po ji ltar sgom zhe na /
translated: The antidote to attachment to enjoyments is meditation on the impurity of the body.

original: la la na re 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs sgom pa nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: la la na re 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs sgom pa nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that it is the meditation on the faults of desire itself.

original: la la na re lus mi rtag pa sgom pa nyid kyis longs spyod la chags pa spong bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: la la na re lus mi rtag pa sgom pa nyid kyis longs spyod la chags pa spong bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that the meditation on the impermanence of the body itself eliminates attachment to wealth.

original: chos kyi rgyal po ni chos dang mthun par bya'i bab col du ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal po ni chos dang mthun par bya'i bab col du ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Dharma King acts in accordance with the Dharma, not rashly.

original: ji @262b ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji @262b ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rjes su 'jug par gyis la zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'jug par gyis la zhes bya ste /
translated: By saying, Follow me.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar gsungs pa bzhin du 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar gsungs pa bzhin du 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that one should act in accordance with what the Blessed One has taught.

original: chos ma yin pa ni lugs ma yin te /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa ni lugs ma yin te /
translated: Unrighteousness is not the way.

original: dper na kun du rgyu byang chub kyi sems skyes pa'i rabs las bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na kun du rgyu byang chub kyi sems skyes pa'i rabs las bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is taught in the Avadāna of the Bodhisattva's Generation of the Mind.

original: da ni gang gis mi rtag pa de nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: da ni gang gis mi rtag pa de nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to show what is impermanent, it is said:

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /🔽re zhig dper dgod pa ni ri chen po zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / re zhig dper dgod pa ni ri chen po zhes bya ba ste /
translated: For example, etc.🔽 First, the example is given: a great mountain.

original: thog tu bab pas na ri dper dgod pa'o //
analyzed: thog tu bab pas na ri dper dgod pa'o //
translated: Because it falls down, the mountain is given as an example.

original: rga ba la sogs pa bstan par phyogs bzhi smos so //
analyzed: rga ba la sogs pa bstan par phyogs bzhi smos so //
translated: The four directions are mentioned in order to indicate old age, etc.

original: mi zlogs shing mi shigs par bstan pas na sra ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mi zlogs shing mi shigs par bstan pas na sra ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The words “hard,” etc. are mentioned in order to indicate that it cannot be turned back and cannot be destroyed.

original: dbug par mi nus pas na sra ba'o //
analyzed: dbug par mi nus pas na sra ba'o //
translated: It is hard because it cannot be pierced.

original: mkhregs pas na snying po dang ldan pa'o //🔽'phan med pas na ma zhig pa'o //
analyzed: mkhregs pas na snying po dang ldan pa'o // 'phan med pas na ma zhig pa'o //
translated: It is solid because it is firm.

original: ser ka med pas na ma gas pa'o //
analyzed: ser ka med pas na ma gas pa'o //
translated: It is not broken because it is not torn.🔽It is not cracked because it is not split.

original: gseng med pas na khong stong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gseng med pas na khong stong ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not hollow because it is not empty.

original: gzhig par mi nus pas na mkhregs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhig par mi nus pas na mkhregs pa'o //
translated: It is firm because it cannot be destroyed.

original: bar med pas na gcig tu 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: bar med pas na gcig tu 'dus pa'o //
translated: It is compact because it is without interstices.

original: 'phangs dang rngams che bas na byin che zhing mtho ba'o //
analyzed: 'phangs dang rngams che bas na byin che zhing mtho ba'o //
translated: It is high and lofty because it is vast and deep.

original: de ltar bshad pa'i dpe nyid sbyar ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa'i dpe nyid sbyar ba ni /
translated: The application of the very examples that have been explained is as follows:

original: de bzhin du smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du smos te /
translated: The words “just so” are mentioned.

original: bzlog par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bzlog par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not easily turned back.

original: shugs kyis nyon mongs pa spangs nas 'ching ba las grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'phangs pa yin no //
analyzed: shugs kyis nyon mongs pa spangs nas 'ching ba las grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'phangs pa yin no //
translated: The implication is that one becomes liberated from bondage by abandoning the afflictions.

original: de la lus dang srog dang longs spyod kyi dbang du byas nas 'dir bzhi bstan te /
analyzed: de la lus dang srog dang longs spyod kyi dbang du byas nas 'dir bzhi bstan te /
translated: Here, four are taught from the perspective of body, life, and resources.

original: lus kyi dbang du byas nas rga ba dang na ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang du byas nas rga ba dang na ba'o //
translated: From the perspective of body, aging and sickness.

original: srog gi dbang du byas nas 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: srog gi dbang du byas nas 'chi ba'o //
translated: From the perspective of life, death.

original: longs spyod kyi dbang du byas nas rgud par rnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: longs spyod kyi dbang du byas nas rgud par rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: From the perspective of resources, decline is posited.

original: 'joms pa ni 'phrog pa'i phyir te ji skad du dge slong dag lang 'tsho ni 'jig rten pa thams cad la sdug pa /
analyzed: 'joms pa ni 'phrog pa'i phyir te ji skad du dge slong dag lang 'tsho ni 'jig rten pa thams cad la sdug pa /
translated: Destruction is because of being robbed. As it is said, “Monks, youth is dear to all worldly people,

original: na ba / phangs pa /🔽yid du 'ong ba /
analyzed: na ba / phangs pa / yid du 'ong ba /
translated: sickly,🔽cherished,

original: mngon par dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par dga' bar bya'o //
translated: and delightful.

original: lang tsho'i mtha' ni rga ba ste /
analyzed: lang tsho'i mtha' ni rga ba ste /
translated: The end of youth is aging.

original: dge slong dag 'jig rten pa thams cad mi sdug pa dang / mi na ba /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'jig rten pa thams cad mi sdug pa dang / mi na ba /
translated: Monks, aging is not dear to all worldly people,

original: mi phangs pa /
analyzed: mi phangs pa /
translated: not sickly,

original: yid du mi 'ong ba /
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba /
translated: not cherished,🔽not delightful,🔽and not something to be delighted in.

original: mngon par dga' ba bya ba ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba bya ba ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is not something to be delighted in.🔽

original: de ltar log par sgrub pa spyir bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar log par sgrub pa spyir bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having generally taught wrong practice,

original: da ni de dag thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin pas lus la chags pa spang ba khyad par du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni de dag thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin pas lus la chags pa spang ba khyad par du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, since the body is the root of all of these, one should especially speak of the abandonment of attachment to the body.

original: de la re zhig lus mi rtag pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig lus mi rtag pa bstan pa ni /
translated: In this regard, first of all, the impermanence of the body is taught:

original: 'chi ba yin la /
analyzed: 'chi ba yin la /
translated: Death is the end of the life of a sentient being.

original: de yang mi 'dod pa gzhan gyi dbang yin pas rang dbang med par bstan pa ni /🔽ri dags @263a * //
analyzed: de yang mi 'dod pa gzhan gyi dbang yin pas rang dbang med par bstan pa ni / ri dags @263a * //
translated: Moreover, since it is not desired by others, it is taught to be without independence:

original: kyi rgyal po seng ge zhes dpes bstan to //
analyzed: kyi rgyal po seng ge zhes dpes bstan to //
translated: Like a lion, the king of beasts.

original: dpe gnyis sbyar ba ni de bzhin du zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dpe gnyis sbyar ba ni de bzhin du zhes gsungs te /
translated: The application of the two examples is stated:

original: 'chi bdag ni gshin rje la bya'o //
analyzed: 'chi bdag ni gshin rje la bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the Lord of Death

original: gsal zhing zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsal zhing zhes bya ba ni /
translated: is clear and

original: mi bde ba'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: mi bde ba'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: is a synonym for unpleasant.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: rgyags pa dang ni bral zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyags pa dang ni bral zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Free from pride, etc.

original: ji ltar mi bde bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi bde bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it unpleasant?

original: srid pa bzhir brgyud pa'i tshe sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi myong ste /
analyzed: srid pa bzhir brgyud pa'i tshe sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi myong ste /
translated: In the four existences, one experiences the four kinds of suffering.

original: 'chi ba'i srid pa dang / bar ma do'i srid pa dang / sngon dus kyi srid pa dang / skye ba'i srid pa ste rnam pa bzhir rgyags pa dang bral ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi myong ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i srid pa dang / bar ma do'i srid pa dang / sngon dus kyi srid pa dang / skye ba'i srid pa ste rnam pa bzhir rgyags pa dang bral ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi myong ste /
translated: The four kinds of suffering are experienced in the four states: the state of death, the intermediate state, the state of birth, and the state of prior to death.

original: de la rgyags pa dang bral zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal mang po bstan to //🔽las kyi srid pa nas yang srid pa la ni 'jug ces bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: de la rgyags pa dang bral zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal mang po bstan to // las kyi srid pa nas yang srid pa la ni 'jug ces bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: The suffering of death is indicated by the words “deprived of what is desired” and so on.

original: bar ma do'i srid pa'i sdug bsngal bstan te /
analyzed: bar ma do'i srid pa'i sdug bsngal bstan te /
translated: The suffering of the intermediate state is indicated by the words “from the state of karma, one enters again into existence” and so on.

original: 'ju zhes bya bas 'bras bu'i rgyu lta bur chad par mi 'gyur bar 'byung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: 'ju zhes bya bas 'bras bu'i rgyu lta bur chad par mi 'gyur bar 'byung ba la bya'o //
translated: The word “digests” means that the intermediate state does not occur as a discontinuity, like the cause of a result.

original: 'dir sdug bsngal ni lus bye brag med pa la srid par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir sdug bsngal ni lus bye brag med pa la srid par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Here, “suffering” means the state of existence in a body that is not specified.

original: la la na re bar ma do'i srid pa ni med de /
analyzed: la la na re bar ma do'i srid pa ni med de /
translated: Some say that there is no intermediate state,

original: lung las bar ma do'i bshad pa yang gnas gzhan du 'gro ba'i bar la bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: lung las bar ma do'i bshad pa yang gnas gzhan du 'gro ba'i bar la bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: and that the explanation of the intermediate state in the scriptures should be understood as the time required to reach another place.

original: sngon dus kyi srid pa'i sdug bsngal bstan pa ni gang du skye ba de'i byad gzugs 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: sngon dus kyi srid pa'i sdug bsngal bstan pa ni gang du skye ba de'i byad gzugs 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The suffering of existence in the past is shown to be the form of the body in which one will be born.🔽This very sutra states:

original: mdo 'di nyid las sems can dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid las sems can dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur na /
translated: If one is going to be reborn as a hell being,🔽one will be born in the Reviving Hell and so on.

original: de sems can dmyal ba yang sos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te de'i phyir mun pa chen por ni zhugs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de sems can dmyal ba yang sos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te de'i phyir mun pa chen por ni zhugs zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said that one enters great darkness,

original: sdig pa byed pa'i snang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdig pa byed pa'i snang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the light of evil deeds.

original: des ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba sems can dmyal ba la sogs par skye ba ni srid pa'i sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: des ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba sems can dmyal ba la sogs par skye ba ni srid pa'i sdug bsngal te /
translated: The suffering of existence in the future is the birth of a hell being and so on.

original: de dag tu nying mtshams sbyor ba ni phyir mdo 'di nyid las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag tu nying mtshams sbyor ba ni phyir mdo 'di nyid las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sutra itself states that one will be born there, because one will be conceived in those states.

original: 'o na sdug bsngal de las skyob par byed pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sdug bsngal de las skyob par byed pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What protects one from that suffering?

original: sbyin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Giving and so on are stated.

original: dka' thub ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: dka' thub ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Austerity is morality.

original: chos ni thos pa la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: chos ni thos pa la sogs pa'o ;
translated: Dharma is listening to the Dharma and so on.

original: / la la na ra sbyin pa ni gtong ba'o //
analyzed: / la la na ra sbyin pa ni gtong ba'o //
translated: Some say: Generosity is giving.

original: dka' thub ni yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong ngo //
analyzed: dka' thub ni yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong ngo //
translated: Asceticism is the purification of the fast with its eight components.

original: chos ni bzod pa ste /
analyzed: chos ni bzod pa ste /
translated: Dharma is patience.

original: de gsum gyis ni ngan song gis spong bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de gsum gyis ni ngan song gis spong bar 'gyur bas /
translated: By these three, one is freed from the lower realms.🔽As it is said in the scriptures:

original: lung las / slong ba chung yang sbyin par bya //
analyzed: lung las / slong ba chung yang sbyin par bya //
translated: Even a small gift should be given.

original: bden par smra bya khro mi bya //
analyzed: bden par smra bya khro mi bya //
translated: One should speak the truth and not be angry.

original: rnam pa 'di gsum gnas bgyis na //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di gsum gnas bgyis na //
translated: If one abides in these three aspects,

original: @263b lha yi nang du skye bar 'gyur //🔽zhes zer ro //
analyzed: @263b lha yi nang du skye bar 'gyur // zhes zer ro //
translated: one will be born among the gods.

original: la la na re chos ni skyabs su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: la la na re chos ni skyabs su 'gro ba'o //
translated: Some say: Dharma is going for refuge.

original: dka' thub ni sdig pa bshags pa'o //
analyzed: dka' thub ni sdig pa bshags pa'o //
translated: Asceticism is confessing one's sins.

original: sbyin pa ni dngos po dang / zhing dang / bsam pa'i khyad par can la bya'o zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni dngos po dang / zhing dang / bsam pa'i khyad par can la bya'o zhes 'dod do //
translated: Generosity is giving things, fields, and special intentions.

original: la la dag ni chos ni bzod pa la sogs pa bzhi la 'dod do //
analyzed: la la dag ni chos ni bzod pa la sogs pa bzhi la 'dod do //
translated: Some say: Dharma is the four, beginning with patience.

original: 'jig rten na chos ma yin pa la chos kyi sgrar bshad pa phyugs bsad pa'i mchod sbyin la sogs pa dag ni bde ba'i rgyu ma yin pas skyabs gzhan med ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten na chos ma yin pa la chos kyi sgrar bshad pa phyugs bsad pa'i mchod sbyin la sogs pa dag ni bde ba'i rgyu ma yin pas skyabs gzhan med ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the world, non-Dharma is explained as the sound of Dharma, such as the sacrifice of killing cattle, etc. Since that is not the cause of happiness, it is said, “There is no other refuge.”

original: la la na re bu dang bu mo la sogs pa dag ni /
analyzed: la la na re bu dang bu mo la sogs pa dag ni /
translated: Some say that sons, daughters, etc.

original: tshe 'di 'ba' zhig gi grogs yin pas /
analyzed: tshe 'di 'ba' zhig gi grogs yin pas /
translated: are friends only in this life.

original: 'phags pa drag shul can gyis zhus pa las kyang de skad brjod pas na chos ma gtogs pa skyabs gzhan med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa drag shul can gyis zhus pa las kyang de skad brjod pas na chos ma gtogs pa skyabs gzhan med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes zer ro //
translated: Since it is said in the noble Inquiry of Ugra, “Apart from the Dharma, there is no other refuge,” etc.

original: da ni mi rtag pa bsgom par gdams pa ni /
analyzed: da ni mi rtag pa bsgom par gdams pa ni /
translated: Now, the instruction to meditate on impermanence is stated:

original: de lta bas na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: dngos po ni 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni 'jig pa'o //
translated: Things are perishable.

original: skyo ba skye ba'i rgyu yin pas na 'chi bas 'jigs skrag par bya'o //
analyzed: skyo ba skye ba'i rgyu yin pas na 'chi bas 'jigs skrag par bya'o //
translated: Since it is the cause of the arising of sadness, one should be frightened by death.

original: des ni ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: des ni ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What is to be done by that?

original: 'chi ba la las rjes su 'breng bas na las mi dge ba spangs pa ni /
analyzed: 'chi ba la las rjes su 'breng bas na las mi dge ba spangs pa ni /
translated: Since one is bound by karma at death, one should abandon non-virtuous karma.

original: chos kyi rgyal srid kyi sa shig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal srid kyi sa shig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase the level of the sovereignty of Dharma and so on.

original: mthun pa ni rjes su 'jug pa'o //🔽'o na lus 'di ni gus shing gces par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: mthun pa ni rjes su 'jug pa'o // 'o na lus 'di ni gus shing gces par bya ba yin te /
translated: Agreeable means conducive to.

original: yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes rgol ba ni /
analyzed: yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes rgol ba ni /
translated: But this body is to be honored and cherished, because it possesses all good qualities.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba'o ;🔽/ las ni gus par byas shing gces su byas pa yang 'chi ba'i tshe yon tan thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur bas de don med par 'gyur zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba'o ; / las ni gus par byas shing gces su byas pa yang 'chi ba'i tshe yon tan thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur bas de don med par 'gyur zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: To this objection, the root text states, Why is that?

original: legs par yongs su bsrungs legs par yang yongs su btsas pas yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: legs par yongs su bsrungs legs par yang yongs su btsas pas yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation is that when death arrives, all good qualities are lost, and so the body becomes meaningless. The phrase well protected and well cherished means well.

original: phyi'i mi mthun pa las ni bsrungs zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: phyi'i mi mthun pa las ni bsrungs zhes bya ba'o//
translated: It is protected from external harm.

original: nang gi mi mthun pa las ni btsas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nang gi mi mthun pa las ni btsas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is cherished from internal harm.

original: yon tan ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa'o //
translated: Good qualities are form, sound, smell, taste, and tactility.

original: ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'byor ba'o //
analyzed: ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'byor ba'o //
translated: Possessed of means endowed with.

original: yun ring por zhes bya ba ni nam 'tsho'i bar du /
analyzed: yun ring por zhes bya ba ni nam 'tsho'i bar du /
translated: For a long time means for as long as one lives.

original: de la ro phun sum tshogs pa'i mi rtag pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la ro phun sum tshogs pa'i mi rtag pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching on the impermanence of the perfection of taste is:🔽Food, drink,

original: bza' ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /🔽bza' ba ni 'bras chan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bza' ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / bza' ba ni 'bras chan la sogs pa'o //
translated: etc.🔽Food is rice, etc.

original: bca' ba ni bu ram shing la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bca' ba ni bu ram shing la sogs pa'o //
translated: Drink is sugarcane, etc.

original: myang ba ni sbrang rtsi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: myang ba ni sbrang rtsi la sogs pa'o //
translated: Flavor is honey, etc.

original: ngoms par 'gyur ba ni btung ba'i bye brag go //
analyzed: ngoms par 'gyur ba ni btung ba'i bye brag go //
translated: Satisfaction is a particular kind of drink.

original: bsod pa ni yid du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: bsod pa ni yid du 'ong ba'o //
translated: Good is pleasing.

original: gtsang ba ni g-yos legs pa'o //
analyzed: gtsang ba ni g-yos legs pa'o //
translated: Pure is well-cooked.

original: tshim pa ni 'bru la sogs pa'o //🔽de nyid kyang mi @264a * //
analyzed: tshim pa ni 'bru la sogs pa'o // de nyid kyang mi @264a * //
translated: Filling is grain, etc.

original: rtag pas na tha ma'i mal na 'dug pa'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pas na tha ma'i mal na 'dug pa'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That itself is impermanent, as is said in the line, “When you are lying on your final bed.

original: dri phun sum tshogs pa mi rtag par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dri phun sum tshogs pa mi rtag par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching on the impermanence of the perfection of smell is:🔽Having bathed, anointed, and perfumed yourself with incense,

original: bkrus shing bskus te bdug pas bsgos zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bkrus shing bskus te bdug pas bsgos zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: etc.

original: dri nga ba ni dri mi zhim pa'o //
analyzed: dri nga ba ni dri mi zhim pa'o //
translated: Bad smell is an unpleasant smell.

original: reg pa mi rtag par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: reg pa mi rtag par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching on the impermanence of touch is:

original: yul ka shi'i ras dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yul ka shi'i ras dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The cloth of Kashi and so on.

original: sgra snyan pa mi rtag pa ni /
analyzed: sgra snyan pa mi rtag pa ni /
translated: The impermanence of sound is taught:

original: bud med kyi nang na 'dug ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bud med kyi nang na 'dug ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: When you are among women, and so on.

original: gzugs mi rtag par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs mi rtag par bstan pa ni /
translated: The impermanence of form is taught:

original: khyod kyi khyim gyi nang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: khyod kyi khyim gyi nang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In your house, and so on.

original: gdon mi za ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: Undoubtedly means certainly.

original: da ni longs spyod pa'i khyad par mi rtag par bstan pa'i phyir glang po che'i bya ba la kha'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni longs spyod pa'i khyad par mi rtag par bstan pa'i phyir glang po che'i bya ba la kha'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the impermanence of the special enjoyments, [the Buddha] says, The elephant, and so on.

original: glang po che dang / rta dang / shing rta ni zhon pa'i longs spyod do //
analyzed: glang po che dang / rta dang / shing rta ni zhon pa'i longs spyod do //
translated: Elephants, horses, and chariots are the enjoyments of riding.

original: dung la sogs pa ni sgra snyan pa'i longs spyod do //
analyzed: dung la sogs pa ni sgra snyan pa'i longs spyod do //
translated: Conches and so on are the enjoyments of pleasant sound.

original: gdugs ni dga' ba'i longs spyod do //
analyzed: gdugs ni dga' ba'i longs spyod do //
translated: Parasols are the enjoyments of pleasure.

original: rgyal mtshan la sogs pa ni mtshon pa'i longs spyod do //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan la sogs pa ni mtshon pa'i longs spyod do //
translated: Flags and so on are the enjoyments of indication.

original: gzugs kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khyad par ro //
translated: They are the special forms.

original: nor bu'i yu ba can la sogs pa ni bsil ba'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: nor bu'i yu ba can la sogs pa ni bsil ba'i bya ba'o //
translated: The jeweled staff and so on are for cooling.

original: glang po che dang rta dang dpung bu chung ni bde ba skyob pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: glang po che dang rta dang dpung bu chung ni bde ba skyob pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The elephant, horse, and foot soldiers are from the point of view of protecting one's happiness.

original: blon po la sogs pa ni shis pa rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: blon po la sogs pa ni shis pa rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: The ministers and so forth are from the point of view of proclaiming good fortune.

original: de dag mi rtag par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de dag mi rtag par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching on their impermanence is:

original: g-yo ba med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: g-yo ba med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Not moving, and so forth.

original: zhon pa'i longs spyod la mi rtag par bstan pa la sogs pa dang rim pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhon pa'i longs spyod la mi rtag par bstan pa la sogs pa dang rim pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply the teaching on the impermanence of the enjoyments of riding, and so forth, in the same order.

original: 'o na rgyal po 'ba' zhig gi lus mi rtag gam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rgyal po 'ba' zhig gi lus mi rtag gam zhe na /
translated: But is the body of the king alone impermanent?

original: thams cad kyi lus kyi rang bzhin ni 'di yin te zhes smos pas skyes pa thams cad ni 'chi bar 'gyur zhes mgo gcig tu lan gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi lus kyi rang bzhin ni 'di yin te zhes smos pas skyes pa thams cad ni 'chi bar 'gyur zhes mgo gcig tu lan gdab par bya'o //
translated: Since it is said, The nature of the body of all is this, one should answer categorically, All who are born will die.

original: 'o na 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa de dag las thabs gang gis grol bar 'gyur zhe na spang ba'i thabs gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'o na 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa de dag las thabs gang gis grol bar 'gyur zhe na spang ba'i thabs gsungs pa ni /
translated: But by what means will one be liberated from the suffering of death and so forth? The means of abandoning them is stated:

original: mi rtag par lta ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag par lta ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The view of impermanence, and so forth.

original: sdug bsngal mtha' dag gi rgyu tshe 'di la chags pa yin pas 'chi ba rjes su dran pa la gdams pa ni mi rtag par lta ba dang / zad pa dang / 'jig par lta ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mtha' dag gi rgyu tshe 'di la chags pa yin pas 'chi ba rjes su dran pa la gdams pa ni mi rtag par lta ba dang / zad pa dang / 'jig par lta ba'o //
translated: Since attachment to this life is the cause of all suffering, the instruction in mindfulness of death is the view of impermanence, the view of exhaustion, and the view of destruction.

original: 'chi ba'i 'og tu ngan song gi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mi dge ba yin pas /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i 'og tu ngan song gi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mi dge ba yin pas /
translated: Since nonvirtue is the cause of the suffering of the lower realms after death,

original: las dang 'bras bu yid ches pa'i dad pa sgom par gdams pa ni /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu yid ches pa'i dad pa sgom par gdams pa ni /
translated: the instruction in cultivating the faith of confidence in karma and its effects is

original: 'dod chags kyi chags pa med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi chags pa med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: as stated in the lines beginning “Without the attachment of desire” and so on.

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dag gi rgyu ni 'dod chags la sogs pa yin pas spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dag gi rgyu ni 'dod chags la sogs pa yin pas spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Since desire and so on are the causes of the paths of the ten nonvirtues, they should be abandoned.

original: 'khor ba @264b las thar ba ma yin par 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal mi ldog pas /
analyzed: 'khor ba @264b las thar ba ma yin par 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal mi ldog pas /
translated: Since the suffering of death is not averted without liberation from cyclic existence,

original: 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs sgom par gdams pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs sgom par gdams pa ni /
translated: the instruction in cultivating the faults of cyclic existence is

original: rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: as stated in the lines beginning “The sovereignty of a universal monarch” and so on.

original: spang zhes bya ba'i sgras slar yang phyir 'khor bar 'gyur bas spang bar bya zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: spang zhes bya ba'i sgras slar yang phyir 'khor bar 'gyur bas spang bar bya zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: This is the meaning of “abandon.”

original: slob dpon nyid kyis 'khor ba mthon dman gyi nyes pa bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: slob dpon nyid kyis 'khor ba mthon dman gyi nyes pa bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The Master himself has explained the faults of the highs and lows of cyclic existence.

original: srog ces bya ba ni tshe'i don to //
analyzed: srog ces bya ba ni tshe'i don to //
translated: “Life” means the meaning of life.

original: nad med pa ni lus kyi srog dang lus kyi bde bas khengs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nad med pa ni lus kyi srog dang lus kyi bde bas khengs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Health” means that one should not be filled with the life of the body and the happiness of the body. This is the meaning.🔽“One should enjoy the sense objects.”🔽Why is that?

original: 'dod pa dag ni longs spyad par bya ba yin no zhes de ci'i phyir zhen zhes rgol ba la gang zhig tshim par 'gyur ba de ni brten par rig nas /
analyzed: 'dod pa dag ni longs spyad par bya ba yin no zhes de ci'i phyir zhen zhes rgol ba la gang zhig tshim par 'gyur ba de ni brten par rig nas /
translated: When one knows that one is satisfied, then one should rely on them.

original: 'dod pa dag ni lan tshva'i chu lta bu yin pas phyir zhing gdung bar 'gyur bas don med pa'i phyir brten par mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni /🔽'dod pa rnams rnyed pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dod pa dag ni lan tshva'i chu lta bu yin pas phyir zhing gdung bar 'gyur bas don med pa'i phyir brten par mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni / 'dod pa rnams rnyed pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Since the sense objects are like salty water, one should not rely on them because they are meaningless, since they cause thirst again and again.🔽This is the meaning of the verse that begins, “The sense objects are like salt water.”

original: tshol ba'i dbang du byas nas rnyed pa'am so sor rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: tshol ba'i dbang du byas nas rnyed pa'am so sor rnyed pa'o //
translated: In terms of seeking, one either finds them or does not find them.

original: srung ba'i dbang du byas nas bsags pa'am rab tu bsags pa'o //
analyzed: srung ba'i dbang du byas nas bsags pa'am rab tu bsags pa'o //
translated: In terms of protection, it is accumulated or well accumulated.

original: longs spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas brten pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas brten pa'o //
translated: In terms of enjoyment, it is supported.

original: nga mi smra'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pas tshim par mi gsung ba ste /
analyzed: nga mi smra'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pas tshim par mi gsung ba ste /
translated: I do not speak” means that he does not speak of satisfaction through desire.

original: zhal gyis mi bzhes so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhal gyis mi bzhes so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that he does not accept it.🔽Well then, what is the existent effect? Nirvana is to be attained.

original: 'o na 'bras bu yod pa gang yin zhe na mya ngan las 'das pa ni bsgrub par bya'o zhes phan yon bstan pa ni /🔽ngoms pa'i 'phags pa shes rab bo //
analyzed: 'o na 'bras bu yod pa gang yin zhe na mya ngan las 'das pa ni bsgrub par bya'o zhes phan yon bstan pa ni / ngoms pa'i 'phags pa shes rab bo //
translated: The teaching of the benefits is:

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: The noble one is satisfied with wisdom.

original: mthong ba'i lam thob pa la 'bad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam thob pa la 'bad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that one should strive to attain the path of seeing.

original: shes rab ni bden pa ma nor ba'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: shes rab ni bden pa ma nor ba'i shes rab bo //
translated: Wisdom is the unmistaken wisdom of the truths.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar gsungs pa bzhin du 'jug par bya ba ni rgyal ba'i tshul te /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar gsungs pa bzhin du 'jug par bya ba ni rgyal ba'i tshul te /
translated: Thus, engaging in accordance with what the Bhagavat has said is the way of the Victor.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa klu sgrub nyid kyis rin po che'i phreng ba'i mdo las gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa klu sgrub nyid kyis rin po che'i phreng ba'i mdo las gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is stated by the master Ārya Nāgārjuna himself in the Precious Garland.

original: de ltar rtag pa dang bde ba mngon par zhen pa'i log par bslabs pa spangs pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar rtag pa dang bde ba mngon par zhen pa'i log par bslabs pa spangs pa bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the abandonment of the false training that is the adherence to permanence and happiness,

original: da ni gtsang bar phyin ci log pa'i log par sgrub pa spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gtsang bar phyin ci log pa'i log par sgrub pa spang ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to abandon the false practice that is the error regarding purity,

original: rtag tu lus la mi sdug par bsgom pa dang ldan par bya ste zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu lus la mi sdug par bsgom pa dang ldan par bya ste zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: it is said: “One should always be endowed with the cultivation of the body as impure.”

original: ji ltar bsgom par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgom par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one cultivate it?

original: lus 'di la skra dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lus 'di la skra dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said: “In this body there is hair of the head…” and so forth.

original: re zhig nang gi dbang du byas pa'o //🔽rnam par bam pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: re zhig nang gi dbang du byas pa'o // rnam par bam pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: This is from the point of view of the internal.

original: phyi'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The “bloated” and so forth are from the point of view of the external.

original: nang dang phyi'i 'dod chags kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽kun rdzob tu mi @265a * //
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i 'dod chags kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro // kun rdzob tu mi @265a * //
translated: This is because it is the antidote to the attachment to the internal and the external.🔽One should cultivate the thirty-six impure substances and so forth conventionally.

original: gtsang ba'i rdzas sum cu rtsa drug la sogs pa bsgoms nas chos nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: gtsang ba'i rdzas sum cu rtsa drug la sogs pa bsgoms nas chos nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: Then, from the point of view of reality,

original: rang bzhin med pa'i 'og nas 'byung ba lta bu sgom pa ni mi sdug pa bsgom pa'i thabs theg pa chen po'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i 'og nas 'byung ba lta bu sgom pa ni mi sdug pa bsgom pa'i thabs theg pa chen po'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The meditation on the absence of intrinsic nature, as will be explained below, is the method of cultivating the meditation on the impurity from the perspective of the Great Vehicle.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i dbang du byas pa ni /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i dbang du byas pa ni /
translated: From the perspective of the Śrāvaka Vehicle,

original: nyan thos kyis las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyis las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood as it occurs in the Śrāvakabhūmi.

original: bsgom pa'i thabs su gnas bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i thabs su gnas bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching on the place for the method of meditation

original: dgon pa na 'dug kyang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dgon pa na 'dug kyang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: is stated in the line “whether in the forest or elsewhere,” and so on.

original: lus 'du 'dzi las dben par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus 'du 'dzi las dben par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the body should be secluded from busyness.

original: de la rgyar grags kyi mtha' ni dgon pa ste /
analyzed: de la rgyar grags kyi mtha' ni dgon pa ste /
translated: In this regard, the forest is the edge of a village,

original: skye bo'i rgyun lugs dang sgra'i tsher ma las dben pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bo'i rgyun lugs dang sgra'i tsher ma las dben pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is secluded from the noise and the thorns of people.

original: lo ma dang ldan pa shing gi shing drung ste /
analyzed: lo ma dang ldan pa shing gi shing drung ste /
translated: The foot of a tree is a tree that has leaves,

original: ha cang rtag par bya ba zhen pas bsten par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ha cang rtag par bya ba zhen pas bsten par bya ba yin no //
translated: because it is not too cold or hot and is a place to be resorted to by those who are attached to constant activity.

original: khong stong gi 'du 'dzi la chags pas bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: khong stong gi 'du 'dzi la chags pas bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: An empty place is a place to be resorted to by those who are attached to the busyness of crowds.

original: yongs su rtog pa ni dpyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa ni dpyod par byed pa'o //
translated: Reflection is the analysis.

original: phan pa dang bde ba'i don la rmongs pas na byis pa'o //
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba'i don la rmongs pas na byis pa'o //
translated: The child is the one who is confused about what is beneficial and what is happiness.

original: spyi mi shes pas na blun pa'o //
analyzed: spyi mi shes pas na blun pa'o //
translated: The fool is the one who does not know the general.

original: bye brag mi phyed pas na mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: bye brag mi phyed pas na mi gsal ba'o //
translated: The unclear is the one who does not distinguish the specific.

original: phan bde'i thabs la 'jug pa mi shes pas na mi mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: phan bde'i thabs la 'jug pa mi shes pas na mi mkhas pa'o //
translated: The unskilled is the one who does not know how to engage in the means for achieving benefit and happiness.

original: dngos po 'di dag shes nas zhes bya ba ni mi gtsang brtags na'o //
analyzed: dngos po 'di dag shes nas zhes bya ba ni mi gtsang brtags na'o //
translated: Having understood these things means having examined the impurities.

original: de nyid nges pa'i don du bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid nges pa'i don du bstan pa ni /
translated: The definitive meaning of that is taught by the phrase

original: don rnam par gdon mi za ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs las zhes smos so ;
analyzed: don rnam par gdon mi za ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs las zhes smos so ;
translated: from the Dharma discourse The Unerring Meaning.

original: /'dis ni ril por 'dzin pa'i log par bsgrub pa spang ba yang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: /'dis ni ril por 'dzin pa'i log par bsgrub pa spang ba yang bstan pa yin no //
translated: This also teaches the abandonment of the false practice of grasping the whole.

original: da ni bdag tu lta ba byed pa po'i bdag tu zhen pa'i log par sgrub pa spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bdag tu lta ba byed pa po'i bdag tu zhen pa'i log par sgrub pa spang ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to abandon the false practice of clinging to a self that is the agent,

original: lus 'di thog ma dang tha ma'i rgyu la so sor brtag par bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: lus 'di thog ma dang tha ma'i rgyu la so sor brtag par bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said that this body should be examined in terms of its beginning and end.

original: dbang phyug dang dus la sogs pas ma byas pas na byed pa po med pa'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug dang dus la sogs pas ma byas pas na byed pa po med pa'o //
translated: Since it is not created by Īśvara, time, and so forth, it is without an agent.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'grub ce na /
translated: Well then, how is it accomplished?

original: pha dang ma phrad pa dang / dri za nye bar 'khor ba dang / las ji ltar bsags pa ste /
analyzed: pha dang ma phrad pa dang / dri za nye bar 'khor ba dang / las ji ltar bsags pa ste /
translated: The father and mother come together, the gandharva is present, and the karma is accumulated.

original: rgyu rkyen de gnyis dang ldan pa las skyes pas na /
analyzed: rgyu rkyen de gnyis dang ldan pa las skyes pas na /
translated: Since the intermediate existence is born from these two causes and conditions,

original: tshogs pa tsam gyis 'bras bu 'byin //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa tsam gyis 'bras bu 'byin // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the mere assembly produces the effect.

original: de'i phyir / pha ma'i khu chu dang khrag 'dus pa las 'byung ste zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / pha ma'i khu chu dang khrag 'dus pa las 'byung ste zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “it arises from the combination of the father’s semen and the mother’s blood.”

original: pha'i sa bon la gnod pa med pa dang / ma'i zla mtshan dus dang ldan pa dang / dri za nye bar 'khor bas na 'dus pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pha'i sa bon la gnod pa med pa dang / ma'i zla mtshan dus dang ldan pa dang / dri za nye bar 'khor bas na 'dus pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When the father’s seed is not damaged, the mother’s menstrual flow is timely, and the gandharva is present, it is called “combination.”

original: skye ba'i dang po khu khrag gnas //
analyzed: skye ba'i dang po khu khrag gnas //
translated: The first stage of birth is the stage of semen and blood.

original: dug can srin bu'i dug dang mtshungs //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dug can srin bu'i dug dang mtshungs // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is like the poison of a worm.

original: tha ma zhes bya ba ni lus gnas pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma zhes bya ba ni lus gnas pa'o //
translated: The last stage is the stage of the body.

original: kham gyi zas @265b zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kham gyi zas @265b zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The food of morsels is

original: dri dang ro dang reg pa'i skye mched gsum ste /
analyzed: dri dang ro dang reg pa'i skye mched gsum ste /
translated: the three sense bases of smell, taste, and touch.

original: kham gyi zas ni 'dod pa na //
analyzed: kham gyi zas ni 'dod pa na //
translated: The food of morsels is in the desire realm.

original: skye mched gsum gyi bdag nyid de //
analyzed: skye mched gsum gyi bdag nyid de //
translated: It is the nature of three sense bases.

original: zhe'o // de las kyang rags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhe'o // de las kyang rags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and that is coarser than the other two.

original: skye mched smos pa ni bza' ba'i zas zhes smos so //
analyzed: skye mched smos pa ni bza' ba'i zas zhes smos so //
translated: The sense-fields are mentioned because they are the food of the sense-fields.

original: de la spyi bo nas lhe'u sna'i bar ni bad kan gyi gnas pa'o //🔽lhe'u sna nas lte ba'i bar ni mkhris pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: de la spyi bo nas lhe'u sna'i bar ni bad kan gyi gnas pa'o // lhe'u sna nas lte ba'i bar ni mkhris pa'i gnas so //
translated: In this regard, from the crown of the head down to the navel is the location of phlegm.🔽From the navel down to the genitals is the location of bile.

original: lte ba nas rkang mthil gyi bar du ni rlung gi gnas so //
analyzed: lte ba nas rkang mthil gyi bar du ni rlung gi gnas so //
translated: From the genitals down to the soles of the feet is the location of wind.

original: de la rkyang rkyang po ni sla bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la rkyang rkyang po ni sla bar byed pa ste /
translated: In this regard, the rasanā is the one that makes things easy,

original: chu'i khams yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu'i khams yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the water element.

original: zhu bar byed pa ni me'i khams yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhu bar byed pa ni me'i khams yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The lalanā is the one that digests, because it is the fire element.

original: rnam par 'byed pa ni g-yo bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa ni g-yo bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The avadhūti is the one that separates, because it moves.

original: de ltar rgyas par bshad pa bsdu ba'i phyir yang zhes smos te /
analyzed: de ltar rgyas par bshad pa bsdu ba'i phyir yang zhes smos te /
translated: In order to summarize this extensive explanation, he says, “and so on.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni gtsang bar zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni gtsang bar zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ” Arrogance is attachment to purity.

original: ji ltar mngon zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: sna nas rnag gi rnam pa 'dzag / ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sna nas rnag gi rnam pa 'dzag / ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Pus and blood flow from the nose and so on.

original: de ltar bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i log par sgrub pa spang bar bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i log par sgrub pa spang bar bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the abandonment of the wrong practice of the manifest clinging to a self in that way,

original: da ni yon tan du lta ba'i log par sgrub pa spang ba'i phyir sgom pa ni ;
analyzed: da ni yon tan du lta ba'i log par sgrub pa spang ba'i phyir sgom pa ni ;
translated: now, in order to abandon the wrong practice of the view of good qualities, [the Bhagavān] declares meditation on the faults,

original: grogs po rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: grogs po rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: beginning with “friends, this body is impermanent, ” and so on.

original: nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid dang / nyes dmigs rtogs nas spang bar bya ba dang / spangs pa'i phan yon rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid dang / nyes dmigs rtogs nas spang bar bya ba dang / spangs pa'i phan yon rig par bya'o //
translated: The characteristics of the faults, having understood the faults, one should abandon them, and one should know the benefit of abandoning them.

original: de la nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: Therein, the teaching of the characteristics of the faults is

original: lus 'di ni 'di ltar mi rtag par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lus 'di ni 'di ltar mi rtag par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “this body is impermanent, ” and so on.

original: mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa tshig gsum smos te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa tshig gsum smos te /
translated: The characteristic of impermanence is stated in three phrases, beginning with “impermanent. ”

original: skad cig pa dang / rgyun gyis dang / glo bur gyis mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig pa dang / rgyun gyis dang / glo bur gyis mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because of momentary, continuous, and adventitious impermanence.

original: stong pa'i mtshan nyid ni nyam chung ba ste /
analyzed: stong pa'i mtshan nyid ni nyam chung ba ste /
translated: The characteristic of emptiness is “weak. ”

original: dngos por lta ba ni brtag mi bzod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos por lta ba ni brtag mi bzod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because the view of entities is unable to withstand investigation.

original: bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid ni snying po med pa ste /🔽bdag tu lta ba dag ni btsal na mi rnyed pa'i phyir gzhan du mi dmigs pa phung po dag ni du ma'i ngo bor snang ba la /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid ni snying po med pa ste / bdag tu lta ba dag ni btsal na mi rnyed pa'i phyir gzhan du mi dmigs pa phung po dag ni du ma'i ngo bor snang ba la /
translated: The characteristic of selflessness is the absence of a core.🔽Since the view of self is not found when sought, it is not observed elsewhere.

original: bdag gi rang bzhin ni gcig tu brtag pa'i phyir de med pas na zhig pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi rang bzhin ni gcig tu brtag pa'i phyir de med pas na zhig pa'o //
translated: Since the aggregates appear as a multiplicity, and the nature of self is imagined to be one, it is destroyed by the absence of that.

original: sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of suffering is

original: 'di ltar yun thung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /🔽'du byed dang / 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar yun thung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / 'du byed dang / 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum ni /
translated: as follows: “Thus, it is short-lived, etc.”🔽The three types of suffering are the suffering of conditioned existence, the suffering of change, and the suffering of suffering.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / btang snyoms kyi tshor ba gsum gyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / btang snyoms kyi tshor ba gsum gyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: These are in terms of the three feelings of pleasure, suffering, and equanimity.

original: de la tshor ba dang btang snyoms kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la tshor ba dang btang snyoms kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: In terms of the feeling of equanimity,

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal ni yun thung ba zhes bya ste /🔽bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi 'du byed pas na ring @266a * //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal ni yun thung ba zhes bya ste / bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi 'du byed pas na ring @266a * //
translated: the suffering of conditioned existence is called “short-lived.”

original: du mi gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: du mi gnas pa yin la /
translated: Since it is conditioned by pleasure and suffering, it does not last long.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag ni sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag ni sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because pleasure and pain are suffering.

original: tshor ba sdug bsngal gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: tshor ba sdug bsngal gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to the suffering of sensation,

original: sdug bsngal ba zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba zhes gsungs te /
translated: he says, “It is suffering.

original: tshor ba sdug bsngal ba dag ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba sdug bsngal ba dag ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ” Because the sensation of suffering is the suffering of suffering.

original: tshor ba bde ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to the sensation of pleasure,

original: nad mang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nad mang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “It is a mass of diseases, etc.

original: lus kyi bde ba nad med pa'i 'gyur ba ni nad mang ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi bde ba nad med pa'i 'gyur ba ni nad mang ba'o //
translated: ” The transformation of bodily pleasure into disease is a mass of diseases.

original: longs spyod la sogs pa nyams pa la sogs pas tshor ba sdug bsngal bskyed pas na 'gyur ba'i chos can yin no //
analyzed: longs spyod la sogs pa nyams pa la sogs pas tshor ba sdug bsngal bskyed pas na 'gyur ba'i chos can yin no //
translated: Because the transformation of the enjoyment of possessions, etc. into their loss, etc. generates the sensation of suffering, it is subject to change.

original: nad mang ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: nad mang ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it a mass of diseases?

original: nad kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nad kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The answer is: because it is the basis of disease.

original: nad mang ba'i snod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nad mang ba'i snod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is the vessel of a mass of diseases.

original: gnas nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gnas nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: The basis itself is explained:🔽“Bones are connected to bones.

original: rus pa la rgyus pa 'brel pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rus pa la rgyus pa 'brel pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: The bones are connected by tendons.🔽

original: rus pa dum bu nyis brgya bzhi bcu ni chu rgyus brgya drug cus sprel zhing chu ba chen po bcu drug gis brtan pa /
analyzed: rus pa dum bu nyis brgya bzhi bcu ni chu rgyus brgya drug cus sprel zhing chu ba chen po bcu drug gis brtan pa /
translated: The two hundred and forty bone segments are connected by one hundred and sixty ligaments and are stabilized by sixteen major tendons.

original: sha svar thabs brgyad cus zhal zhal byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu yin la ;
analyzed: sha svar thabs brgyad cus zhal zhal byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu yin la ;
translated: It is smeared with eighty kinds of flesh and fat.

original: gtso bo yin pas rus pa dang rgyus pa smos te /
analyzed: gtso bo yin pas rus pa dang rgyus pa smos te /
translated: The bones and tendons are mentioned because they are the main [components].

original: de'i dpe ni 'khrul 'khor lta bu ste /
analyzed: de'i dpe ni 'khrul 'khor lta bu ste /
translated: The example of that is like a machine.

original: 'gro ba dang nyal ba'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang nyal ba'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it performs the functions of going and lying down.

original: 'di ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: This is from the perspective of the suffering of change.

original: mkhas pas de la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mkhas pas de la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The line The wise do not abide in that

original: shes rab kyis brtags nas zhen par mi bya'o zhes gdams pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyis brtags nas zhen par mi bya'o zhes gdams pa'o //
translated: means that having examined with wisdom, one should not cling [to the body].

original: de ltar nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid mdor bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid mdor bstan nas /
translated: Having thus briefly explained the characteristics of the faults,

original: da ni rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to explain them extensively,

original: lus 'di ni cang mi bzod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lus 'di ni cang mi bzod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, This body is impatient, and so on.

original: khyab pa dang bstsags pa dang rten byed pa'i phyir lus zhes bya ste re zhig spyir btang ba yin no //
analyzed: khyab pa dang bstsags pa dang rten byed pa'i phyir lus zhes bya ste re zhig spyir btang ba yin no //
translated: The body is so called because it is extended, accumulated, and a support.

original: de la gzugs kyi phung po 'di dag ni ha cang mi bzod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi phung po 'di dag ni ha cang mi bzod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This aggregate of form is called “unbearable”

original: nyam chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyam chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is weak.

original: de'i dpe ni dbu ba rdos pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i dpe ni dbu ba rdos pa lta bu'o //
translated: Its example is a mass of foam.

original: lus zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'i phung po ste /
analyzed: lus zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'i phung po ste /
translated: The body is the aggregate of feeling,
