original: ring du mi gnas pa ni byung nas 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ring du mi gnas pa ni byung nas 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: which does not last long because it ceases after arising.

original: chu'i chu bur lta bu zhes bya ba ni yang skye zhing 'gag pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa ste /
analyzed: chu'i chu bur lta bu zhes bya ba ni yang skye zhing 'gag pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa ste /
translated: It is like a water bubble, because it arises and ceases again, and because it is the nature of suffering.

original: lung las kyang tshor ba ni chu'i chu bur lta bu yin la /
analyzed: lung las kyang tshor ba ni chu'i chu bur lta bu yin la /
translated: In the scriptures it is also said: “Feeling is like a water bubble.

original: tshor ba gang ci yang rung /
analyzed: tshor ba gang ci yang rung /
translated: Whatever feeling there is,

original: de ni 'dir sdug bsngal du rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'dir sdug bsngal du rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that should be known here as suffering.

original: lus zhes bya ba ni /

translated: The body is

translated: The master himself states:🔽Recitation, lamp, mirror,

analyzed: mi 'pho bar yang mkhas rtogs bya //

analyzed: re zhig tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu ni mi'i lus thob bo //

analyzed: dmyal bar 'phen no //

analyzed: gti mug gi shas che zhing nyes pa ltung ba phra mo khyad du bsad pas ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skye'o //

analyzed: 'dod chags kyi shas che zhing ser sna'i las mang du byas pas ni yi dags su skye ste /

analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams ni mnyam par ma bzhag pas na sems 'khrugs pa'o //

original: mtshan ma ni rtags so //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni rtags so //

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pas na dgyes pa zhes bya ste /

analyzed: yid mi bde ba la sogs pa nub pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: sprin lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang nub pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni rtags te mtshon pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de dag kyang ji ltar rigs par skad cig pa dang rgyun gyi ngo bos 'jig pas skad cig tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

original: rgyu la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //

original: glog ces bya ba ni ha cang myur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glog ces bya ba ni ha cang myur ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: thams cad kyang mi rtag par bstan pa yin no zhes kyang zer ro //

analyzed: la la na re skye ba mi rtag par bstan pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan dang / brag ca lta bur bshad la /

analyzed: gnas pa mi rtag pa ni sprin lta bu'o //
translated: Clouds are like duration, because they are impermanent.

original: 'chi ba mi rtag pa ni glog lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba mi rtag pa ni glog lta bu ste /

original: de ltar sprin thams cad kyang mi rtag pa zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de ltar sprin thams cad kyang mi rtag pa zhes zer ro //

original: de ltar phung po la sogs pa'i nyes dmigs spang bar bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar phung po la sogs pa'i nyes dmigs spang bar bshad nas /

analyzed: da ni gang zag tu lta ba spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Now, in order to abandon the view of the person,

analyzed: der gtogs pa'i nyes dmigs kyi mtshan @267b nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: the characteristic of the disadvantage of that is taught:

analyzed: rkyen sna tshogs las 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: rkyen sna tshogs pa ni mi shes pa dang / las dang sred pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Various conditions are of the nature of ignorance, action, and craving.

original: bdag po zhes bya ba ni byed pa po ste /
analyzed: bdag po zhes bya ba ni byed pa po ste /
translated: “Dominant” means creator,

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as Īśvara and so on.

original: de dag btsal na mi rnyed pas na med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag btsal na mi rnyed pas na med pa'o //

analyzed: de'i phyir phung po 'dod rgyal dus dang rang bzhin dang // ngo bo nyid las ma yin rgyu med yin //
translated: The aggregates do not arise from chance, time, or inherent nature; they are not causeless.

original: dbang phyug de yi rgyu min de lta bas //
analyzed: dbang phyug de yi rgyu min de lta bas //
translated: They do not arise from Īśvara and so on.

original: mi shes las dang srid las byung rig mdzod //🔽ces slob dpon nyid kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: mi shes las dang srid las byung rig mdzod // ces slob dpon nyid kyis gsungs so //
translated: Know that they arise from ignorance, action, and craving.

original: sa dang 'dra ba ni /
analyzed: sa dang 'dra ba ni /
translated: The earth-like is

original: sra ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sra ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of solidity.

original: byed pa ni las te dbang phyug la sogs pas ma byas pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: byed pa ni las te dbang phyug la sogs pas ma byas pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Action is activity, not created by Īśvara and so on, as before.

original: chu dang 'dra ba ni gsher ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chu dang 'dra ba ni gsher ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Water is the characteristic of fluidity.

original: bdag med ces bya ba ni rtag pa la sogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med ces bya ba ni rtag pa la sogs pa med pa'o //
translated: Selflessness means the absence of permanence, etc.

original: me dang 'dra ba ni tsha zhing sreg pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: me dang 'dra ba ni tsha zhing sreg pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Fire is the characteristic of heat and burning.

original: srog med pa ni drod de me yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog med pa ni drod de me yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is without life because heat is fire.

original: rlung dang 'dra ba ni yang ba dang g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid do ;
analyzed: rlung dang 'dra ba ni yang ba dang g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid do ;
translated: Wind is the characteristic of lightness and movement.

original: / gang zag med pa ni skye zhing 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽nam mkha' dang 'dra ba ni rang bzhin med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: / gang zag med pa ni skye zhing 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang yin pa'i phyir ro // nam mkha' dang 'dra ba ni rang bzhin med pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is without person because the characteristic of arising and perishing is due to the power of karma and the afflictions.

original: rig pas btsal na mi rnyed pas so //
analyzed: rig pas btsal na mi rnyed pas so //
translated: Space is without intrinsic nature because it is not found when investigated by the wise.

original: de lta bas na 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi gnas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi gnas zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called the abode of the great elements.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa dag ni de kho na nyid du brdzun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa dag ni de kho na nyid du brdzun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the unreal is false in reality.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: lus ni sa la sogs pa rgyu rkyen tshogs pa las skyes pa yin pas gnas zhes bya la /
analyzed: lus ni sa la sogs pa rgyu rkyen tshogs pa las skyes pa yin pas gnas zhes bya la /
translated: The body is called an abode because it arises from the collection of causes and conditions such as earth.

original: de dag kyang rgyu gcig gis 'bras bu du ma mi byed la /
analyzed: de dag kyang rgyu gcig gis 'bras bu du ma mi byed la /
translated: Moreover, a single cause does not produce many effects,🔽nor does a single cause produce a single effect.

original: rgyu gcig gis 'bras bu gcig kyang mi byed pa'i phyir dang / rgyu du mas 'bras bu du ma mi byed la /
analyzed: rgyu gcig gis 'bras bu gcig kyang mi byed pa'i phyir dang / rgyu du mas 'bras bu du ma mi byed la /
translated: Many causes do not produce many effects,

original: rgyu du mas 'bras bu gcig kyang mi byed pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rgyu du mas 'bras bu gcig kyang mi byed pa'i phyir la /
translated: nor do many causes produce a single effect.

original: 'on kyang ma brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du rgyu dang 'bras bu yang dmigs pas yang dag pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang ma brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du rgyu dang 'bras bu yang dmigs pas yang dag pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: However, since cause and effect are perceived as having the characteristic of the unanalyzed, they are not real.

original: phung po lnga ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i gzhi ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i gzhi ste /

original: de yang rnam par shes pa la ni bdag tu 'dzin pa la phung po lhag ma la ni bdag gir 'dzin pas na bdag dang bdag gi'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes pa la ni bdag tu 'dzin pa la phung po lhag ma la ni bdag gir 'dzin pas na bdag dang bdag gi'o //
translated: Moreover, consciousness is apprehended as the “I,” and the remaining aggregates are apprehended as “mine.”

original: de dag kyang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba med pas te stong pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba med pas te stong pa'o //
translated: Since they are free from the nature of being one or many, they are empty.

original: cis stong zhe na /
analyzed: cis stong zhe na /
translated: What is empty?

original: la la dag ni bdag ces bya ba dngos por grub par 'dod de /
analyzed: la la dag ni bdag ces bya ba dngos por grub par 'dod de /
translated: Some assert that the so-called “I” is an established thing.

original: de dag kyang ci bdag ces bya ba phung po'i ngo bo nyid dam de las ma gtogs pa zhig tu yod grangs na /
analyzed: de dag kyang ci bdag ces bya ba phung po'i ngo bo nyid dam de las ma gtogs pa zhig tu yod grangs na /
translated: If it is asked whether that self is the nature of the aggregates or something other than the aggregates,

original: phyogs @268a * //
analyzed: phyogs @268a * //
translated: the first position

original: dang po ltar na phung po dag ni mi rtag la du ma'i ngor snang ba'i phyir dang / bdag ces bya ba ni rtag pa dang gcig pur brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po ltar na phung po dag ni mi rtag la du ma'i ngor snang ba'i phyir dang / bdag ces bya ba ni rtag pa dang gcig pur brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is untenable because the aggregates appear as impermanent and multiple, and the so-called self is imagined to be permanent and singular.

original: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na /
translated: The second position

original: phung po las ma gtogs pa'i bdag ni snang du rung ba las mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / bdag gi ngo bor 'dod pa'i phyir mi rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: phung po las ma gtogs pa'i bdag ni snang du rung ba las mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / bdag gi ngo bor 'dod pa'i phyir mi rung ba nyid do //
translated: is untenable because a self that is not included in the aggregates is not observed among the things that can appear and because it is asserted to be the essence of the self.

original: la la dag ni rdul phra rab 'byung ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor gnas so zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: la la dag ni rdul phra rab 'byung ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor gnas so zhes 'dod do //
translated: Some assert that the self is the nature of the subtle particles and the elements.

original: de dag kyang cha shas dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir /🔽gang yang mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang cha shas dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir / gang yang mi rung ba'o //
translated: Those are also untenable because the errors of having parts and so on would ensue.

original: ha cang spros pas chog nas da ni dkyus ma nyid brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ha cang spros pas chog nas da ni dkyus ma nyid brjod par bya ste /
translated: Since too much elaboration is sufficient, now the main topic will be explained.

original: bems po zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa dang bral ba'o ;
analyzed: bems po zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa dang bral ba'o ;
translated: The term “inert” means devoid of awareness.

original: / da ni dpe ni rtsva la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / da ni dpe ni rtsva la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, the example is grass and so on.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir gzugs kyi phung po 'grub ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir gzugs kyi phung po 'grub ce na /
translated: But why is the form aggregate established?

original: rnam par shes pa la brten pa'i rlung gi byed pas na 'khrul 'khor dang ldan par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la brten pa'i rlung gi byed pas na 'khrul 'khor dang ldan par 'byung ba'o //
translated: It arises with a mechanism based on the wind-energy that is dependent on consciousness.

original: 'o na bems po ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bems po ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is not inert.

original: tshor ba med pas te nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba med pas te nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is devoid of feeling, it is not experienced.

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni skye gnas nas rlung gis 'phen zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni skye gnas nas rlung gis 'phen zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The term “element” means that from the moment of birth it is propelled by the wind-energy.

original: de'i dngos po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i dngos po gang zhe na /
translated: What is its nature?

original: rnag dang mi gtsang ba bsags pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnag dang mi gtsang ba bsags pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is a collection of pus and excrement.

original: khu ba dang khrag las mchi gu'i rnam pa lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khu ba dang khrag las mchi gu'i rnam pa lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: It is like a lump of semen and blood.

original: snying po med pas na gsog go //
analyzed: snying po med pas na gsog go //
translated: It is a void because it is without essence.

original: gnas pa'i 'du byed kyis kyang dgod pas na rtag tu byug pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i 'du byed kyis kyang dgod pas na rtag tu byug pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is always smeared with excrement because it is smeared with the formative forces of abiding.

original: gang las she na ;
analyzed: gang las she na ;
translated: From what?

original: nad ces smos te /
analyzed: nad ces smos te /
translated: The text says “from disease.”

original: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan dang / 'dus pa las gyur pa'i nad brgya rtsa gcig pa bzhi ni bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan dang / 'dus pa las gyur pa'i nad brgya rtsa gcig pa bzhi ni bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: The four hundred and four diseases are the one hundred and one diseases of wind, bile, phlegm, and their combination.

original: gtse ba ni gnyen po'o //
analyzed: gtse ba ni gnyen po'o //
translated: The afflictions are their antidotes.

original: rga ba ni 'byung ba yongs su smin pa'o //
analyzed: rga ba ni 'byung ba yongs su smin pa'o //
translated: Aging is the maturation of the elements.

original: zil gyis non pa ni rtag tu nyen pa'o //
analyzed: zil gyis non pa ni rtag tu nyen pa'o //
translated: Subjugation is the constant threat.

original: 'chi ba ni rnam par shes pas lus yongs su btang ba'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba ni rnam par shes pas lus yongs su btang ba'o //
translated: Death is the consciousness’s abandonment of the body.

original: de la rtsva'i rkyal pa lta bu yin pas na gsob bo //
analyzed: de la rtsva'i rkyal pa lta bu yin pas na gsob bo //
translated: Here, it is hollow because it is like a straw mat.

original: khron pa rnying pa'o //
analyzed: khron pa rnying pa'o //
translated: It is an old well.

original: de ltar na skye ba dang gnas pa dang / na ba dang 'chi ba'i ngo bo nyid pas nyes dmigs sna tshogs pa bshad nas da ni mdor bsdus te bshad pa ni /🔽phung po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na skye ba dang gnas pa dang / na ba dang 'chi ba'i ngo bo nyid pas nyes dmigs sna tshogs pa bshad nas da ni mdor bsdus te bshad pa ni / phung po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, having explained the various faults of birth, abiding, sickness, and death, now, in brief, he says:

original: phung po lnga ni gshed ma lta bu ste ;
analyzed: phung po lnga ni gshed ma lta bu ste ;
translated: The five aggregates are like executioners,

original: 'dir zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga las logs shig tu bstan pa'i phyir gshed ma lta bu zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga las logs shig tu bstan pa'i phyir gshed ma lta bu zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: Here, he says “like executioners” because the five aggregates are taught separately from the five undefiled aggregates.

original: khams rnams ni dug drag po zhes smos te /
analyzed: khams rnams ni dug drag po zhes smos te /
translated: The elements are called “strong poison”

original: sprul gdug pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sprul gdug pa lta bu'o //
translated: like a poisonous snake.🔽The sense bases are like an empty village

original: skye mched rnams ni grong stong pa lta bu zhes smos te /
analyzed: skye mched rnams ni grong stong pa lta bu zhes smos te /
translated: The sense spheres are like an empty town.🔽

original: 'di dag gis ni nyes dmigs mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni nyes dmigs mtshon pa yin no //
translated: These illustrate the disadvantages.

original: @268b phung po la sogs pa la yon tan du blta ba ni log par sgrub pa yin pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du bshad nas /
analyzed: @268b phung po la sogs pa la yon tan du blta ba ni log par sgrub pa yin pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du bshad nas /
translated: Since the view of the aggregates, etc. as good qualities is a wrong practice, after explaining their characteristics of impermanence, etc.

original: da ni nyes dmigs rtogs nas de spang bar bya ba'i phyir gdams pa ni /
analyzed: da ni nyes dmigs rtogs nas de spang bar bya ba'i phyir gdams pa ni /
translated: Now, having understood the disadvantages, in order to abandon them, the instruction is:

original: khyed kyis de lta bu'i lus de la sun pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽sun pa ni dmus byung bar bya'o ;
analyzed: khyed kyis de lta bu'i lus de la sun pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / sun pa ni dmus byung bar bya'o ;
translated: “You should be disgusted with that kind of body, etc.”🔽Disgust is to be generated as a revulsion.

original: / skyo ba bskyed pa ni spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: / skyo ba bskyed pa ni spang bar bya'o //
translated: Aversion is to be generated as a rejection.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: sngar bshad pa ltar goms par byas la nyes dmigs rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa ltar goms par byas la nyes dmigs rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: As previously explained, one should cultivate it and understand the disadvantages.

original: rtogs na spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtogs na spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one understands them, one will abandon them.

original: 'o na thob par bya ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na thob par bya ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: Well, what is to be attained?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la mos pa bskyed par bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la mos pa bskyed par bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: One should generate devotion to the body of the Tathāgata.

original: 'bras bu thob par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the result to be attained.

original: sku ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sku ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The body is of two kinds:

original: gzugs kyi sku dang / chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku dang / chos kyi sku'o //
translated: the body of form and the body of Dharma.

original: de la gtso bo yin pa'i phyir chos kyi sku smos te /
analyzed: de la gtso bo yin pa'i phyir chos kyi sku smos te /
translated: Among them, the body of Dharma is mentioned because it is primary.

original: lung las kyang //
analyzed: lung las kyang //
translated: Also, a scripture says:

original: gang zhig nga la gzugs su mthong //
analyzed: gang zhig nga la gzugs su mthong //
translated: Those who see me as form,

original: gang zhig nga la sgrar shes pa //
analyzed: gang zhig nga la sgrar shes pa //
translated: and those who know me as sound,

original: log par spong bas zhugs pa ste //
analyzed: log par spong bas zhugs pa ste //
translated: They enter into the wrong path,

original: skye bo des ni nga mi mthong //
analyzed: skye bo des ni nga mi mthong //
translated: those people do not see me.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni chos kyi sku //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni chos kyi sku //
translated: The Buddhas are the body of Dharma.

original: 'dren pa rnams ni chos nyid lta //🔽chos nyid shes par bya min par //
analyzed: 'dren pa rnams ni chos nyid lta // chos nyid shes par bya min par //
translated: The leaders are seen as reality.🔽Reality cannot be known

original: des ni yang dag shes mi nus //
analyzed: des ni yang dag shes mi nus //
translated: by one who is unable to know the truth.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / yang dge slong dag de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi skur yongs su rdzogs par ltos la 'jig tshogs la skur ma 'dzin cig ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / yang dge slong dag de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi skur yongs su rdzogs par ltos la 'jig tshogs la skur ma 'dzin cig ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And also: “Monks, you should see the Tathāgata as perfect in the body of Dharma, but do not grasp the body of sentient beings as real.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos kyi sku ni sngar bshad pa ltar khyab pa dang rtag pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni sngar bshad pa ltar khyab pa dang rtag pa'i phyir la /
translated: The Dharma body is as explained above, because it is pervasive and permanent.

original: gzugs kyi sku ni kun rdzob yin pas de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku ni kun rdzob yin pas de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The form body is conventional, and it does not exist.

original: rkyen las skyes pa rang gi dngos ma skyes //
analyzed: rkyen las skyes pa rang gi dngos ma skyes //
translated: That which arises from conditions does not arise from itself.

original: rgyal ba rnams kyi sku ni chos kyi sku //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyi sku ni chos kyi sku //
translated: The body of the victors is the Dharma body.

original: chos nyid nam mkha' lta bur rtag gnas zhes //🔽bstan pas chos skyong 'od zer 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: chos nyid nam mkha' lta bur rtag gnas zhes // bstan pas chos skyong 'od zer 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: It is taught that it always abides like space, the nature of phenomena.

original: zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: zhes gsungs la /
translated: Therefore, by teaching this, the light ray of Dharma protection is accomplished.

original: dge slong dag mtshan bzang po dang dpe byad kyi ngo bor de bzhin gshegs pa lta ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong dag mtshan bzang po dang dpe byad kyi ngo bor de bzhin gshegs pa lta ba ni /
translated: Bhikṣhus, those who view the Tathāgata as the essence of the major and minor marks🔽would also view a universal monarch as the Tathāgata.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po yang de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang / yang bdag ni ring bsrel pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid len to zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po yang de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang / yang bdag ni ring bsrel pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid len to zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because it is said, I take the perfection of wisdom itself as my relics.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis su yid la mi byed /
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis su yid la mi byed /
translated: Likewise, they do not attend to the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, as the thirty-two marks,

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cur yid la mi byed de /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cur yid la mi byed de /
translated: nor do they attend to him as the eighty minor marks.

original: dran pa med cing yid la byed pa med pa ni /
analyzed: dran pa med cing yid la byed pa med pa ni /
translated: Non-mindfulness and non-attention

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bla na med pa zhes bya'o @269a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bla na med pa zhes bya'o @269a * //
translated: is called the unsurpassed recollection of the Buddha.

original: zhes gsungs pas na chos kyi sku ni thob par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas na chos kyi sku ni thob par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the Dharma Body is what is to be attained.

original: de thob pa'i thabs lam gyi bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de thob pa'i thabs lam gyi bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the truth of the path, the means for attaining that?

original: bsod nams las skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bsod nams las skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is stated: “Arisen from merit, etc.”

original: tshogs gnyis kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir la bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pas bsod nams las skyes pa'o zhes sbrel te /
analyzed: tshogs gnyis kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir la bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pas bsod nams las skyes pa'o zhes sbrel te /
translated: Because it is the result of the two collections, the intermediate term is elided, and it is connected as “arisen from merit.”

original: de lta ma yin na /🔽bsod nams ye shes las byung ba'i //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na / bsod nams ye shes las byung ba'i //
translated: Otherwise,🔽it would be as stated:🔽“May I attain the two highest

original: dam pa gnyis ni thob par shog //
analyzed: dam pa gnyis ni thob par shog //
translated: arisen from merit and wisdom.”

original: ces slob dpon nyid kyi lung yang ji ltar grang /
analyzed: ces slob dpon nyid kyi lung yang ji ltar grang /
translated: How is it that the Master himself has a scripture that says this?

original: la la na re yon tan gyi mtshan nyid tsam la chos kyi skur bshad pas bsod nams las skyes zhes bya'o zhes kyang zer ro //🔽la la ni de lta na ni rgyu ni ma tshang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: la la na re yon tan gyi mtshan nyid tsam la chos kyi skur bshad pas bsod nams las skyes zhes bya'o zhes kyang zer ro // la la ni de lta na ni rgyu ni ma tshang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Some say: Since the mere characteristics of qualities are explained as the body of attributes, it is said that the body of attributes is generated from merit.

original: yon tan gyi sku la chos kyi skur bshad na /
analyzed: yon tan gyi sku la chos kyi skur bshad na /
translated: Some say: In that case, the cause is incomplete, because if the body of qualities is explained as the body of attributes,

original: ye shes kyi cha la bsod nams su ci'i phyir mi 'dogs /
analyzed: ye shes kyi cha la bsod nams su ci'i phyir mi 'dogs /
translated: why is the aspect of transcendent wisdom not designated as merit?

original: 'dogs na ni 'dod pa kho na yin la ma yin na ni rgyu ma tshang bar 'gyur ro zhes kyang zer ro //
analyzed: 'dogs na ni 'dod pa kho na yin la ma yin na ni rgyu ma tshang bar 'gyur ro zhes kyang zer ro //
translated: If it is designated as such, it is just what we assert, but if it is not, the cause is incomplete.

original: bsod nams nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsod nams nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is merit?

original: sbyin pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sbyin pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said that merit arises from generosity and so on.

original: sbyin pa ni gtong ba dang / gtong ba chen po dang / shin tu gtong ba'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: sbyin pa ni gtong ba dang / gtong ba chen po dang / shin tu gtong ba'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Generosity is the nature of giving, great giving and complete giving.

original: sngar bshad pa'i phung po yongs su dag pa gang yin pa ni /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i phung po yongs su dag pa gang yin pa ni /
translated: The aggregates that were previously explained as completely pure

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa ste /
translated: are ethics and so on.

original: tshul khrims ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'o //
translated: Morality is the morality of restraint, etc.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Concentration is the concentration of the illusion-like, etc.

original: shes rab ni mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab ni mkhyen pa ste /
translated: Wisdom is knowledge.

original: gsum char yang zag pa med pa la bya'o //
analyzed: gsum char yang zag pa med pa la bya'o //
translated: All three are to be understood as uncontaminated.

original: rnam par grol ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'o //
translated: Liberation is the abandonment of all obscurations, such as those to be abandoned by seeing, etc.

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba ni khyad par can gyi ye shes mngon sum du byas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba ni khyad par can gyi ye shes mngon sum du byas pa'o //
translated: The vision of the wisdom of liberation is the direct realization of special wisdom.

original: byams pa la sogs pa bzhi ni tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa bzhi ni tshad med pa'o //
translated: The four beginning with love are the immeasurables.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ste /
translated: Generosity, etc. are the ten perfections.

original: dul ba ni nyon mongs pa 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: dul ba ni nyon mongs pa 'dul ba'o //
translated: Subjugation is the subjugation of afflictions.

original: yang dag par sdom pa ni zag pa sdom par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sdom pa ni zag pa sdom par byed pa'o //
translated: Correct restraint is the restraint of defilements.

original: dge ba bcu ni srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa ste tshul khrims kyi rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba bcu ni srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa ste tshul khrims kyi rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: The ten virtues are the abandonment of killing, etc., which are the divisions of morality.

original: sdug bsngal las ji mi snyam pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum ni bzod pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las ji mi snyam pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum ni bzod pa'o //
translated: The three aspects beginning with the indifference to suffering are patience.

original: gzhan la mi 'tshe ba ni nges pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan la mi 'tshe ba ni nges pa ste /
translated: The certainty is the non-harming of others.

original: 'di gnyis ni bzod pa'i rab tu dbye ba'o //🔽rgyun mi gcod pas na brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni bzod pa'i rab tu dbye ba'o // rgyun mi gcod pas na brtson 'grus so //
translated: These two are the divisions of patience.🔽It is effort because it is uninterrupted.

original: brtson pa mi 'dor bas na brtan pa'o //
analyzed: brtson pa mi 'dor bas na brtan pa'o //
translated: It is firm because it does not abandon exertion.

original: sems rab tu 'dzin pa'i phyir yang brtan pa ste /
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin pa'i phyir yang brtan pa ste /
translated: It is also firm because it holds the mind.

original: 'di gsum ni spro ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'di gsum ni spro ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: These three are the distinctions of enthusiasm.

original: bsam gtan ni bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Dhyana is the first dhyana, etc.

original: rnam @269b par thar pa ni gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba la sogs pa brgyad do //
analyzed: rnam @269b par thar pa ni gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba la sogs pa brgyad do //
translated: Liberation is the eight liberations, such as the visible form of one who has form looking at visible forms, etc.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Concentration is the hero’s progress, etc.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: Attainment is the four dhyanas, the four formless attainments, and the attainment of cessation.

original: 'di bzhi ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di bzhi ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: These four are the divisions of concentration.

original: thos pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la den snang ba'i mig gi yul can no //
analyzed: thos pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la den snang ba'i mig gi yul can no //
translated: Hearing is the eye’s object that appears as sound to the mental consciousness.

original: shes rab ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the thorough differentiation of phenomena.

original: thabs ni thabs la mkhas pa'i yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: thabs ni thabs la mkhas pa'i yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Skill in means is the embracing of skill in means.

original: 'dis ni smon lam dang / stobs dang / ye shes kyang bsdus par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni smon lam dang / stobs dang / ye shes kyang bsdus par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that this includes vows, power, and knowledge.

original: 'di gsum ni shes rab kyi rab tu dbye ba ste ;
analyzed: 'di gsum ni shes rab kyi rab tu dbye ba ste ;
translated: These three are the divisions of wisdom.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag kyang lam gang du sgom zhe na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag kyang lam gang du sgom zhe na /
translated: In which path are the six perfections cultivated?

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun zhes smos te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun zhes smos te /
translated: The thirty-seven aids to enlightenment are mentioned.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la sogs pa lam bzhi'i ngo bo nyid du sgom mo //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la sogs pa lam bzhi'i ngo bo nyid du sgom mo //
translated: They are cultivated as the nature of the four paths, beginning with the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa de dag ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa de dag ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
translated: How are those four foundations of mindfulness and so on cultivated?

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes gsungs te /
translated: Tranquility and insight are mentioned.

original: zhi gnas ni sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas ni sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: Tranquility is one-pointedness of mind.

original: lhag mthong ni so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong ni so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: Insight is discernment.

original: lam lnga pa mi slob pa'i lam la ni stobs bcu zhes smos te /
analyzed: lam lnga pa mi slob pa'i lam la ni stobs bcu zhes smos te /
translated: On the fifth path, the path of no-more-learning, the ten powers are mentioned.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa la sogs pa bcu'o //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa la sogs pa bcu'o //
translated: The ten powers are the power of knowledge of what is possible and impossible, etc.

original: mi 'jigs pa ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa zhal gyis bzhes pa la sogs pa bzhi la klan ka'i rgol ba chos dang mthun pa med pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa zhal gyis bzhes pa la sogs pa bzhi la klan ka'i rgol ba chos dang mthun pa med pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four fearlessnesses are the four fearlessnesses in accepting the abandonment of the afflictions, etc.,

original: ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni /
translated: The eighteen distinctive qualities are

original: spyod pa ma 'dres pa dang / rtog pa ma 'dres pa dang / phrin las dang ye shes kyi ma 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: spyod pa ma 'dres pa dang / rtog pa ma 'dres pa dang / phrin las dang ye shes kyi ma 'dres pa ste /
translated: the distinctive qualities of conduct, the distinctive qualities of knowledge, and the distinctive qualities of activity and wisdom.

original: 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba la sogs pa bco brgyad do //
analyzed: 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba la sogs pa bco brgyad do //
translated: The distinctive qualities of conduct are the eighteen distinctive qualities such as the absence of error, etc.🔽The distinctive qualities of knowledge are the ten powers.🔽The distinctive qualities of activity and wisdom are the four fearlessnesses and the eighteen distinctive qualities.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad ni dad pa'i stobs su bshad pa'i yon tan thams cad kyi mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad ni dad pa'i stobs su bshad pa'i yon tan thams cad kyi mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of all perfections is the perfection of all the qualities explained as the power of faith.

original: mngon par shes pa ni rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa rnam pa drug shes pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa ni rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa rnam pa drug shes pa'o //
translated: The higher perceptions are the six kinds of knowledge such as the knowledge of magical powers.

original: rig pa ni rnam pa gsum shes pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa ni rnam pa gsum shes pa'o //
translated: The three knowledges are the three knowledges.

original: mi dge ba ni sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Nonvirtue is the three kinds of suffering.

original: spong ba ni kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: spong ba ni kun 'byung ngo //
translated: Abandonment is the origin.

original: dge ba ni 'gog pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: dge ba ni 'gog pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Virtue is the nature of cessation.

original: sdud pa ni lam mo //
analyzed: sdud pa ni lam mo //
translated: The summary is the path.

original: bden pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: bden pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: Truth is the accumulation of merit.

original: yang dag pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: Reality is the accumulation of wisdom.

original: bag yod pa ni yon tan de dag 'grub pa'i rgyu'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: bag yod pa ni yon tan de dag 'grub pa'i rgyu'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: Carefulness is the cause for accomplishing those qualities.

original: de ltar rgyas par bshad nas mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: de ltar rgyas par bshad nas mdor bsdu na /
translated: Having explained in detail, in brief,

original: dge ba'i las tshad med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i las tshad med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: it is called “immeasurable virtuous karma.”

original: dngos po dang dus so //
analyzed: dngos po dang dus so //
translated: It is in terms of entity and time.

original: de la dngos po ni /
analyzed: de la dngos po ni /
translated: With regard to that, the entity

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mtha' dag go //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mtha' dag go //
translated: is the entire accumulation of merit and wisdom.

original: @270a * // dus ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum mo //
analyzed: @270a * // dus ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum mo //
translated: The time is the three incalculable eons.

original: de ltar na dngos po dang dus tshad med pas tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po dang dus tshad med pas tshad med pa'o //
translated: Thus, because of immeasurable entity and time, it is immeasurable.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang sngar bshad pa'i lam rnam pa bzhi'i ngo bor phyogs kyi chos rnams sgom par byed pa na /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang sngar bshad pa'i lam rnam pa bzhi'i ngo bor phyogs kyi chos rnams sgom par byed pa na /
translated: Moreover, when one meditates on the qualities of the four aspects of the path explained above,

original: lam gang dang gang la gtsor byed can tshogs kyis la mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lam gang dang gang la gtsor byed can tshogs kyis la mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: on whatever path one emphasizes, it is called “abandoning all nonvirtuous qualities.”

original: ldog pa'i tshul khrims gtsor bsgom mo //
analyzed: ldog pa'i tshul khrims gtsor bsgom mo //
translated: One meditates on the ethics of turning away from nonvirtue.

original: sbyor ba'i lam la dge ba sdud pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam la dge ba sdud pa zhes bya ste /
translated: On the path of preparation, it is called the virtue of accumulation.

original: 'jug pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: It is the morality of engagement.

original: mthong ba'i lam la bden pa las skyes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la bden pa las skyes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: On the path of insight, it is called the morality born of the truths.

original: ye shes bcu drug la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes bcu drug la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it focuses on the sixteen aspects of the truths.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la yang dag pa nyid las skyes pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la yang dag pa nyid las skyes pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: On the path of cultivation, it is called the morality born of reality.

original: yang dag pa ni phyin ci ma log pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa ni phyin ci ma log pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: Reality is the undistorted reality.

original: nyid ces bya ba ni ji ltar mthong ba'i don de nyid goms par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba ni ji ltar mthong ba'i don de nyid goms par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called reality because one cultivates just that reality which one has seen.

original: bag yod pa zhes bya ba ni chos de dag thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir mtha' dag par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bag yod pa zhes bya ba ni chos de dag thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir mtha' dag par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply heedfulness to all of these dharmas because it is the root of all of them.

original: dge ba'i las tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i las tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is called the immeasurable virtue of good karma.

original: bsod nams brgya las skyes pa'o zhes bya'o//🔽de ltar na sku rnam pa gnyis ni /
analyzed: bsod nams brgya las skyes pa'o zhes bya'o// de ltar na sku rnam pa gnyis ni /
translated: It is called born of a hundred merits.

original: tshogs rnam pa gnyis las skyes so zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: tshogs rnam pa gnyis las skyes so zhes 'dod do //
translated: Thus, these two kinds of bodies are born of these two kinds of stores.🔽This is the explanation of the morality of restraint.

original: 'o na lam gyi chos ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o zhes 'byung ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na lam gyi chos ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o zhes 'byung ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t it said that the dharma of the path is the eightfold noble path?

original: bden mod kyi 'gal ba ni med de der ni gtso bo smos te /
analyzed: bden mod kyi 'gal ba ni med de der ni gtso bo smos te /
translated: That is true, but there is no contradiction, because there the principal is mentioned,

original: 'dir ni lam mtha' dag gtsor gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni lam mtha' dag gtsor gzung ba yin no //
translated: but here the entire path is taken as principal.

original: de ltar bden pa bzhi shes par bya ba ni log par sgrub pa spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bden pa bzhi shes par bya ba ni log par sgrub pa spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the knowledge of the four truths is the abandonment of wrong practice.

original: de ltar khyim pa rnams kyi sgrub pa spyir bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar khyim pa rnams kyi sgrub pa spyir bshad nas /
translated: Having thus explained the practice in general for householders,

original: da ni dbang phyug gi gnas rnyed pa rnams kyi sgrub pa bye brag tu bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni dbang phyug gi gnas rnyed pa rnams kyi sgrub pa bye brag tu bshad par bya'o //
translated: now the practice should be explained in particular for those who have attained the state of lordliness.

original: de la yang dag pa'i sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: And in order to show the right practice,

original: dbang phyug gi gnas rnyed na yang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dbang phyug gi gnas rnyed na yang zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said: “Even if one has attained the state of lordliness,”

original: log par sgrub pa ni mi dge ba la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: log par sgrub pa ni mi dge ba la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: Wrong practice is the non-virtuous and so on that will be explained below.

original: yang dag pa'i sgrub pa ni tshul rnam pa brgyad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sgrub pa ni tshul rnam pa brgyad la sogs pa'o //
translated: Right practice is the eightfold path and so on.

original: de nyid bstan pa ni skye dgu bskyang ba la brtson pa'i chos kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa ni skye dgu bskyang ba la brtson pa'i chos kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The teaching of that is stated by “the Dharma King who strives to protect living beings” and so forth.

original: skye dgu ni res su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye dgu ni res su gtogs pa'o //
translated: Living beings are those who belong to a class.

original: bskyang ba ni chos kyis bskyang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: bskyang ba ni chos kyis bskyang bar bya ba'o //
translated: Protection is protection by Dharma.

original: chos kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba ni chos dang mthun par byed pa mtha' dag go //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba ni chos dang mthun par byed pa mtha' dag go //
translated: The Dharma King is one who acts in accordance with Dharma.

original: la la ni chos kyi rgyal po zhes bod pa ste /
analyzed: la la ni chos kyi rgyal po zhes bod pa ste /
translated: Some say that the Dharma King is a title.

original: gang phyir bzod dang mi bzod pa //
analyzed: gang phyir bzod dang mi bzod pa //
translated: Because he knows what to accept and what to reject,

original: shes par dga' bas rgyal po ni //
analyzed: shes par dga' bas rgyal po ni //
translated: the king is praised by those who delight in knowledge.

original: chos min rigs pas min spyod kyang //
analyzed: chos min rigs pas min spyod kyang //
translated: Even though he does not act unrighteously,

original: rjes su 'tsho bas phal cher bstod //
analyzed: rjes su 'tsho bas phal cher bstod //
translated: the majority praise him.

original: ces bya bas rab snang gtum po la ngor bstod pa bzhin no zhes zer @270b ro ;
analyzed: ces bya bas rab snang gtum po la ngor bstod pa bzhin no zhes zer @270b ro ;
translated: This is like the praise of the cruel king Pradyota by the Nirgrantha truthful one.

original: / de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: / de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gcer bu bden smra ba ni ngor bstod pa'i kha gsag can yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcer bu bden smra ba ni ngor bstod pa'i kha gsag can yang ma yin te /
translated: The Nirgrantha truthful one is not one who praises with flattery.

original: mdo 'di nyid las rgyal po chen po khyod ni gtum po'o khyod ni khro bo'o zhes ngor ldog pa'i phyir dang / bde ba'i tshig ni gong gi 'brel ba'i sgras drangs kyang mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid las rgyal po chen po khyod ni gtum po'o khyod ni khro bo'o zhes ngor ldog pa'i phyir dang / bde ba'i tshig ni gong gi 'brel ba'i sgras drangs kyang mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this very sūtra says, “Great King, you are fierce, you are wrathful,” in order to turn him away, and because it is not tenable to draw out the word “happiness” from the preceding context.

original: brgyad ces smos pa ni bye ba'i ngo bo bsdus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: brgyad ces smos pa ni bye ba'i ngo bo bsdus pa'i phyir te /
translated: The mention of “eight” is in order to include the nature of ten million.

original: zhib tu ni rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhib tu ni rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In detail, it is because there are infinitely many divisions.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: gzhan la ltos pa'i dbang du byas pa dang / rang la ltos pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa'i dbang du byas pa dang / rang la ltos pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: From the perspective of depending on others and from the perspective of depending on oneself.

original: gzhan la ltos pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Depending on others is threefold:

original: sems can sdug bsngal la spyod pa dang / bde ba la gnas pa dang / rjes su 'brel pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal la spyod pa dang / bde ba la gnas pa dang / rjes su 'brel pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: from the perspective of sentient beings experiencing suffering, abiding in happiness, and being related.

original: sdug bsngal la spyod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la spyod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Experiencing suffering is twofold:

original: rgyu la zhugs pa dang / sdug bsngal dngos la spyod pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu la zhugs pa dang / sdug bsngal dngos la spyod pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: from the perspective of engaging in the cause and experiencing the actual suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la zhugs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la zhugs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The cause of suffering is twofold:

original: bag med pa dang log par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: bag med pa dang log par sgrub pa'o //
translated: negligence and wrong practice.

original: de la bag med pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la bag med pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to negligence,

original: ris su gtogs pa la bu'i 'du shes so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ris su gtogs pa la bu'i 'du shes so zhes bya'o //
translated: it is the idea of a son with regard to those who belong to one’s own group.

original: log par sgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas nad pa'i 'du shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: log par sgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas nad pa'i 'du shes zhes bya'o //
translated: With regard to wrong practice, it is the idea of a patient.

original: sdug bsngal dngos la spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas snying rje'i 'du shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dngos la spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas snying rje'i 'du shes zhes bya'o //
translated: With regard to the actual experience of suffering, it is the idea of compassion.

original: bde ba la gnas pa'i dbang du byas nas dga' ba'i 'du shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba la gnas pa'i dbang du byas nas dga' ba'i 'du shes zhes bya'o //
translated: With regard to those who are happy, it is the idea of joy.

original: rjes su 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis te ;🔽'khon pas rjes su 'brel pa dang / mdza' bas rjes su 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis te ; 'khon pas rjes su 'brel pa dang / mdza' bas rjes su 'brel pa'o //
translated: There are two kinds of connection:🔽connection through hostility and connection through affection.

original: de la 'khon pas rjes su 'brel pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la 'khon pas rjes su 'brel pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to connection through hostility,

original: de'i gzhi la nyes par lta ba'i 'du shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gzhi la nyes par lta ba'i 'du shes zhes bya'o //
translated: it is the idea of seeing faults in the basis of that.

original: mdza' bas rjes su 'brel pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: mdza' bas rjes su 'brel pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to connection through affection,

original: rjes su srung ba'i 'du shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su srung ba'i 'du shes zhes bya'o //
translated: it is the idea of protecting.

original: rang la ltos pa'i rnam pa gnyis te /🔽longs spyod kyi dbang du byas pa dang / bdag gi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: rang la ltos pa'i rnam pa gnyis te / longs spyod kyi dbang du byas pa dang / bdag gi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: There are two aspects in relation to oneself:🔽the aspect of enjoyment and the aspect of the self.

original: de la longs spyod kyi dbang du byas pa ni /
analyzed: de la longs spyod kyi dbang du byas pa ni /
translated: The aspect of enjoyment is

original: sman gyi 'du shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sman gyi 'du shes zhes bya'o //
translated: called the perception of medicine.

original: bdag gi dbang du byas pa ni bdag med pa'i 'du shes zhes byas so //
analyzed: bdag gi dbang du byas pa ni bdag med pa'i 'du shes zhes byas so //
translated: The aspect of the self is called the perception of selflessness.

original: de ltar dbye ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dbye ba bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the classification,

original: gsal ba'i dbye ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gsal ba'i dbye ba bstan pa ni /
translated: the classification of the clear is taught.

original: rgyal po chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The great king, etc.

original: rgyal po chen po zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i mnyes pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i mnyes pa'i tshig go //
translated: The great king is a word of pleasant address.

original: ris ni 'khor du gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ris ni 'khor du gyur ba'o //
translated: The faction is the retinue.

original: mi srun pa ni 'khor du gyur pa bag med pa'o //
analyzed: mi srun pa ni 'khor du gyur pa bag med pa'o //
translated: The unruly are the heedless in the retinue.

original: bag med pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bag med pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of heedlessness:

original: sdig pa spyod pa dang / so tshis mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa spyod pa dang / so tshis mi shes pa'o //
translated: the practice of evil and not knowing how to take care of oneself.

original: tshar gcad pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: tshar gcad pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of punishment:

original: bzhams te bsgo ba dang / 'khyig @271a * //
analyzed: bzhams te bsgo ba dang / 'khyig @271a * //
translated: warning, binding,

original: cing sdod pa dang / tshogs su sma dbab pa dang / bskrad pa'i las bya ba'o //
analyzed: cing sdod pa dang / tshogs su sma dbab pa dang / bskrad pa'i las bya ba'o //
translated: and to banish them from the monastery.

original: bskrad pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bskrad pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Banishment is of two kinds:

original: re zhig pa dag gtan du ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig pa dag gtan du ba'o //
translated: temporary and permanent.

original: snying rje'i bsam pa mi gtong ba ni /
analyzed: snying rje'i bsam pa mi gtong ba ni /
translated: The attitude of compassion is not to abandon them,

original: thams cad du rang gi nyon mongs pa las srung ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad du rang gi nyon mongs pa las srung ba'o //
translated: but to protect them from their own afflictions.

original: nad pa'i 'du shes ni ji skad du /🔽rtag tu nyes pas rang dbang med par byas sems kyis //
analyzed: nad pa'i 'du shes ni ji skad du / rtag tu nyes pas rang dbang med par byas sems kyis //
translated: The attitude of a nurse is as follows:

original: skye bo rnams la blo ldan nyes par mi 'dzin te //
analyzed: skye bo rnams la blo ldan nyes par mi 'dzin te //
translated: The wise do not consider people at fault,🔽because they think, “They act wrongly because they are overpowered by afflictions,

original: mi 'dod bzhin du log par sgrub par 'gyur ro zhes //
analyzed: mi 'dod bzhin du log par sgrub par 'gyur ro zhes //
translated: and they do not want to suffer.”

original: skye bo dag la snying rje rnam par 'phel phyir ro //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: skye bo dag la snying rje rnam par 'phel phyir ro // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus compassion for sentient beings increases.

original: mi khro ba ni byams pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: mi khro ba ni byams pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: Not being angry is to cultivate loving kindness.
