analyzed: 'dzin pa'i tshul ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The method of preservation is fourfold:

original: sgrub pa dang ldan pas 'dzin pa dang / rigs pa dang ldan pas 'dzin pa dang / dbang phyug dang ldan pas 'dzin pa dang / rnal 'byor dang ldan pas 'dzin pa'o //🔽sgrub pa dang ldan pas 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: sgrub pa dang ldan pas 'dzin pa dang / rigs pa dang ldan pas 'dzin pa dang / dbang phyug dang ldan pas 'dzin pa dang / rnal 'byor dang ldan pas 'dzin pa'o // sgrub pa dang ldan pas 'dzin pa ni /
translated: preservation by means of practice, preservation by means of reasoning, preservation by means of sovereignty, and preservation by means of yoga.

original: thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / sgom pa la rab tu sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / sgom pa la rab tu sbyor ba'o //
translated: Preservation by means of practice is the application to listening, reflection, and meditation.

original: rigs pa ni rnam pa mang ste /
analyzed: rigs pa ni rnam pa mang ste /
translated: Reasoning is of many kinds.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas de dag gis ji ltar 'dzin ce na /🔽mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa la brten nas chos mi mthun par smra ba'i phyi rol gyi mu stegs kun du rgyu la sogs pa dag gis /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas de dag gis ji ltar 'dzin ce na / mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa la brten nas chos mi mthun par smra ba'i phyi rol gyi mu stegs kun du rgyu la sogs pa dag gis /
translated: How do they apprehend them through direct perception and inference?

original: rtag par 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i grub pa'i mtha' ngan pa rnam par 'joms shing /🔽yang dag pa'i lta ba la 'god pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung la brten nas /
analyzed: rtag par 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i grub pa'i mtha' ngan pa rnam par 'joms shing / yang dag pa'i lta ba la 'god pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung la brten nas /
translated: They destroy the bad tenets of non Buddhists such as the tirthikas who proclaim a doctrine contrary to the Dharma, such as the belief in permanence, through direct perception and inference.

original: nang gi mu stegs kha cig brjed du med pa'i gang zag tu lta ba la sogs pa log pa'i grub pa'i mtha' la zhen pa rnams de las bzlog cing /
analyzed: nang gi mu stegs kha cig brjed du med pa'i gang zag tu lta ba la sogs pa log pa'i grub pa'i mtha' la zhen pa rnams de las bzlog cing /
translated: They establish them in the correct view and they refute the attachment of some Buddhists to the bad tenets of nihilism, such as the view that the person is not remembered.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba la 'god pa dag ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba la 'god pa dag ni /
translated: They establish them in the correct view.

original: reg pa dang ldan pas chos yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: reg pa dang ldan pas chos yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: They uphold the Dharma through contact.

original: dbang phyug dang ldan pas ji ltar 'dzin ce na /
analyzed: dbang phyug dang ldan pas ji ltar 'dzin ce na /
translated: How do they uphold the Dharma through power?

original: kha cig rgyal po dbang phyug gi che ba nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i tshe /
analyzed: kha cig rgyal po dbang phyug gi che ba nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i tshe /
translated: Some obtain the power of a king.

original: de'i 'khor du dge sbyong dang bram ze gang yang rung /
analyzed: de'i 'khor du dge sbyong dang bram ze gang yang rung /
translated: In the retinue of such a king, there are ascetics and brahmins.

original: yang la la zhig chen po yongs su spangs shing bor /
analyzed: yang la la zhig chen po yongs su spangs shing bor /
translated: Some of them have abandoned and rejected the great way.

original: de btang nas nag po bstan pa'i chos ston cing 'dul ba la 'god pas dam pa'i chos nub par byed pa mthong na /
analyzed: de btang nas nag po bstan pa'i chos ston cing 'dul ba la 'god pas dam pa'i chos nub par byed pa mthong na /
translated: Having abandoned it, they teach the Dharma of the dark side and establish it in the monastic discipline.

original: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni log pa'i lam du zhugs shing /
analyzed: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni log pa'i lam du zhugs shing /
translated: When he sees that the true Dharma is disappearing, he thinks, “Alas, these beings have entered a false path.

original: gzhan yang de'i rjes su 'khrid par byed pa la phan pa dang bde ba 'byung ba'i rgyu yang nub par byed pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang de'i rjes su 'khrid par byed pa la phan pa dang bde ba 'byung ba'i rgyu yang nub par byed pas /
translated: They are causing the disappearance of the cause of the benefit and happiness of those whom they are leading astray.

original: ma la bdag ni ngan song du lhung yang bla'i /
analyzed: ma la bdag ni ngan song du lhung yang bla'i /
translated: I would rather fall into the lower realms.

original: 'di dag ni de lta ma yin no snyam nas snying rje'i bsam pas de dag srog dang bral ba'i bar du byed cing /
analyzed: 'di dag ni de lta ma yin no snyam nas snying rje'i bsam pas de dag srog dang bral ba'i bar du byed cing /
translated: It is not right for them to do this.” With this thought of compassion, he will even kill them.

original: des chos yun ring du gnas pa ni dbang phyug dang ldan pas yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: des chos yun ring du gnas pa ni dbang phyug dang ldan pas yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The Dharma will remain for a long time, and it will be protected by those who have power.

original: rnal 'byor dang ldan pas 'dzin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor dang ldan pas 'dzin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is protection through being endowed with yoga?

original: 'ga' zhig bsam gtan gyi mthu phul du byung zhing ting nge 'dzin la dbang thob par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig bsam gtan gyi mthu phul du byung zhing ting nge 'dzin la dbang thob par 'gyur bas /
translated: Some will attain the highest power of meditative concentration and will master meditative concentration.

original: sngar bshad pa lta bu'i gang zag la rdzu 'phrul ston cing /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa lta bu'i gang zag la rdzu 'phrul ston cing /
translated: They will display miracles to the persons mentioned above and will frighten or inspire them.

original: skrag pa'am 'dun par byed pas dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas par byed pa ni rnal 'byor dang ldan pas dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa'o //🔽don gyi skabs 'dir ni sgrub pas 'dzin pa'i phyogs @273a * //
analyzed: skrag pa'am 'dun par byed pas dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas par byed pa ni rnal 'byor dang ldan pas dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa'o // don gyi skabs 'dir ni sgrub pas 'dzin pa'i phyogs @273a * //
translated: Thus, they will cause the holy Dharma to remain for a long time. This is the preservation of the holy Dharma by those who are endowed with yoga.

original: gcig bstan to //
analyzed: gcig bstan to //
translated: In this context, the preservation by practice is taught as one part.

original: gnyis pa ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos la smod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos la smod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The second is the condemnation of sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: kun rdzob la skur pa mi 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob la skur pa mi 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it does not deny the conventional.

original: gsum pa ni stong pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni stong pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The third is the emptiness, etc.

original: bzhi pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa zhes gsungs te ;
analyzed: bzhi pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa zhes gsungs te ;
translated: The fourth is the generation of the thought of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'o //
translated: Enlightened attitude is conventional and ultimate.

original: des na chos yongs su 'dzin pa ni phan pa dang bde ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: des na chos yongs su 'dzin pa ni phan pa dang bde ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be said that the thorough grasping of the Dharma is the cause of benefit and happiness.

original: don 'grub pa'i thabs thams cad kyang phan tshun du 'dra ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don 'grub pa'i thabs thams cad kyang phan tshun du 'dra ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Moreover, all the means of accomplishing the aim are not similar to each other.

original: bden mod kyi 'dir sngar brjod pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub par bshad pa de nyid ni rgyas par byas pa yin pas don thob pa gtso bo zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: bden mod kyi 'dir sngar brjod pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub par bshad pa de nyid ni rgyas par byas pa yin pas don thob pa gtso bo zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: Although this is true, since the establishment of the Dharma that was previously mentioned in accordance with the explanation is just the elaboration, it should be said that the attainment of the aim is the principal matter.

original: de ltar yang dag par sgrub par bshad nas da ni log par sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir re zhig mtshams sbyar ba ni mi dge ba yongs su spang bar bya ba gang zhe na zhes smos te /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag par sgrub par bshad nas da ni log par sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir re zhig mtshams sbyar ba ni mi dge ba yongs su spang bar bya ba gang zhe na zhes smos te /
translated: Having thus explained the correct practice, now, in order to teach the incorrect practice, the connection is first made: What is the nonvirtue that should be abandoned?

original: sngar bshad pa de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid mi dge ba yin pa na yin nam /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid mi dge ba yin pa na yin nam /
translated: Since the very opposite of that which was previously explained is nonvirtue, is it nonvirtue?

original: de las lhag pa ci zhig yod ces rgol ba ni gang zhe na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las lhag pa ci zhig yod ces rgol ba ni gang zhe na zhes bya'o //
translated: What is more than that?

original: lan ni der ma zad kyi rtsa ba'i ltung ba dag kyang yin no zhes bstan pa ni nyi ma'i snying po'i le'u las 'byung ba zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: lan ni der ma zad kyi rtsa ba'i ltung ba dag kyang yin no zhes bstan pa ni nyi ma'i snying po'i le'u las 'byung ba zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The four types of root downfalls are taught in the chapter on the essence of the sun.

original: de la rtsa ba'i ltung ba ni 'dir rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la rtsa ba'i ltung ba ni 'dir rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four types of root downfalls are:

original: rgyal po'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang / blon po'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang / nyan thos kyi rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' las dang po ba'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal po'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang / blon po'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang / nyan thos kyi rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' las dang po ba'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba'o //
translated: the root downfalls of a king, the root downfalls of a minister, the root downfalls of a śrāvaka, and the root downfalls of a beginner bodhisattva.

original: de la nyan thos kyi rtsa ba'i ltung ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de la nyan thos kyi rtsa ba'i ltung ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The five types of root downfalls of a śrāvaka are:

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa nas mtshams med pa'i las kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa nas mtshams med pa'i las kyi bar du'o //
translated: killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, and the five heinous actions.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: The eight types of root downfalls of a bodhisattva are:

original: yongs su ma smin pa'i gang zag la stong pa nyid brjod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma smin pa'i gang zag la stong pa nyid brjod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: teaching emptiness to those who are not ready, and so forth.

original: de la nyan thos kyi rtsa ba'i ltung ba dag ni gong ma dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyan thos kyi rtsa ba'i ltung ba dag ni gong ma dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: The root downfalls of the Disciples are related to the higher [realms].

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba dag ni 'og ma dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba dag ni 'og ma dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: The root downfalls of the Bodhisattvas are related to the lower [realms].

original: de la nyan thos kyi sa dang 'brel pa dag ni nyan thos kyi sa rnams su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la nyan thos kyi sa dang 'brel pa dag ni nyan thos kyi sa rnams su rig par bya'o //
translated: The root downfalls related to the levels of the Disciples should be understood as explained in the levels of the Disciples.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the root downfalls of the Bodhisattvas will be explained.

original: 'phags pa klu sgrub nyid kyis ni byang chub dpa' las dang po pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba ni bcu gnyis su bzhed de gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa klu sgrub nyid kyis ni byang chub dpa' las dang po pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba ni bcu gnyis su bzhed de gang zhe na /
translated: Noble Nagarjuna himself accepts twelve root downfalls for the beginner Bodhisattva.

original: 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po'i mdo las rtsa ba'i ltung ba rnam pa brgyad dang / thun mong bar gyur pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po'i mdo las rtsa ba'i ltung ba rnam pa brgyad dang / thun mong bar gyur pa bzhi'o //
translated: The noble Gaganagañja Sūtra mentions eight root downfalls and four that are common to both.

original: de la las kyi @273b sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang / mjug yongs su rdzogs pa las pham pa'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de la las kyi @273b sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang / mjug yongs su rdzogs pa las pham pa'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag go //
translated: There, a downfall is established as a root downfall by the complete performance of the deed, the basis, and the attitude.

original: la la na re 'phags pa klu sgrub nyid kyis ni sngar bstan pa brgyad dang / de'i steng du ser snas slong ba la sbyin par mi byed pa dang / chos ma yin pa chos su brjod pa dang / byang chub kyi sems yongs su spong ba ste /
analyzed: la la na re 'phags pa klu sgrub nyid kyis ni sngar bstan pa brgyad dang / de'i steng du ser snas slong ba la sbyin par mi byed pa dang / chos ma yin pa chos su brjod pa dang / byang chub kyi sems yongs su spong ba ste /
translated: Some say: The eight previously mentioned and in addition, not giving to a beggar through miserliness, describing non-dharma as dharma and completely abandoning the mind of awakening are

original: bco lnga po ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag go zhe'o //
analyzed: bco lnga po ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag go zhe'o //
translated: the fifteen root downfalls of bodhisattvas.

original: la la na re 'phags pa thogs med dang rjes su mthun par gzhag go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: la la na re 'phags pa thogs med dang rjes su mthun par gzhag go zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: They are posited in accordance with the Arya Asanga.

original: 'phags pa thogs med zhabs kyis ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa la rtsa ba'i ltung ba rnam pa brgyad du gsal bar gzhag pa na'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa thogs med zhabs kyis ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa la rtsa ba'i ltung ba rnam pa brgyad du gsal bar gzhag pa na'o //
translated: The Arya Asanga clearly posits eight root downfalls in the Bodhisattvabhumi.

original: 'dir rgyal po la sogs pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba ci'i phyir bstan /
analyzed: 'dir rgyal po la sogs pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba ci'i phyir bstan /
translated: Why are the root downfalls of kings and so on taught here?

original: gal te sdom pa dang 'brel pas so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sdom pa dang 'brel pas so zhe na /
translated: If it is said that they are related to the vows,

original: de dag las ji ltar nges kyi gzhan la ma yin /
analyzed: de dag las ji ltar nges kyi gzhan la ma yin /
translated: why are they definite from those and not from others?

original: ma yin na ni rtsa ba'i ltung bar ji ltar gzhag / nyes pa ming de 'dir ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa la dgongs pa dang / 'byung ba nye bas rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang / rgyal po la sogs pa las gzhag go //
analyzed: ma yin na ni rtsa ba'i ltung bar ji ltar gzhag / nyes pa ming de 'dir ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa la dgongs pa dang / 'byung ba nye bas rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang / rgyal po la sogs pa las gzhag go //
translated: The name “fault” here refers to the severing of the roots of virtue, and the root downfalls are so called because they are the source of that.

original: de lta bas na dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon bskyed pa thams cad chud gsan par 'gyur zhes 'byung ba dang / yang log par lta ba dang grong 'joms pa dag so sor bstan pas 'byung ba nye bar gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon bskyed pa thams cad chud gsan par 'gyur zhes 'byung ba dang / yang log par lta ba dang grong 'joms pa dag so sor bstan pas 'byung ba nye bar gsal ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the statement, “All previously generated roots of virtue are destroyed,” and the separate mention of wrong views and the destruction of a town indicate that the root downfalls are the source of that.

original: gang ltar yang zad mod sdom pa'i rtsa bar ltung bar gzhag go //
analyzed: gang ltar yang zad mod sdom pa'i rtsa bar ltung bar gzhag go //
translated: In any case, the root downfalls are posited as root downfalls because they destroy the vows.

original: ma yin te ;
analyzed: ma yin te ;
translated: They are not.

original: rtsa ba'i ltung ba dag ni sdom pa gcod par byed pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung ba dag ni sdom pa gcod par byed pa'i phyir la /
translated: The root downfalls destroy the vows.

original: 'di dag sdom pa can las na kha na ma tho ba chen por 'gyur du zin kyang /
analyzed: 'di dag sdom pa can las na kha na ma tho ba chen por 'gyur du zin kyang /
translated: Even though these are great sins for one who has vows,

original: sdom pa gcod par byed par mi 'gyur bas rtsa ba'i ltung bar gzhag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sdom pa gcod par byed par mi 'gyur bas rtsa ba'i ltung bar gzhag par mi bya'o //
translated: they do not destroy the vows, and therefore they are not posited as root downfalls.

original: ma byin par len pa dang srog gcod pa dag gis kyang ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa dang srog gcod pa dag gis kyang ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But are not stealing and killing also unwholesome?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: They are, but

original: de ni 'dod pa nyid yin yang tshul khrims 'chal pa la zhe sdang ba dang / chos spong ba dang / log par lta ba dag ji ltar gzhag par bya /
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa nyid yin yang tshul khrims 'chal pa la zhe sdang ba dang / chos spong ba dang / log par lta ba dag ji ltar gzhag par bya /
translated: how can one explain the hatred of immorality, the abandonment of the Dharma, and wrong views as unwholesome?

original: bar du gcod pa'i chos dang / mi dge ba bcu'i gnod pa zhes ming du bstan pa las na rtsa ba'i ltung ba ma yin par mngon no //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i chos dang / mi dge ba bcu'i gnod pa zhes ming du bstan pa las na rtsa ba'i ltung ba ma yin par mngon no //
translated: Since they are taught as obstacles and as the harm of the ten unwholesome actions, it is clear that they are not downfalls.

original: de lta bas na rgyal po dang blon po'i ltung ba bstan pas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyal po dang blon po'i ltung ba bstan pas na /
translated: Therefore, since the downfalls of kings and ministers are taught,

original: sdom pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: sdom pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba mtshon pa yin no //
translated: the root downfalls that are related to the vows are illustrated.

original: de dag dngos su ci'i phyir mi bstan zhe na /
analyzed: de dag dngos su ci'i phyir mi bstan zhe na /
translated: Why are they not taught explicitly?

original: so sor thar pa dang / nam mkha'i snying po'i mdo las gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor thar pa dang / nam mkha'i snying po'i mdo las gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are clear in the Pratimoksa and the Akasagarbhasutra.

original: rgyal po la sogs pa dag kyang 'dra ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rgyal po la sogs pa dag kyang 'dra ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But are not kings, etc., also uncertain?

original: de ni the tshom za ba srid pas mdo @274a * //
analyzed: de ni the tshom za ba srid pas mdo @274a * //
translated: Since it is possible to doubt them, they are taught in the sutras.

original: mang po nges don du byas pa'i phyir dang / khyim pa sgrub pa yin pas de dag phyogs gcig tu bstan pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: mang po nges don du byas pa'i phyir dang / khyim pa sgrub pa yin pas de dag phyogs gcig tu bstan pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: because many are taken as having definitive meaning, and because they are taught as one part, since they are the practice of the householder.

original: sdom pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i yang de dang 'dra ba kho na yin pas bstan par rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: sdom pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i yang de dang 'dra ba kho na yin pas bstan par rigs so zhe na /
translated: And it is proper to teach them, since they are related to the vow.

original: de ni gong du sems bskyed pa bstan pas de'i mi mthun pa'i chos spang bar go ba'i phyir dang / sdom pa 'jig pa'i rgyur gsungs pa la the tshom za ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gong du sems bskyed pa bstan pas de'i mi mthun pa'i chos spang bar go ba'i phyir dang / sdom pa 'jig pa'i rgyur gsungs pa la the tshom za ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not so, because the generation of the Thought is taught above, and because it is understood that one should abandon the discordances with it, and because it is impossible to doubt what is said to be the cause of the destruction of the vow.

original: de lta bas na dang po nyi ma'i snying po'i mdo las 'byung ba'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na dang po nyi ma'i snying po'i mdo las 'byung ba'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the root downfalls that occur in the Sutra of the Golden Light are taught first.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na zhes gsungs te /
translated: The text says, In the future time...

original: re zhig gang dang 'brel zhe na /
analyzed: re zhig gang dang 'brel zhe na /
translated: With what is it related?

original: rgyal rigs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal rigs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: With the warrior-noble, etc.

original: gang gi dang 'brel zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi dang 'brel zhe na /
translated: With what is it related?

original: chos kyi gnas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

translated: If one does not do this, etc.

original: la la ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul las nyams pa'i 'bras bu gnyis pa mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu mtshon pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: la la ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul las nyams pa'i 'bras bu gnyis pa mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu mtshon pa'i phyir te /
translated: For some, the second result of falling away from the method explained above is shown to be the result in this very life.

original: lhag ma ni zhar las byung zhes kyang zer ro //
analyzed: lhag ma ni zhar las byung zhes kyang zer ro //
translated: The rest is said to be incidental.

original: da ni sa'i snying po'i mdo las yul gyi khyad par las byung ba'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni sa'i snying po'i mdo las yul gyi khyad par las byung ba'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the root downfalls arising from the distinctions of place should be stated in the Kṣitigarbha Sūtra.

original: re zhig ltung ba bskyed pa'i 'thad pa ni /
analyzed: re zhig ltung ba bskyed pa'i 'thad pa ni /
translated: First, the justification for generating the downfalls is as follows.

original: sngon 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sngon 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The phrase in the past and so on.

original: srin po sha za dang dud 'gro'i gti mug pas kyang gus par bkur ba'i phyir yul khyad par can du gyur pa mngon no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: srin po sha za dang dud 'gro'i gti mug pas kyang gus par bkur ba'i phyir yul khyad par can du gyur pa mngon no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is evident that it is a special place, because even the rakshasas, flesh-eaters, and animals revere it with devotion. This is the meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'dzin ce na 'khor nges par bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'dzin ce na 'khor nges par bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why does the Lord hold the inference? Because it generates certainty in the retinue.

original: de lta yin yang rmongs pa 'ga' zhig ni de lta mi shes so zhes smad pa ni /
analyzed: de lta yin yang rmongs pa 'ga' zhig ni de lta mi shes so zhes smad pa ni /
translated: Even though that is so, some deluded ones do not know that, so he criticizes.

original: yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase in the future time and so on.

original: ltung bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: ltung bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of falling is

original: rkyen sna tshogs la tha snyad btags zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rkyen sna tshogs la tha snyad btags zhes bya ba ste /
translated: designating various conditions.

original: ltung ba'i 'bras bu ni rab tu nyes par gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: ltung ba'i 'bras bu ni rab tu nyes par gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no ;
translated: The result of falling is stated by becoming very bad and so on.

original: / dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba zhig pa'o //
analyzed: / dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba zhig pa'o //
translated: The phrase severing the roots of virtue means destroying the roots of virtue such as generosity.

original: sems kyi rgyud sreg pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud sreg pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase the continuum of his mind is burned means

original: dkar po'i chos rgyud la mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i chos rgyud la mi skye ba'o //
translated: that the continuum of his virtuous qualities will not grow.

original: mkhas pa spangs pa ni dam pas yongs su bor ba'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa spangs pa ni dam pas yongs su bor ba'o //
translated: The phrase he is rejected by the wise means that he is abandoned by the holy.

original: lus la chad pas bcad pa 'ba' zhig gis ltung bar 'gyur bar ma zad kyi longs spyod dang phral bas kyang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus la chad pas bcad pa 'ba' zhig gis ltung bar 'gyur bar ma zad kyi longs spyod dang phral bas kyang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase he is ruined means that he is ruined not only by the punishment inflicted on his body, but also by the loss of his possessions.

original: de ltar rtsa ba'i ltung ba'i mtshan nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rtsa ba'i ltung ba'i mtshan nyid bstan nas /
translated: Having thus explained the characteristics of the fundamental transgression,

original: 'o na dbang phyug gi gnas gang la gnang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dbang phyug gi gnas gang la gnang zhe na /
translated: in what state of sovereignty is it permitted?

original: bzod pa thob pa'i gang zag ces gsungs so //
analyzed: bzod pa thob pa'i gang zag ces gsungs so //
translated: The text states, with regard to a person who has attained tolerance.

original: de la mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa na bzod pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: de la mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa na bzod pa thob pa'o //
translated: The phrase with regard to a person who has attained tolerance means that it is permitted for one who is established in the stage of action in faith and has attained tolerance.

original: 'o na mos pa spyod pa ma yin pa'i gang zag de dag ni ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes thal ba brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'o na mos pa spyod pa ma yin pa'i gang zag de dag ni ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes thal ba brjod pa ni /
translated: But if it is not permitted for a person who is not in the stage of action in faith, then the consequence is that he would commit a transgression. The text states, if he requests.

original: gsol ba zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gsol ba zhes gsungs te /
translated: The phrase if he requests means that it is permitted if he requests it.🔽The phrase how could he not go? means

original: ji ltar ba na song du mi 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar ba na song du mi 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: that it is not permitted if he does not go.

original: 'gro bar thal ba kho na'o zhes skyon brjod pa'o //🔽ma yin te gal te bzod pa ma thob pa'i sdig pa la spyod pa dag ni /
analyzed: 'gro bar thal ba kho na'o zhes skyon brjod pa'o // ma yin te gal te bzod pa ma thob pa'i sdig pa la spyod pa dag ni /
translated: The consequence is that they are going to the lower realms.
This is not so, because those who practice evil when they have not attained acceptance

original: ltar 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ltar 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: want it that way.

original: lhag ma ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: lhag ma ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: The rest of the passage is a statement of reasons that are not established.

original: gal te bzod pa ma thob kyang chos kyi rjes su 'jug ba dag ni ngan song du 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni gang bzod pa ma thob kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te bzod pa ma thob kyang chos kyi rjes su 'jug ba dag ni ngan song du 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni gang bzod pa ma thob kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even though they have not attained acceptance, those who follow the Dharma do not go to the lower realms.

original: de lta bas na bzod pa ma thob kyang chos bzhin du'ang mi byed pa la ni ;
analyzed: de lta bas na bzod pa ma thob kyang chos bzhin du'ang mi byed pa la ni ;
translated: Therefore, even though they have not attained acceptance, those who do not act in accordance with the Dharma

original: dbang phyug gi gnas gnang ba ma yin la /
analyzed: dbang phyug gi gnas gnang ba ma yin la /
translated: are not permitted to live in the realm of the powerful.

original: de la spyod pas na kha na ma tho ba'i las rtsa ba'i ltung ba 'byung bas na bstan pa zab mo 'di 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: de la spyod pas na kha na ma tho ba'i las rtsa ba'i ltung ba 'byung bas na bstan pa zab mo 'di 'jig pa ste /
translated: Since they practice that, they commit the root downfall of an offensive action, and so they destroy this profound teaching.

original: bcas pa las dral bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bcas pa las dral bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They are expelled from the precepts.

original: gzhan dag ni gal te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gal te /
translated: Others say:

original: rgyal po gdol par gyur na de'i rjes su gzhan 'jug pas /
analyzed: rgyal po gdol par gyur na de'i rjes su gzhan 'jug pas /
translated: If the king becomes a caṇḍāla, others will follow his example.

original: tshul khrims btang ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims btang ste /
translated: Having abandoned morality,🔽they will cause the Sutra of the Ten Wheels of Kṣitigarbha to disappear, and by following that, they will go to the lower realms.

original: sa'i snying po 'khor lo bcu pa'i mdo nub par byed cing de'i rjes su 'jug pas ngan song du 'gro'o zhes mdo nyid tshad mar bya'o zhes kyang 'dod do //
analyzed: sa'i snying po 'khor lo bcu pa'i mdo nub par byed cing de'i rjes su 'jug pas ngan song du 'gro'o zhes mdo nyid tshad mar bya'o zhes kyang 'dod do //
translated: The sutra itself should be taken as authoritative.

original: ji ltar thar bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni thar bar mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar thar bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni thar bar mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “How will they be liberated?” means that they will not be liberated at all.

original: de ltar gnang ba dang ma gnang ba'i gang zag gi rab tu dbye ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar gnang ba dang ma gnang ba'i gang zag gi rab tu dbye ba bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the classification of persons who are permitted and not permitted,

original: da ni gnang ba'i gang zag gis rjes su sgrub pa'i thabs bstan pa ni /
analyzed: da ni gnang ba'i gang zag gis rjes su sgrub pa'i thabs bstan pa ni /
translated: now, the method of practice by the person who is permitted is taught,

original: gang dad pa'i stobs kyi go cha bgos te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang dad pa'i stobs kyi go cha bgos te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: beginning with “who has donned the armor of the power of faith.🔽”

original: sngar rtsa ba'i ltung ba'i nyes pa bstan pa de nyid las bzlog pa'i chos dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: sngar rtsa ba'i ltung ba'i nyes pa bstan pa de nyid las bzlog pa'i chos dang ldan pa ni /
translated: Having the qualities that are the opposite of the faults of the root downfalls that were previously taught,

original: de'i gnyen pos te /
analyzed: de'i gnyen pos te /
translated: through their antidotes,

original: log par sgrub pa spong ba yin pas na /🔽rjes su sgrub pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: log par sgrub pa spong ba yin pas na / rjes su sgrub pa'i tshul lo //
translated: they abandon wrong practice.🔽Therefore, it is the method of practice.

original: de la dad pa ni yid ches pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la dad pa ni yid ches pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Faith is confidence and so forth.

original: de nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi brdzi bas na stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi brdzi bas na stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is not overcome by adverse factors, it is called “strength.”

original: go cha ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: go cha ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: Armor is effort.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: rgyal po'i ltung ba'i rtsa ba dang po'i gnyen po ni /
analyzed: rgyal po'i ltung ba'i rtsa ba dang po'i gnyen po ni /
translated: The antidote to the first root downfall of a king is:

original: dkon mchog gsum la dad pa mang zhing zhes bya ba ste 'dir dad pa mang zhing gsum bsgom mo //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la dad pa mang zhing zhes bya ba ste 'dir dad pa mang zhing gsum bsgom mo //
translated: “Having much faith in the Three Jewels,” and here one cultivates much faith in the Three Jewels.

original: rtsa ba'i ltung ba gnyis pa dam pa'i chos spong ba'i gnyen po ni /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung ba gnyis pa dam pa'i chos spong ba'i gnyen po ni /
translated: The antidote to the second root downfall of abandoning the sublime Dharma is:

original: theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung ba'i chos mi spong la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung ba'i chos mi spong la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Not abandoning the Dharma that is the definite emergence of the three vehicles,” and so on.🔽The antidote to the third root downfall of relying on ascetics is:

original: gsum pa dge sbyong la brten pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba'i gnyen po ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang tshul khrims 'chal pa la yang rnam par mi 'tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa dge sbyong la brten pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba'i gnyen po ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang tshul khrims 'chal pa la yang rnam par mi 'tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Not harming those with ethical conduct or those with broken ethical conduct,” and so on.

original: mtshams med pa la ste /
analyzed: mtshams med pa la ste /
translated: It is in regard to the heinous acts.

original: rtsa ba'i ltung ba'i gnyen po ni /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung ba'i gnyen po ni /
translated: The antidote to the root downfalls is:

original: dge 'dun dang mchod rten gyi rdzas mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun dang mchod rten gyi rdzas mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: One does not steal the property of the Saṅgha or stūpas.

original: longs spyod 'phrog pa ni mtshams med pa dang nye ba yin la /
analyzed: longs spyod 'phrog pa ni mtshams med pa dang nye ba yin la /
translated: Stealing is similar to the heinous acts.

original: de spong bas mtshams med @276b pa ga la zhig byed ces gnyen por bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de spong bas mtshams med @276b pa ga la zhig byed ces gnyen por bstan pa yin no //
translated: The Buddha taught this as an antidote to stealing, since one who does not steal will not commit a heinous act.

original: bzlog pa ni gzhan yang de ltar na rjes su 'dzin pas na rang nyid ga la zhig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni gzhan yang de ltar na rjes su 'dzin pas na rang nyid ga la zhig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The opposite of stealing is generosity, which is the antidote to stealing.

original: log par lta ba'i gnyen po ni /
analyzed: log par lta ba'i gnyen po ni /
translated: The antidote to wrong view is

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba yin te /
translated: right view.🔽Therefore, the first cause of the arising of right view is

original: de'i phyir dang po yang dag pa'i lta ba skye ba'i rgyu skyes bu dam pa la brten pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir dang po yang dag pa'i lta ba skye ba'i rgyu skyes bu dam pa la brten pa ni /
translated: to rely on holy persons,

original: theg pa gsum la nan tan byed pa'i dge slong rnams la brten pa dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum la nan tan byed pa'i dge slong rnams la brten pa dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa'o //
translated: to rely on and serve monks who are diligent in the three vehicles.🔽The second cause is

original: gnyis pa dam pa'i chos nyan pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa dam pa'i chos nyan pa ni /
translated: to listen to the holy Dharma,

original: theg pa gsum gyi nges par 'byung ba'i chos kyi gtam nyan ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi nges par 'byung ba'i chos kyi gtam nyan ces bya ba'o //
translated: to listen to the Dharma teachings of the three vehicles that lead to liberation.

original: gsum pa tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: gsum pa tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa ni /
translated: The third, proper mental attention, is🔽the practice of what one has heard to the best of one's ability, firmness in one's vows, and the engagement of beings in the Great Vehicle.

original: ji ltar thos pa nyams kyis ci nus su sgrub pa dang / yi dam la brtan pa dang / sems can rnams theg pa chen po la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / de la yi dam ni rang gi dam bcas pa sngar bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: ji ltar thos pa nyams kyis ci nus su sgrub pa dang / yi dam la brtan pa dang / sems can rnams theg pa chen po la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / de la yi dam ni rang gi dam bcas pa sngar bstan pa rnams so //
translated: Firmness in one's vows is the previously mentioned own vow.

original: gzhan de dag 'god pa ni 'khor mang po kha na ma tho ba dag la sbyor ba'i gnyen po bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan de dag 'god pa ni 'khor mang po kha na ma tho ba dag la sbyor ba'i gnyen po bstan pa yin te /
translated: The engagement of others is the teaching of the antidote to the application to the many faults of the assembly.

original: sngar ji skad du /
analyzed: sngar ji skad du /
translated: As it was previously stated:

original: sems can mang po dag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can mang po dag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He engages many beings in the path of the ten virtues.

original: de lta bas na /🔽skyes bu dam pa brten pa la sogs pa dag ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na / skyes bu dam pa brten pa la sogs pa dag ni /
translated: Therefore,

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba skye ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba skye ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: the reliance on holy men and so forth are the causes for the arising of right view.

original: de skyes na log par lta ba spong bas na 'di ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba lnga po'i gnyen por bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de skyes na log par lta ba spong bas na 'di ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba lnga po'i gnyen por bzhag pa yin no //
translated: When that arises, wrong view is abandoned. Thus, this is set forth as the antidote to the five root downfalls.

original: grong 'joms pa la sogs pa'i gnyen po ni mi slu ba'i sems dang ldan pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: grong 'joms pa la sogs pa'i gnyen po ni mi slu ba'i sems dang ldan pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: The antidote to the destruction of villages, etc. is stated to be the possession of an undeceiving mind.

original: grong la sogs pa 'joms pa ni g-yo'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grong la sogs pa 'joms pa ni g-yo'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the destruction of villages, etc. is the application of deceit.

original: de'i phan yon bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phan yon bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of its benefit is

original: log par ltung bar mi 'gyur bar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: log par ltung bar mi 'gyur bar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: that one does not fall into error.

original: de bzhin du rjes su sgrub pa'i phan yon bstan pa ni ;
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su sgrub pa'i phan yon bstan pa ni ;
translated: Similarly, the teaching of the benefit of subsequent establishment is

original: yang dag nyid las 'byung ba zhes smos te /
analyzed: yang dag nyid las 'byung ba zhes smos te /
translated: that one emerges from reality.

original: dge ba ni sngar bshad pa'i chos rnams dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba ni sngar bshad pa'i chos rnams dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The virtuous one is endowed with the qualities explained above.

original: lnga brgya tham zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lnga brgya tham zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The five hundred is

original: phrag bcu'i tha ma rtags tsam 'dzin pa'i dus so //
analyzed: phrag bcu'i tha ma rtags tsam 'dzin pa'i dus so //
translated: the time of mere token observance, the end of ten decadal periods.

original: bdag bsrung ba ni sngar bshad pa'i nyams pa las rjes su sgrub pa'i tshul du byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag bsrung ba ni sngar bshad pa'i nyams pa las rjes su sgrub pa'i tshul du byed pa'o //
translated: Self-protection is the performance of the method of subsequent establishment from the degeneration explained above.

original: gzhan bsrung ba ni de ltar rjes su sgrub pas yul 'khor du bya ba thams cad byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan bsrung ba ni de ltar rjes su sgrub pas yul 'khor du bya ba thams cad byed pa ste /
translated: Other-protection is the performance of all actions in the realm and the country by that subsequent establishment.

original: nyes pa las bzlog pa'i phan yon 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa las bzlog pa'i phan yon 'byung ba'o //
translated: The benefit of turning away from faults arises.

original: 'jig rten pha rol bsrung ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol bsrung ba ni /
translated: Protection of the next world is

original: lha dang mi'i skye ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi'i skye ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: birth as a god or human, and so on.

original: bstan pa bsrung ba ni dbang phyug gi stobs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa bsrung ba ni dbang phyug gi stobs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Protection of the teaching is the power of the lord, and so on.

original: yon tan ni thos pa la sogs pa'o //🔽snod ni tshul @277a * //
analyzed: yon tan ni thos pa la sogs pa'o // snod ni tshul @277a * //
translated: Virtues are learning and so on.

original: khrims rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: khrims rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: A vessel is pure morality.

original: srung bar byed pa ni 'tshe ba la sogs pa las bzlog pa'o //🔽mi spyod pa ni 'phrog pa dang spyod pa las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: srung bar byed pa ni 'tshe ba la sogs pa las bzlog pa'o // mi spyod pa ni 'phrog pa dang spyod pa las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Protection is the prevention of harm and so on.🔽Non-enjoyment is the prevention of theft and enjoyment.

original: spyod du mi 'jug pa ni 'phrog tu 'jug pa dang / spyod du 'jug pa las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: spyod du mi 'jug pa ni 'phrog tu 'jug pa dang / spyod du 'jug pa las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Non-engagement is the prevention of engagement in theft and enjoyment.

original: de'i phan yon bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phan yon bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of its benefits is

original: bsod nams kyi phung po zhes smos te /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi phung po zhes smos te /
translated: stated in the line, “an immeasurable mass of merit.”

original: ma mthong ba'i phan yon gyi dbang du byas nas bsod nams kyi phung po tshad med ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i phan yon gyi dbang du byas nas bsod nams kyi phung po tshad med ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: From the perspective of unseen benefits, the line, “an immeasurable mass of merit,” and so on, is stated.

original: tshad med pa ni tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad med pa ni tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Immeasurable means immeasurable.

original: grangs med pa ni bgrang bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs med pa ni bgrang bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Incalculable means unable to be counted.

original: dpag tu med pa ni shes pas mi dpogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa ni shes pas mi dpogs pa'o //
translated: Incalculable means not to be measured by the intellect.

original: mthong ba'i phan yon ni /
analyzed: mthong ba'i phan yon ni /
translated: The benefits of seeing are

original: tshe bsrid  pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshe bsrid  pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: the extension of life, and so forth.

original: bcu tshan dang pos ni bde ba'i rkyen sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: bcu tshan dang pos ni bde ba'i rkyen sgrub pa'o //
translated: The first group of ten establishes the conditions for happiness.

original: gnyis pas ni mi bde ba'i rkyen spong ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni mi bde ba'i rkyen spong ba'o //
translated: The second group of ten eliminates the conditions for unhappiness.

original: longs spyod dang bral bar byed pa'i ltung ba las bzlog pas na yongs su skyong ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: longs spyod dang bral bar byed pa'i ltung ba las bzlog pas na yongs su skyong ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: Since it turns back the downfall that causes one to be deprived of resources, it is called thorough protection.

original: la la ni thams cad kyi don bsdus pa yin no zhes kyang zer ro //🔽gtong ba po ni rkyen sgrub pa'i ming ngo ;
analyzed: la la ni thams cad kyi don bsdus pa yin no zhes kyang zer ro // gtong ba po ni rkyen sgrub pa'i ming ngo ;
translated: Some say that it is a summary of the meaning of all the perfections.🔽The giver is the one who establishes the conditions.

original: / sbyin bdag ni rgyu sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: / sbyin bdag ni rgyu sbyor ba'o //
translated: The donor is the one who provides the cause.

original: der ma zad pas na lha dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: der ma zad pas na lha dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Since it is not limited to that, it says gods, and so forth.

original: bstan pa 'dzin pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bstan pa 'dzin pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The upholder of the teaching is as before.

original: des ni chos kyi bar chad byed pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: des ni chos kyi bar chad byed pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: That is the antidote to obstacles to the Dharma.

original: chos kyi tshul yun ring du gnas par byed pa ni /
analyzed: chos kyi tshul yun ring du gnas par byed pa ni /
translated: The one who makes the way of the Dharma last a long time is as follows.

original: chos smra ba la brten pa la sogs pas chos 'grel cing bshad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos smra ba la brten pa la sogs pas chos 'grel cing bshad par byed pa'o //
translated: The Dharma is explained and expounded by means of the Dharma teacher, etc.

original: des ni chos smra ba la gnod par byed pa'i gnyen po yang yin no //
analyzed: des ni chos smra ba la gnod par byed pa'i gnyen po yang yin no //
translated: This also is the antidote to the harm of the Dharma teacher.

original: rigs rgyun mi gcod pa ni /
analyzed: rigs rgyun mi gcod pa ni /
translated: The lineage is not cut off

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: because of the application to the generation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: ngag las skyes pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'i 'bras bu thob pa ste /
analyzed: ngag las skyes pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'i 'bras bu thob pa ste /
translated: The one born from speech is the one who has attained the result of the Śrāvaka Vehicle,

original: bden pa bzhi'i chos bshad pas 'bras bu rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi'i chos bshad pas 'bras bu rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has obtained the result through the explanation of the Dharma of the four noble truths.

original: chos las skyes pa ni /
analyzed: chos las skyes pa ni /
translated: The one born from the Dharma is

original: rang rgyal ba'i theg pas 'bras bu thob pa ste /
analyzed: rang rgyal ba'i theg pas 'bras bu thob pa ste /
translated: the one who has attained the result of the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtogs pa las 'bras bu rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtogs pa las 'bras bu rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has obtained the result through the realization of dependent origination.

original: chos kyi sprul pa ni theg pa chen pos 'bras bu thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sprul pa ni theg pa chen pos 'bras bu thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ste /
translated: The emanation of the Dharma is the bodhisattva who has attained the result of the Great Vehicle,

original: 'bras bu thob kyang mngon du mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob kyang mngon du mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has attained the result but does not actualize it.

original: gzhan dad pa ni skyabs su 'gro ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dad pa ni skyabs su 'gro ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Faith in others is having gone for refuge.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni /
translated: The ultimate truth is

original: stong pa nyid bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bsgom pa'o //
translated: The remedy for the common downfall of neglecting the training in concentration is to meditate on emptiness.

original: 'o na nyan thos la sogs pa dag kyang yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na nyan thos la sogs pa dag kyang yin no zhe na /
translated: But the Sravakas and so forth also have that, you say.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i zhes gsungs te /
translated: The Buddha said, “The perfect and complete Buddha.”

original: theg pa mchog 'dod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa mchog 'dod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Buddha is the supreme vehicle.

original: de'i phan yon ni /
analyzed: de'i phan yon ni /
translated: The benefits of the training are as follows.

original: lag tu gtad do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: lag tu gtad do zhes gsungs te /
translated: The Buddha said, “It is placed in your hands.”

original: mi ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mi ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: You will not turn back.

original: de ltar na yul @277b gyi khyad par las gyur pa ltung ba thun mong ba'i gnyen po bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yul @277b gyi khyad par las gyur pa ltung ba thun mong ba'i gnyen po bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the remedy for the common downfall of neglecting the training in concentration is taught in terms of the difference in the object.

original: thun mong ba dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid gang zhe na /🔽rgyal po dang blon po'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba dag ni /
analyzed: thun mong ba dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid gang zhe na / rgyal po dang blon po'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba dag ni /
translated: What is the difference between the common and uncommon downfalls?

original: khyim par gyur pa gzhan dang thun mong ma yin la /🔽yul gyi khyad par dge sbyong la brten pa dag ni /
analyzed: khyim par gyur pa gzhan dang thun mong ma yin la / yul gyi khyad par dge sbyong la brten pa dag ni /
translated: The root downfalls of the king and minister are not common to other lay people.🔽The downfalls that are based on the difference in the object of the ascetic are also the downfalls of the king and so forth.

original: rgyal po la sogs pa'i yang yin pas thun mong bar gzhag go //
analyzed: rgyal po la sogs pa'i yang yin pas thun mong bar gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, they are posited as common.

original: de ltar na mi mthun pa dang gnyen po ji skad bstan pa dag ni phal cher sdom pa dang ma 'brel par lta'o //
analyzed: de ltar na mi mthun pa dang gnyen po ji skad bstan pa dag ni phal cher sdom pa dang ma 'brel par lta'o //
translated: Thus, the unfavorable and the remedies have been taught for the most part without reference to the vows.

original: mdo kun las btus pa'i bshad pa lung gi tshad mas sbyar ba las dbang phyug gi gnas rnyed pa rnams kyi bsgrub pa bstan zin to /
analyzed: mdo kun las btus pa'i bshad pa lung gi tshad mas sbyar ba las dbang phyug gi gnas rnyed pa rnams kyi bsgrub pa bstan zin to /
translated: In the Proof of Logic, the chapter on the “Examination of Inference for Oneself” is finished.

original: // / de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs bar du gcod pa spang ba'i thabs bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs bar du gcod pa spang ba'i thabs bstan par bya ste /
translated: The method of abandoning the unfavorable, the obstructions, will now be taught.

original: de'i phyir chos sgrub pa la gnas par 'dod pas sems la mkhas par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos sgrub pa la gnas par 'dod pas sems la mkhas par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “One who wishes to abide in the practice of the Dharma should be skilled in the mind.”

original: chos ni ji ltar bshad pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: chos ni ji ltar bshad pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The Dharma is morality as it has been explained.

original: bsgrub pa ni mi nyams par bya bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa ni mi nyams par bya bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: Practice is the desire not to let it deteriorate.

original: sems ni dran pa dang shes bzhin dang / bag yod pa'o ;
analyzed: sems ni dran pa dang shes bzhin dang / bag yod pa'o ;
translated: The mind is mindfulness, vigilance, and carefulness.

original: / mkhas pa ni 'og nas ci zhes dpyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: / mkhas pa ni 'og nas ci zhes dpyod par byed pa'o //
translated: Skill is what is being analyzed below.

original: de dag 'das pa'i dus su kha na ma tho bas nyams par byas pa ni stobs bzhis dag par bya ba dang / da ltar gyi nyes pa ni thun tshod las ma 'das pas /
analyzed: de dag 'das pa'i dus su kha na ma tho bas nyams par byas pa ni stobs bzhis dag par bya ba dang / da ltar gyi nyes pa ni thun tshod las ma 'das pas /
translated: Those who have been damaged by past transgressions should purify themselves by the four powers.🔽Those who have present faults should confess them as appropriate before a day has passed.

original: ji ltar rigs par bshad par bya ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i nyes pas gos par dogs pas ni dran pa la sogs pa goms par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par bshad par bya ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i nyes pas gos par dogs pas ni dran pa la sogs pa goms par bya ba yin no //
translated: Those who fear being defiled by future faults should cultivate mindfulness and so on.

original: tshul khrims ni lus la sogs pa gsum gyis bsrung bar bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni lus la sogs pa gsum gyis bsrung bar bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t morality to be guarded by the three, body and so on?

original: ji ltar na sems kho na la mkhas par byed pa zhes rgol ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems kho na la mkhas par byed pa zhes rgol ba ni /
translated: How can it be said that one should be skilled in mind alone?

original: ji ltar ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “How?” means “in what way?”

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes smos pas ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes smos pas ni /
translated: The mention of “bodhisattva”

original: sems bskyed pa mi nyams par bsrung bar bstan to //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa mi nyams par bsrung bar bstan to //
translated: teaches the protection of the generation of the spirit of enlightenment from degeneration.

original: de'i phyir lus dang sems rab tu dben pas zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus dang sems rab tu dben pas zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “by the isolation of body and mind,”

original: sems nyid gtso bo yin par bstan te /
analyzed: sems nyid gtso bo yin par bstan te /
translated: teaching that mind is the principal factor.

original: gzhan dun dran pa la sogs pa med na /
analyzed: gzhan dun dran pa la sogs pa med na /
translated: If one lacks mindfulness and so on,

original: lus la sogs pa nyes pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa nyes pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the body, etc. would be engaged in faults.

original: lus la sogs pa la dben par ma gyur na yang dran pa 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa la dben par ma gyur na yang dran pa 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And if the body, etc. are not isolated, mindfulness does not enter.

original: de'i phyir lus dang zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus dang zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “in the body, etc.”

original: de la lus dben pa ni /
analyzed: de la lus dben pa ni /
translated: Therein, the isolation of the body is

original: 'du 'dzi la sogs pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi la sogs pa spangs pa'o //
translated: the avoidance of crowds, etc.

original: 'du 'dzi nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'du 'dzi nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is a crowd?

original: la la ni skye bo'i tshogs la bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: la la ni skye bo'i tshogs la bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that it is a group of people.

original: la la na re tshe 'di'i rtogs pa dang ldan pa ni gcig kho na yang 'du 'dzi'i gnas yin no zhes zer ro //🔽sems rab @278a * //
analyzed: la la na re tshe 'di'i rtogs pa dang ldan pa ni gcig kho na yang 'du 'dzi'i gnas yin no zhes zer ro // sems rab @278a * //
translated: Others say that even a single person can be a crowd if he is a knower of this life.

original: tu dben pa ni /
analyzed: tu dben pa ni /
translated: The isolation of the mind is

original: 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa spangs pa'o //
translated: the avoidance of thoughts of desire, etc.

original: de la  dran pa yongs su srung ba ni /
analyzed: de la  dran pa yongs su srung ba ni /
translated: Therein, the protection of mindfulness is

original: ci bdag gis sems 'di dge ba la spyod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ci bdag gis sems 'di dge ba la spyod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Is this mind of mine engaged in virtue?”

original: shes bzhin gyi srung ba ni /
analyzed: shes bzhin gyi srung ba ni /
translated: The protection of vigilance is

original: dga' ba dang rangs pa dang / mos pa bskyed do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dga' ba dang rangs pa dang / mos pa bskyed do zhes gsungs te /
translated: “I will generate joy, delight, and confidence.”

original: dga' ba ni thog mar sems bde ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni thog mar sems bde ba'o //
translated: Joy is the initial mental pleasure.

original: rangs pa ni bar du mgu ba'o //
analyzed: rangs pa ni bar du mgu ba'o //
translated: Delight is the intermediate satisfaction.

original: mos pa ni tha mar 'gyod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa ni tha mar 'gyod pa med pa'o //
translated: Interest is the final absence of regret.

original: bag yod pa ni skyo ba dang rtog pa mang ba ste /
analyzed: bag yod pa ni skyo ba dang rtog pa mang ba ste /
translated: Carefulness is the cultivation of disgust and frequent reflection.

original: skyo ba mang ba ni mi mthun pa spong ba'o //
analyzed: skyo ba mang ba ni mi mthun pa spong ba'o //
translated: Frequent disgust is the abandonment of what is incompatible.

original: rtog pa ni gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa ni gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
translated: Reflection is the cultivation of the counteragent.

original: de lta bas na dang po dran pas rang gi sems gang la spyod ces mi brjed par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na dang po dran pas rang gi sems gang la spyod ces mi brjed par byed do //
translated: Thus, first, through mindfulness, one does not forget to examine where one’s mind is operating.

original: shes bzhin gyis dge ba la spyod cing rjes su mi 'gyod pa la sogs pa byed do //
analyzed: shes bzhin gyis dge ba la spyod cing rjes su mi 'gyod pa la sogs pa byed do //
translated: Through vigilance, one acts virtuously and without regret, etc.

original: bag yod pas dge ba goms shing sdig pa spong bar byed do //
analyzed: bag yod pas dge ba goms shing sdig pa spong bar byed do //
translated: Through carefulness, one cultivates the virtuous and abandons the sinful.

original: de lta bu'i tshul khrims de gang gi don du zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul khrims de gang gi don du zhe na /
translated: For whose sake is such morality?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don du yin pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don du yin pas /
translated: For the sake of omniscience.

original: ma skyes dgra'i mdo las kyang zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: ma skyes dgra'i mdo las kyang zhes gsungs pa /
translated: As the Ajataśatrukaukṛtyavinodana Sūtra says,

original: 'dun pas 'gro ba dang / zhe sdang gis 'gro ba dang / 'jigs pas 'gro ba dang / gti mug gis 'gro ba dag ni bdud kyi spyod yul yin pas glags rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pas 'gro ba dang / zhe sdang gis 'gro ba dang / 'jigs pas 'gro ba dang / gti mug gis 'gro ba dag ni bdud kyi spyod yul yin pas glags rnyed pa'o //
translated: Those who go with desire, who go with hatred, who go with fear, and who go with confusion are in the domain of Mara and are thus vulnerable.

original: snying rje dang byang chub kyi sems dang mi ldan pa ni /
analyzed: snying rje dang byang chub kyi sems dang mi ldan pa ni /
translated: Those who are not endowed with compassion and the spirit of enlightenment

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi mnyes pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi mnyes pa ste /
translated: do not please the Tathagatas.🔽If one is without compassion, one will abandon sentient beings.

original: snying rje med na sems can yongs su gtong par 'gyur bas na de'i phyir /
analyzed: snying rje med na sems can yongs su gtong par 'gyur bas na de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: gang gis sems can dag la yid kyis gnod byed kyang //🔽nga la ji ltar brten te de ni ltos dang bral //
analyzed: gang gis sems can dag la yid kyis gnod byed kyang // nga la ji ltar brten te de ni ltos dang bral //
translated: Even if they mentally harm sentient beings,

original: zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: they are not dependent on me, and so are free from dependence.
